loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 39 years old and married to Ben. They are blessed with four children, aged 15 to 8 years. Jane runs a retail shop in Chepterit trading centre and is served by KADET Ltd Kapsabet office. This has been her income-generating business for the last two years. She gets an average monthly income of KES 50,000.

She has borrowed a second loan of KES 60,000 to purchase more items as stock to her business in order to meet her customers’ needs. Some of the items are sugar, tea leaves, baking powder, cooking oil and fats, rice, and dry cells, among other items.

She anticipates getting profits which she will use to repay back the loan and pay school fees for her children.

Her dream and hope are to open a grain store and be able to get an income that can sustain her family’s financial needs.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her retail shop.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 55 years old, married and supports her family of five. She runs a retail shop in Chepterit Trading Centre and is served by Kadet Ltd's Kapsabet branch. This has been her income-generating business for the last seven years. She earns an average monthly income of KSHS 20,000. 

She has borrowed six loans of KSHS 73,000 to pay for her children’s school fees. She will use the profits from the retail shop business to repay the loan. Her dream is to expand her business and give the best education to her children.

loans.use: To pay school fees

loans.name: Jetty

texts.en:
Jetty is a loving mother and happily married to a hard working and kind husband. Jetty manages their farm while her husband works to take care of their day-to-day expenses. Jetty grows rice on their farm. Her husband also helps her when he has time and a free day. Her husband also shares her strategies and ideas to assure that they will get higher yield from their rice crops.

Jetty says that the only hindrances for not gaining higher yields are due to natural calamities like typhoons, when it continues raining, and when pests hit the crop. With regards to her farming business, Jetty is requesting a loan of 50,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) to buy fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides that she will apply to the crops. She expect higher yield this season as she applies the exact amount of farm inputs needed in her farm.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, herbicides and pesticides

loans.name: Ma. Dolores

texts.en:
This is Ma. Dolores, 41, resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Ramiro, a taxi driver and is a mother to her children. She together with her husband manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.

Ma. Dolores offers manicures and pedicures. She already has regular customers in her community and they just contact her when they need her. She does home service. She earns a minimum of PHP 600 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 20,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy nail polish, cuticle remover, pushers, nail cutters and other materials needed in her business.

Ma. Dolores dreams of having her own parlor and hopes to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for nail polish, cuticle remover, pushers, nail cutters and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Anelyn

texts.en:
This is Anelyn, 46, a resident of Bacoor, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Arthur, an employee, and is a mother to their children. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating the business. She and her husband are working hard to provide income for their everyday needs.

Anelyn maintains a direct selling business. She sells clothing, footwear, undergarments, cosmetics and other products through the popular direct selling brands like Avon, Fuller Life, Natasha, Boardwalk, Marikina Shoe Exchange, and other direct selling brands. A customer's order is bought in cash by the dealer and then given to the customer with a one-month-to-pay credit. The dealer’s prices are lower than those in the catalogue, and these are the profits that dealers are getting as their income. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community.  She earns a minimum of PHP 2000 in sales every week.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a PHP 25,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy additional supplies and merchandise products like clothing, footwear, shampoo, cologne, deodorant, perfume, soap, fabric softener, undergarments, cosmetics, and other products needed in her business.

Anelyn hopes to expand her business and dreams to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To buy products like clothing, footwear, undergarments and cosmetics

loans.name: Banco Mujer Emprendedoras De Chilamate Group

texts.es: Iris tiene 52 años de edad, vive en la comunidad de San Pedro de Poas, lugar ubicado en las faldas del Volcán que lleva el mismo nombre. Vive con su esposo y un hijo menor de edad que esta en la escuela, tiene dos hijos mayores que estudian y trabajan para colaborar con  los gastos de la casa. Ella vende artículos de catalogo y con la ganancia de esta actividad se compro unas gallinas ponedoras. Vende en la comunidad tanto huevos como artículos por medio de catalogo. Ella se levanta muy temprano, le alista la ropa y la comida a sus hijos y esposo, cuando se han ido, inicia las labores de recolección de huevos, después hace el almuerzo y en la tarde sale a vender por medio de catalogo. Ante el éxito obtenido, desea invertir el dinero de este crédito en comprar mas gallinas y ofrecer mayor cantidad de productos a sus clientas, ya que en este momento no abastece toda la demanda. Dentro de sus metas esta el poder organizarse para tener un negocio mas grande y estable, una de sus oportunidades es el área de mercadeo, ella quiere estudiar y aprender de esta materia para negociar mejor sus contratos y así obtener un mayor ingreso para su familia.
texts.en: Iris is 52 years old and lives in the community of San Pedro de Poa, a place located in the foothills of the volcano with the same name. She lives with her husband and youngest son, who is in school. She has older children that are students and work to help with the expenses of the house. She sells catalogue products, and with the money she makes from this activity, she buys hens. She sells as many eggs in the community as she does catalogue items. She gets up very early, dresses and feeds her husband and children, and when they leave, she begins to collect eggs. After breakfast, in the afternoon, she goes to sell her catalogue items. With the success she has had, she hopes to use the money from this loan to buy more hens and offer a greater variety of products to her clients because right now she cannot meet the demand. One of her goals is to organize to have a larger and more stable business. One opportunity is the area of marketing. She wants to study and learn marketing material to better negotiate contracts and get more income for her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for making undergarments.

loans.name: Banco Mujer Con Visión De Exito Group

texts.es:
Xinia es una mujer de 44 años de edad, divorciada y tiene 3 hijos, dos de ellos viven con ella aun, uno es de edad escolar. Para generar mayores ingresos para su hogar decide iniciar su negocio de venta de sandalias y blusas hace mas de 20 años, una vez divorciada se da cuenta que el continuar con su negocio le permitirá generar ingresos y poder cuidar a sus hijos, por esta razón s negocio se ve fortalecido con su esfuerzo diario de mas de 6 horas. Divide su energía entre los deberes de la casa, la atención de sus hijos y la venta de sandalias y blusas en las inmediaciones de Puntarenas. Ella acomoda su jornada al horario de la escuela de sus hijos, por lo que si tiene que atender a las clientas en la noche lo hace. Es una mujer que se sacrifica para sacar adelante a sus hijos y brindarles un futuro mejor.
Este crédito le permitirá aumentar su catalogo de productos al diversificar con mayor cantidad de mercadería como lo son: pantalones cortos, vestidos de baño, perfumes además de las sandalias y blusas que vende regularmente.
Ella esta segura que asi como ha logrado mantener su familia y su negocio durante 20 años, lograra crecer y mantenerse en la ruta del éxito por medio de su visión y la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
Xinia is a 44 year old woman, divorced with three kids, 2 of of whom live with her. One is school-aged. To generate more income for her home, she decided to begin a sandal and blouse-selling business, which she has now had for more than 20 years. Divorced once, she realizes that her business will continue and allow her to generate more income and take care of her children. For this reason, she strengthens her business buy working hard for over 6 hours each day. She divides her energy between the chores of the house, attending to her children, and selling sandals and blouses in the vicinity of Puntarenas. She works her schedule around the children's schoolday, so if she has to has to attend to her clients at night, she does. She is a woman who sacrifices to raise her children right and give them a better future.

This credit will allow her to increase her products and diversify, with better quality, her commodities, including: shorts, swimwear, perfumes, in addition to the sandals and blouses that she sells regularly. She is sure that like how she has maintained her family and business for the past 20 years, she will continue to grow the path of success through her vision and the help she has been given.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her retail shop

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 45 years old and married with seven children.

Jocelyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29500 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soap, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Jocelyn has borrowed and paid back 38 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 14 years and also earns an income from food vending and raising pigs.

Jocelyn aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soap, shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet  is 49 years old and married with two children. She earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines. She has been farming sugarcane for 22 years and earns additional income from food vending and raising pigs.

Juliet is borrowing 17,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She is working tirelessly toward attaining her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Silvia Xiomara

texts.es: Silvia, tiene 36 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 2 hijos, vive en el municipio de Esparta, Atlántida. Silvia tiene 4 años de dedicarse a la venta de ropa nueva como pantalones, camisas, ropa intima para damas, y caballeros, sandalias, etc. ha invertido varios prestamos al negocio, actualmente solicita el séptimo ciclo que es por 10,000 Lempiras y los va invertir en la compra de ropa nueva como camisas, pantalones y ropa intima y sandalias con el propósito de poder surtir el negocio y cumplir con los pedidos de los clientes. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio y obtener mejores ganancias para bienestar personal y familiar.
texts.en: Silvia is 36 years old, married, and has two children.  She lives in the town of Esparta, Atlántida and has been selling new clothing such as pants, shirts, intimate apparel for ladies and gentlemen, sandals, etc.  She has invested the loans into the business and is currently sealing a loan to be able to stock her business and meet with her customer demand.  Her goal is to grow her business and increase her income for her family’s wellbeing.

loans.use: to buy clothing an inventory.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace, 25, resides in Bacoor, Cavite, in the Philippines. She is married to Ryan Paul. She and her husband manage their own household. At this time, Grace is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses.  

Grace oversees and operates their tricycle transportation business. They have one tricycle unit, which carries up to four passengers to their destination within the community. Grace receives a "boundary" (daily quota) from the tricycle driver each day. Her regular customers are members of the local community. She earns a minimum 500 Philippine pesos (PHP) every day.
 
To help her continue operating the business, Grace is requesting a loan of 10,000 PHP. She will use the loan to pay for spare parts, accessories and maintenance for the tricycle unit.

Each week, Grace meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories about her work and also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God, which she studies.* She hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a good future.  

*All CCT community partners and clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance for her tricycle unit.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Teresa works hard to support her family.

She has a general store in the Philippines. Teresa is borrowing PHP 25,000 through NWTF to purchase stocks such as biscuits, coffee, milk, etc. to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Teresa has been sustaining her business activities through the past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stocks such as biscuits, coffee, milk, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Jose Melvin

texts.es: Don José  de 42 años de edad  vive en casa propia con su esposa y su hijo  es una persona muy responsable y trabajadora,  el se dedica a la elaboración de hamacas desde hace varios años comercializa sus productos en su casa de habitación y de forma ambulante por las diferentes colonias que están cerca de su lugar de residencia con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, José esta solicitando un crédito con el cual  realizaría la compra de material para elaborar las hamacas como hilos de colores, lanas, lazos, etc. y poder ofrecer a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: José, who is 42 years old lives in his own house with his wife and child. He is a very responsible and hard-working person that is dedicated to making hammocks. For many years, he has been selling the products in his house and travels to different colonies that are nearby. He covers some of his household expenses with what he makes from his sales. José is seeking credit for buy material to makes his hammocks, like colored thread, wool, ribbon, etc. so that he can offer his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy colored thread, wool, ribbon, etc. to use for his hammock-making business

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta  vive junto a su abuela y sobrino  en casa de un familiar se dedica  a la venta de ropa, sandalias y golosinas hace dos años u negocio lo tiene ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia  posee muy buenas referencias departe de sus vecinos, es una persona honrada,  responsable y muy humilde   posee mucha clientela gracias a su amabilidad  con que los atiende  además  de la buena calidad de sus productos  de esta manera a logrado solventar sus gastos familiares la clienta solicita  un crédito para la compra de  mercadería como:  ropa, sandalias y golosinas todo por mayor  para poder abastecer  aun mas su negocio  y así mejorar la calidad de vida  y de su familia.
texts.en: She lives with her grandmother and nephew in a relative’s house and has been selling clothing, sandals, and snacks for two years.  Her business is located hear her home and she has good references from her neighbors.  She is an honest, responsible, and very humble person and has many customers thanks to her friendliness toward them.  She also sells good quality products and is able to pay the family expenses this way.  She is asking for a loan to buy merchandise such as clothing, sandals, and snacks in quantity so she can stock her business more and be able to improve her family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.es: Doña Guadalupe de 55 de edad vive en casa propia junto  a su compañero de vida y su hija  ella se dedica al cultivo de guayaba  y pipián desde hace 20 años  es una persona  muy trabajadora   y responsable  muy reconocida  en la zona por la calidad en los cultivos  además se dedica a la venta de  ropa y  bisutería,  gracias a su trabajo ha logrado solventar algunos de los gastos de su familia, ella solicita un crédito para invertir en el cultivo de guayaba y poder  compra mas arboles y bolsas para protegerlas  de las plagas,  abonos, herbicidas,  etc. y así incrementar  sus cultivos  y abastecer la demanda que posee para poder darle  a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Guadalupe is 55 years old and lives in her own home with her domestic partner and daughter.  She has been raising guava and pipian for 20 years and is a very hardworking and responsible person, very well known in her area for the quality of her crops.  She also sells clothing and costume jewelry and has been able to pay some of her family expenses, thanks to her work.  She is asking for a loan so she can invest in her guava crop and be able to buy more trees and bags to protect them from blights, fertilizers, herbicides, etc.  In this way she will be able to increase her crops and meet the demand so she can provide her family with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy more plants.

loans.name: Jose Mauricio

texts.es: Don José de 56 años de edad  vive en casa propia  junto a su  familia que esta conformado por  su esposa y sus cuatro hijos de 21, 19,16 y 15 años de edad ellos estudian actualmente, hace varios años se dedica al cultivo de maíz y a la crianza de cerdos,  con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, Don José solicita un crédito para la compra de alimento y concentrado para los cerdos , con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Jose is 56 years old and lives in a home of his own along with his family, comprised of his wife and four children, ages 21, 19, 16, and 15.  They all attend school.  He has been raising corn and pigs for several years and he pays the household expenses with the profits.  Jose is asking for a loan so he can buy feed and concentrate for the pigs.  This way he will be able to provide a better quality of life for his family.

loans.use: to buy feed.

loans.name: Londa Group

texts.en:
HIDAYA, who is in her early 40s, is married, living together with her husband, and blessed with four children. Two of the children are in school. For seven years now, HIDAYA has had a business selling cold drinks like beers, soft one:sodas, juices and water. She works from 3 p.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair profit per month. 

This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She will use this loan to buy more beers, sodas, juices and water to improve her drinks business. HIDAYA dreams that one day she will be able to build a shop and open a charcoal business. She will share this loan with her loan group "LONDA" which totals 18 members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more beers, sodas, juices and water to improve her drinks business.

loans.name: Osmar Vicente

texts.es: Osmar Vicente 68 años de edad casado, reside en el departamento de Chinandega en el occidente del país , El se dedica a vender deliciosos pan simple y dulces como: bolillos, crosan, galletas simple, picos, maletas entre otros,  así como también tiene un caramanchel ambulante como: golosinas, galletas, meneítos, paletas entre otros,  sus ingresos familiares dependen de los ingresos de su pequeño negocio, el comenzó este negocio para mejorar su nivel de vida y la de su familia en el  hogar el inicia su jornada desde muy temprano y finaliza un poco tarde hasta lograr de obtener el pan del dia para su familia uno de sus sueños es de mejorar sus vivienda e incrementar su inventario, Osmar actualmente esta solicitando crédito para capital de trabajo en bisuterías, pan, golosinas entre otros, cabe mencionar que el es una persona trabajadora, honesta, y con muchos ánimos de trabajar y salir adelante.
texts.en:
Osmar Vicente, age 68, is married and lives in the Chinandega department in the western part of the country.  He sells delicious bread and sweets like rolls, croissants, biscuits, ‘picos’ (a Nicaraguan specialty made with dough, sugar and cheese), and cakes, among others.  He also sells things like candy, cookies, cheese snacks, and popsicles in an itinerant manner.  His family’s income depends upon the income from his small business.  He started this business in order to improve his standard of living and that of his family at home.  He starts his work day very early, and he finishes a bit late, until he manages to get the daily bread for his family.

One of his dreams is to improve his house and to increase his inventory.  Osmar is currently requesting a loan for knick-knacks, bread, and candy, among others.  It is worth mentioning that he is a hard-working and honest person with a great desire to work and get ahead.

loans.use: to buy knick-knacks, bread, and candy, among others.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en: Joseph is 35 years of age, married to Pricilla and blessed with four children aged 14, 12, 10 and six years respectively. He owns a retail shop, a business he started 12 years ago, and earns a monthly income of KES 25,000. He has requested a first loan of KES 50,000 to purchase bales of flour, bags of tea leaves and cooking oil. The profit he earns will aid him in repaying his loan. His dream is to have a stable business and be self reliant.

loans.use: To purchase bales of flour, bags of tea leaves and cooking oil.

loans.name: Nimwaka

texts.en:
Nimwaka is a married woman. She has two children who attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Nimwaka has operated a fish selling business for the past five years. She fries fish and sells in an open air place. She cites seasonality as her major challenge.

With the KES 10,000 she wants to purchase more fish and cooking oil for her business. She decided to join Yehu to access financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fish and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Reyna Esperanza

texts.es: Doña Reyna es originaria de la ciudad de san juan del sur,  Rivas. De  33 años de edad, casada y madre de 2 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante,  se dedica al negocio  de pulpería desde hace 14 años. Esta actividad ha sido de mucha ayuda para el bienestar de su familia. Tiene  como otra fuente de ingresos una línea de  transporte de moto taxi. Le gustaría dar a conocer sus productos en todos los sectores, ya que asi podrá obtener  mayores ganancias a través de las ventas realizadas. Su expectativa es prosperar e ir aumentando su capital para surtir su pulpería, con el fin de brindar un mejor servicio y ofertas. Solicita el crédito para comprar productos tales como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, aceite, gaseosas y una moto taxi. Estima que el financiamiento será de mucha ayuda para su negocio y familia. Su plan futuro es comprar otra moto taxi para adquirir mayores ingresos y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Reyna is originally from the city of San Juan del Sur, Rivas. 33 years old, she is married and the mother of two children. She is a shopkeeper. She has made a living through her grocery store for 14 years. This activity has been a huge help to the wellbeing of her family. She has a motorcycle taxi transportation service as another source of income. 

She would like to have her products known in all sectors since that is how she will be able to obtain better profits through her sales. Her hope is to prosper and increase her capital to supply her grocery store, with the goal of providing better service and offers. 

She is requesting the loan to buy products like rice, beans, sugar, oil, soft drinks, and a motorcycle taxi. She estimates that the funding will provide a lot of help to her business and family. Her future plan is to buy another motorcycle taxi to acquire a higher income and satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, sugar, oil, soft drinks, and a motorcycle taxi.

loans.name: Dolphin Group

texts.en:
Rose, who is in her early 30s, is married with two children who are still in school. She has been selling secondhand clothes for two years now. She works from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Rose's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to increase her stocks of secondhand clothes. She has paid back all of her loans successfully. She used the profits to buy a fridge, start building her house, pay school fees, and help her husband with household expenses. She will use this loan to buy additional stocks of the secondhand clothes. She dreams of finishing her house to build a shop for her business.

Rose will share this loan with her loan group, Dolphin, which includes three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of secondhand clothes.

loans.name: Sophia

texts.en:
Sophia is married with two children who are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Sophia makes dumplings and sells them to passersby. She cited price fluctuations on items as her major challenge. 

With the KES 10,000, she wants to purchase wheat flour and cooking oil for her business. She joined Yehu to get financial support.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour and cooking oil for her business.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es: María de los Ángeles de 47  años de edad madre soltera reside en el departamento de Chinandega en el occidente del país, Maria se dedica a la compra-venta de leña, así como también cerdos en pie, cabe señalar que también tiene otros ingresos como: actualmente tiene 2 manzanas de maíz donde ella siembra, inicia desde muy temprano si jornada de trabajado, ella vende en comarcas vecinas de este municipio, ella compra al contado en fincas de comarcas ya rajadas o sin rajar, los cerdos en pie los compra a vecinos o sectores aledaños, sus ventas son al contado y al credito los cuales recupera semanalmente,  el negocio lo inició hace 18 años atrás y lo toma como alternativa de trabajo, uno de sus sueños es poder mejorar su vivienda, ella solicita crédito para la compra de capital de trabajo como un lote de leña, y poder obtener de esa manera mejores ingresos, ella está muy contenta y agradece la ayuda que los Inversionistas Kivas le ofrecen a personas con escasos recursos y países pobres como Nicaragua para tener un medio digno de trabajo.
texts.en:
47-year old María de los Ángeles is a single mother who lives in the department of Chinandega in the west part of the country. She buys and sells firewood and pigs. María also has another source of income as she has two manzanas (one manzana = 1.72 acres) planted with corn.

She starts work very early in the morning and sells her merchandise in local markets. She buys the firewood from landowners, both cut and uncut. The pigs are bought from neighbours or nearby farms. María sells for both cash and on credit which she collects weekly. She started the business 18 years ago as an alternative to a regular job.

One of her dreams is to make improvements to her house.

María is seeking a loan to buy more firewood so she can earn more money. She is happy and grateful for the help provided by Kiva donors to poor people in countries like Nicaragua so they can have a dignified way of life.

loans.use: buy more firewood

loans.name: Fatima Auxiliadora

texts.es: Doña Fátima de 32 años de edad, vive en casa propia, junto a su esposo  y sus dos hijos, ella posee una tienda desde varios años, además vende productos de  ferretería, y tiene proyecto de vender comida, es una persona responsable, honesta, tiene una excelente moral de pago, además sus productos son muy solicitados en la zona y sus alrededores ya que es un lugar muy transitado, Ella solicita un crédito para la invertir en productos de la tienda como golosinas, dulces, bebidas, granos básicos, aceite, huevos, etc. Y así poder incrementar su nivel de ventas y ofrecerle a su familia un futuro económico estable.
texts.en:
Sra. Fátima is 32 years old and lives in her own house with her husband and their two children. She has owned a corner store for several years and also sells hardware. She is thinking about selling food also.

Fátima is a responsible, honest person with an excellent credit rating. Her merchandise is much sought after in the local area since the store is in a busy neighbourhood. She is seeking a loan to buy items such as candy, sweets, drinks, basic grains, oil, and eggs. The extra stock will help her increase sales so she can provide her family with a more stable financial future.

loans.use: buy candy, sweets, drinks, basic grains, oil, eggs etc.

loans.name: Kurbonkhon

texts.ru: Курбонхону 18 лет. Он умная и целеустремленная девушка. Курбонхон в школе училась отлично и активно участвовала во всех общественных мероприятиях школы. Она с детства мечтала стать учительницей и служить своему народу. Она в этом году окончила среднюю школу и поступила в университет. Курбонхон живет с родителями, и ее родители очень гордятся ею. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Kurbonkhon is 18 years old.  She is a bright and ambitious young woman.  She used to be a very good student in school, and actively participated in all of her school's social events.  Since childhood, she has been dreaming about becoming a teacher and serving her people.  This year, she graduated from secondary school and has just started university.  She lives with her parents, who are very proud of her.  She is requesting a loan to pay for her university tuition.  She is awaiting your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition.

loans.name: Naimjon

texts.ru: Наимджон трудолюбивый молодой человек. Ему 19 лет. Он не женат и живет с родителями. Наимджон студент 2 курса. Он учится в Технологическом Университете Таджикистана по специальности технолога. Наимджон учится отлично и в свободное время читает интересные книги. Его отец работает в общественной организации, а мать работает в больнице. Он должен оплатить за учебный договор, но не имеет денег. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Naimjon is a hardworking young man of 19. He is unmarried and lives with his parents. Naimjon is a second-year student at the Technological University of Tajikistan with a major in technology. He is an excellent student and reads interesting books in his free time. His father works in a non-governmental organization and his mother works in a hospital. Naimjon needs to pay for his tuition but doesn't have the money. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition

loans.name: Emily

texts.en:
Emily of Bangko, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental, is married with two children. Her husband is a farmer and she helps him operate their farm to make a living. 

Emily joined Gata Daku MPC in 2008 and has successfully repaid her previous loans. She has taken out a new loan to purchase fertilizer such as manure. In her determination to see her children be successful, she hopes to gain more income from her farm to save a portion for their future education.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita, 74, is married with four children. She runs a general store in the Philippines and works hard to provide for her family. She has been running the general store for 40 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Nenita has requested a loan of 25,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF). She will use the loan to purchase additional stock to sell, such as rice, sugar and soft drinks.

Nenita has borrowed and paid 26 loans from NWTF before this loan. She aspires to saving money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell, such as rice, sugar and soft drinks.

loans.name: Farkhanda

texts.en:
Farkhanda, age 33, is a housewife. She adores her family, and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband is a scrap dealer. This business is the only source of income for the family. Income he generates from his work is insufficient to meet the family's expenses. He does not have enough savings to pay their electricity, gas and water bills. But still he always remains thankful to God for his mercy upon his family.

Farkhanda is requesting a loan from Kiva partner BRAC Pakistan with the goal of improving her husband's business. He will use the loan amount to purchase scrap iron, aluminum, and plastic bottles for his business. With the profits expected from this loan, he intends to invest in household needs. Farkhanda hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva lenders and to BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase scrap iron, aluminum, and plastic bottles for her husband's business

loans.name: Tutu

texts.en:
Tutu is 42 years old and lives in Saclepea of Nimba County with her husband and five children. She was unfortunately not able to attend school. Her children’s ages range from 17 to 25. Only two are in school. 

For four years now, she has been operating a table where she sells rice, oil, Vita (juice drink), pepper, salt, etc. in the local market. She started this business with help from her friends. A problem she faces is the high prices of commodities that she sells. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, oil, Vita, pepper, salt, etc. for her business. She likes the way her business keeps her busy and independent. Her plans are to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, oil, Vita, pepper, salt, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 34 years old and lives in Tappita City of Nimba County. She and her fiancée live together, and her fiancée works as a cleaner. They have six children, ranging from 2 to 15 years, respectively. They all live at home with their parents.

For eight years now, Hellen has been operating a table where she sells toothpaste, washing soap, bath soap, rice, and many items. Most interestingly, she has many customers, since her business is in a very good location.

Hellen is requesting a loan to buy toothpaste, washing soap, bath soap, rice, and many items for her business. She plans to expand her business and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, washing soap, bath soap, rice, and many items for her business.

loans.name: Gela

texts.en:
Gela is 49 years old. He is married and lives in the village of Velistsikhe with his spouse, two sons and retired mother. Gela leads the family's agriculture business. In particular, he owns a vineyard and a plot of land where peaches are grown. The family always has quality products and sells them among fruit retailers. As the income from the agriculture business is seasonal and is not enough for consuming, Gela decided to apply for a loan and start an animal husbandry business to generate income.

With this loan Gela will purchase calves. After purchasing livestock, he will raise them and sell them in the spring for a higher price. This will generate an income and the new business initiative financed with the Kiva start-up loan will significantly improve his living conditions.

His loan request was approved within the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program aims to provide business start-up and re-startup credits with more favorable terms to the country's rural poor who do not have access to credit products because they are regarded as “high-risk borrowers” because of low income.

loans.use: to purchase calves and start an animal husbandry business.

loans.name: Olimjon

texts.ru: Олимчон таксист, ему 34 года. Он живет со своей женой и детьми в городе Вахдат за 20 километрами от столицы. У него двое детей, сыну 9 лет, а дочке 7 лет. Олимчон более 5 лет занимается предоставлением услуги такси по маршруту своего города. Он хотел бы отремонтировать свою машину для продолжения деятельности, а также провести ремонт в  доме. Единственным ограничением для этого джентльмена является нехватка денег. Он просит кредит для осуществления своих намерений. Олимчон добросовестный человек и дает слово выплачивать кредит в срок.
texts.en: Olimjon is 34 years old and works as a taxi driver.  He lives with his wife and children in the city of Vahdat, located 20 kilometers away from the capital city.  He has two children: a 9-year-old son and a 7-year-old daughter.  He has been providing taxi services for more than five years, along a route in his city.  He would like to repair his car to be able to continue his activity, and also to perform some repairs at home.  This gentleman's only limitation is a lack of money.  He is asking for a loan to realize his projects.  Olimjon is a conscientious man and he promises to repay his loan on time.

loans.use: to repair his car and house, in order to improve his working and living conditions.

loans.name: Mehrubon

texts.ru: Мехрубон молодой и целеустремленный человек. Он не женат и живёт с родителями и братьями. Мехрубон не имеет высшее образование, так как после окончания средней школы у него не было возможностей, и он научился у мастера изготовлением хозяйственных товаров из древесины. Он занимается этим бизнесом более 6 лет. Он имеет золотые руки и знает все тонкости своего дела. Он обеспечивает свою семью с полученного дохода. Он планирует развевать бизнес и увеличить доход. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 3000 сомони для покупки древесины и оцинкованного железа для пополнения оборотного капитала. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Mehrubon is a young and ambitious man. He is unmarried and lives with his parents and brothers. He doesn't have a higher education since the option was not available to him after he finished high school, and he learned from a master how to make household goods out of wood, a business he has been working in for more than six years. He has "golden hands" and knows all the intricacies of his craft, and supports his family with his earnings. Mehrubon plans to develop his business to increase profits. He is requesting a loan of 3,000 somoni to purchase wood and galvanized iron to augment his working capital. He awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: to buy wood and iron to make and sell household goods

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie owns and operates a garden in the village of Salimpuno, Pana-on, Misamis Occidental. Her husband is a farmer and provides their main source of income. 

Rosalie joined Gata Daku MPC in 2012 and she has borrowed 3,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer for her flower garden. While her three children are young, she is saving a portion of her income for their education in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer for her flower garden

loans.name: Brander

texts.en:
Brander is a married woman with two children who attend school. She lives in her own house that has neither piped water nor electricity. She cites school fees as her greatest monthly expense.

Brander has operated a beauty salon business for the past five years. Her potential customers are women.

With the 10,000 KES she wants to purchase hair chemicals, braids, shampoos and hair conditioners for her business. She decided to join Yehu to get financial support to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase hair chemicals, braids, shampoos and hair conditioners for her business.

loans.name: Juan Jaime

texts.es: Don Juan de 54 años de edad, vive en casa propia junto a su esposa, él se dedica a la agricultura específicamente en el cultivo de café desde hace 10 años cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en sacos así como muestra la fotografía para luego salir a comercializarlo a los diferentes mercados que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, es un persona con excelente moral, responsable muy buena capacidad de pago, además su producto posee gran demanda en la zona, gracias a su  trabajo ha logrado solventar muchas de sus gastos, Don Juan solicita un crédito para preparar una parte de la parcela y comprar abono para el cultivo de café y de esta manera poder continuar con sus labores, obtener mayores ganancias y darle a su familia la calidad de vida que se merecen.
texts.en:
54-year old Don Juan lives with his wife in their own home. He is a farmer and has grown coffee for ten years. When the beans are ready, he harvests them and puts them into bags as shown in the photograph. Then he sells them in different markets near his home.

Juan is an honest man with a fine credit rating. His coffee is in great demand in the area. Thanks to his job he has managed to support his household. He is now seeking a loan so he can prepare his land and buy fertilizer for the coffee plants. In this way he will be able to earn more money and provide his family with the standard of living they deserve.

loans.use: buy fertilizer for the coffee plants

loans.name: Jackie

texts.en: Jackie is 36 years old and lives in Tappita City of Nimba County, she is married and has five children aged between 3 and 15, for the past three years she has been running a business where she sells many items like pepper, bitter-ball, and plantain among other items. She has a lot of customers and her daily sales are very high during the dry season. She is requesting a loan to purchase more pepper, bitter-ball, and plantain for her business, she plans to expand her business and wishes for her children to have a brighter future.

loans.use: to purchase more pepper, bitter-ball, and plantains

loans.name: Safia's Group

texts.en: Safia is a 48 year old woman. She is a member of this two person lending group. She has requested a loan from Kiva's partner, BRAC Pakistan, for her husband. Her husband owns a plumbing shop. He sells a variety of plumbing goods like pipes, sinks, taps, showers, bath tubs, etc. He has a very small shop, in which he has an insufficient amount of goods to sell. He doesn't have enough money to purchase more inventory for his shop. Therefore his wife Safia has requested a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan to purchase more inventory for her husband's shop. Safia is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of plumbing products for her husband's shop.

loans.name: Claris

texts.en:
Claris is married woman with three children, two in school and one underage. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop for the past ten years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. 

With the loan she has requested, she wants to purchase sugar, soap, tea leaves, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, soap, tea leaves, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en: Mamie is 42 years old and lives in Tappita City of Nimba County, she is a 3rd grade dropout, she is married and has eight children between the ages of 10 and 23 years, only four are in school and live at home.  Her husband is a teacher. For the past 7 years she has been selling dry-bush meat. Some problems she is facing is that during the rainy season, her sales are low. She sells for 12 hours every day. She described her herself as a serious woman. She started this business from her husband salary, and learned business tips from her friends. Her business has enabled her to help support her family which makes her proud of her business. She is requesting a loan to purchase dry-bush meat for her business. Her plans are to educate all her children and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase dry-bush meat for her business.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en: Sughran is a 50 year old married woman. She is a mother of five children. She adores her family and her husband works very hard so that his family can have a good and respectable life. Her husband owns a clothing business which is the only source of income for the family. Presently he needs additional capital for the growth of his business. For that Sughran is requesting a loan from Kiva's partner BRAC Pakistan for her husband to purchase a variety of clothes to sell. So that he can respond quickly to customer needs. He will put a side some savings amount from the planned profits to pay for their electricity and gas bills. Sughran hopes that the loan will be helpful for her husband's business. She is thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Masika

texts.en:
Masika is a married woman with three children, two of whom are in school and one who is still underage. For the past eight years, she has operated a tailoring business. Masika lives at her own house without electricity or running water and her greatest business challenge is seasonality. 

Masika is requesting a 30,000 KES loan to purchase fabric, materials, and thread. She dreams of expanding her business and establishing another business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase fabric, materials, and thread

loans.name: Aletha

texts.en:
Aletha is 25 years old and lives in Tappita City of Nimba County with her fiancee. They have three children between 1 and 7 years old and two of the children are in school.  They all share a home.  Aletha dropped out in seventh grade.  Her fiancee is a farmer. Since 2007 she has been selling tomatoes, salt, plastic, etc. She is requesting a loan to purchase more tomatoes, salt, plastic, etc. for the business. She sells ten hours per day, six days per week at her business. She describes herself as a businesswoman.

A shortage of goods is the problem she faces in her business.  She learned this business from friends and started it with money from her fiancee. She likes her business because of the way people respond to her business. Her plans are to expand her business, educate her children, and build her house.

loans.use: to purchase more tomatoes, salt, plastic, etc. for the business.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman with no children. For the past two years, she has operated a retail shop where she sells household consumables such as maize flour, cooking oil, soap, sugar, and other items. Esther lives in a rental house with electricity and running water and her greatest business challenge is price fluctuation. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

Esther is requesting a loan to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, cooking oil, and wheat flour.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, rice, maize flour, cooking oil, and wheat flour

loans.name: Serah

texts.en:
Serah is a married woman with three children who go to school. She operates a business making food such as beans and chapati to sell to neighbors and passersby. Serah owns a house without electricity or running water and her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Serah is requesting a 40,000 KES loan to purchase food items such as wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans. In the near future, she dreams of expanding her business to earn more income and establishing a restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, cooking oil, sugar, and beans

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive en casa de un familiar, junto a su madre y su hijo, ella es propietaria de una tienda y una panadería desde hace 6 años, su negocio es muy estable, ella es muy trabajadora, honesta, tiene mucha clientela  gracias a la calidad de sus productos y la amabilidad con la que atiende a sus clientes, ella solicita un crédito para comprar más productos para surtir su tienda como granos básicos, leche, huevos, golosinas, etc. y para mejorar su panadería  y de esta manera satisfacer la gran demanda que posee, obtener mayores ingresos y así darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: This borrower lives in the house of a relative, along with her mother and her son. She has been the proprietor of a store and a bakery for 6 years. Her business is very stable. She is very hard-working and honest. She has many customers thanks to the quality of her products and the friendliness with which she serves her customers. She is applying for a loan to buy more products to stock her store, such as basic foodstuffs, milk, eggs, candies, etc., and to improve her bakery and in this way satisfy the great demand that she has, obtain greater income, and thus give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy basic foodstuffs, milk, eggs, candies, etc.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George, 30years old, lives in the small village of Telavi with his wife, mother and two infant daughters. The only source of income for the family is the small salary George earns as a physical worker. Because his income is not stable and inadequate for the family, he decided to start his own business and seek credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. 


The startup program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables the rural poor and inexperienced to get a loan to start or re-start business ventures. George's application for a loan of 550 Gel was approved under the framework of this program. He will use the loan to purchase a motorbike to transport wood from the forest to resell. This, along with his job as a manual laborer, will generate a stable income, thereby giving him a real opportunity to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a motorbike to transport wood

loans.name: Jemima's Group

texts.en:
Jemima, standing second from the right in this photo, is the representative of this six-person group loan. Most of the members are married and their average age is 34 and they each have two children. The women all live in the same neighborhood and work buying and selling a variety of merchandise, including cosmetics, plates, corn dough, lining, wax-print, scarves, and bed sheets. Group members decided to join the loan program of the microfinance institution ID-Ghana with the goal of satisfying their fast-growing customer bases. They have successfully repaid previous loans. 

The group is requesting a 2,950 GHS loan to expand their businesses.  Jemima works selling wax-print scarves. Her products are in high demand by her customers and she will use her portion of the loan to purchase wax-print material and scarves wholesale from the central market to resell to customers. She will use the profit from her loan to reinvest in her business and help her husband to meet their household needs.

loans.use: to purchase wax-print material and scarves wholesale from the central market to resell to customers

loans.name: Delmi Azucena

texts.es:
Delmi tiene 25 años de edad ella es una joven mujer con deseos de superarse y sacar sus hijos adelante convirtiéndolos en hombres y mujeres de bien, preparados y de buenos principios. Ella es madre de 3 hijos y en compañía de su pareja se dedican a la siembra de maíz, frijol y arroz desde hace varios años que por medio de esta actividad y estos rubros ha logrado mantener su familia, cubrir los gastos y enviarlos a la escuela. Ella tiene un grado de educación primaria completo el cual pudo cursar gracias al apoyo económico y moral por parte de sus padres. Su producto al final de la cosecha es comercializado en las bodegas de las zonas aledañas, pulperías y en ocasiones intermediarios que llegan para re vender el producto en otras zonas.

Ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el comprara para extender sus cultivos 40 libras de semilla de maíz certificada, 30 libras de semilla de frijol certificado, 15 QQ de fórmula 18-46-0 y 15 QQ de urea para dar asistencia y mantenimiento a los mismos.

Sus planes a futuro son los de mejorar su área de cultivo ampliarla y fortalecerla ya que de esa forma ella podrá aprovechar para cultivar más producto. Como madre de familia ofrecer un mejor estatus de vida a sus hijos y cumplir su propósito que es dejarles un patrimonio fortalecido y poder enviarlos a la universidad.
texts.en:
Delmi is 25 years old. She has the desire to make herself better and get her children ahead, to turn them into good adults, well-prepared and well-principled. She has three children. Along with her partner she has grown beans, corn and rice for a number of years. By doing this she has been able to maintain her family, pay their bills and send the children to school. She has a degree in Primary Education which she was able to study thanks to the support, both economic and moral, of her parents. 

Delmi has requested a loan from COMIXMUL to buy 40 pounds of certified corn seed, 30 lbs of certified bean seed, 15 quintals of Formula 18-46-0 and 15 quintals of urea to assist and maintain the seeds. At the end of the harvest she sells her product to the warehouses in the surrounding area, small stores and occasionally to intermediaries who then re-sell it in other areas. 

Her future plans are to improve the land she cultivates, expand it and make it more productive and in this way she can harvest more. As the mother of a family she would like to offer a higher living standard to her children and leave them a strong estate, and be able to send them to university.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for the maintenance of her fields.

loans.name: Farruh

texts.en:
Farruh is married and has two children. It is important for him to provide his family with a good quality of life. Therefore, Farruh began a transportation business eight years ago. Thanks to his good service, he has managed to gain many customers. His hard work has helped to improve his family’s quality of life and now his children are able to get a good education and the family’s financial challenges are being solved little by little. 

Farruh is requesting a loan to make a party in his family. He awaits your support.

loans.use: to organize a party

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is 25 years old and lives in Tappita City of Nimba County. She is single and has a four-year-old child who lives at home and is currently in school.

For two years Catherine has been involved in the egg business. She makes a good profit and has many customers since she is the only one who sells eggs by card and retail.

She sells 12 hours per day six days per week. She describes herself as a businesswoman. She is requesting a loan to purchase eggs by the carton for her business. She hopes to see her child receive a quality education.

loans.use: to purchase eggs by the carton for her business.

loans.name: Emelie

texts.en:
Emelie is 50 years old and is married with three children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Emelie is borrowing 10,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Emelie has been raising pigs for two years and also earns additional income from a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Analyn

texts.en:
Analyn is 38 years old and married with seven children, six of whom are in school. For the past 14 years, she has run a mat-weaving business in the Philippines. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Analyn is requesting a 4,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy the raw materials for mat weaving. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for mat weaving

loans.name: Sadbarg

texts.ru: Садбарг 42 года. Она вдова и сама воспитывает своих 3 детей. Ее дети Мехрона, Фахриддин и Райхона еще не совершеннолетние. Садбарг более 3 лет работает в цехе по производству лепешек. Она каждый месяц получает зарплату и тратит для покупки продуктов питания и образование своих детей. Она уже несколько лет планирует отремонтировать свой дом, так как ее дом имеет плохое состояние. Она не имеет возможностей купить строительные материалы сделать ремонт, так как она получает маленькую зарплату. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, кирпич, а также для оплаты мастеров по ремонту дома. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Sadbarg is 42 years old.  She is a widow and raises her children by herself.  Her three children's names are Mehrona, Fahriddin and Raihona and they are still minors.  For more than three years now, she has been working in a shop making small cakes.  She receives a monthly salary which she uses to buy food and to send her children to school.

Sadbarg's has been thinking about repairing her house for a few years now, as it is in poor condition.  However, due to her small income, she cannot afford to buy the building materials necessary to perform those repairs.

She is asking for a loan of 7,500 somoni to buy building materials such as cement and bricks and also to pay the builders who will repair her house.  She is awaiting your kindness and relying on your charity.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement and bricks, and to pay the builders.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 48 years old and married with seven children. Three of her children are in school. She earns a living by farming vegetables in the Philippines. Gloria has been farming vegetables for two years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream – to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

Gloria is borrowing 2,000 Philippine pesos through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies .

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 47 years old and is married with 10 children.  Three of her children are in school.

Divina works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 4000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Divina has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year and also earns an income from nipa making.

Divina aspires to save money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina is 37 years old, married, and has three children, all of whom are in school. She is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. 

Divina requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed once in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Divina would like to save enough money that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Tsitsino

texts.en:
Tsitsino is 35 years old. She lives in the Marneuli district with her husband and six children. Tsitsino’s husband is a cook and is the only one who makes money in the household. The family lives below the poverty line and gets a small amount of monthly social assistance from the government. The existing income is not enough to cover the everyday costs of such a large family. 

Tsitsino is unemployed at the moment. She has requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but she hasn't had any success. She wants to start a bakery and a confectionery, but her loan request has always been rejected in the past because of her lack of experience, which is usually required by local credit providers. 

Tsitsino has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with reasonable conditions to vulnerable poor people, who do not have access to regular credit products. These vulnerable poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low incomes. With her credit, Tsitsino will start her own confectionery shop. She has already rented a store with all of the necessary equipment, and she needs money to purchase raw materials for baking cookies and cakes. This new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to start a bakery and confectionery

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Jonalyn works hard to support her family. She has a business selling purified drinking water in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from selling food. Jonalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF.

Jonalyn is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks of purified drinking water to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase purified drinking water to sell.

loans.name: Nasyan

texts.en:
Nasyan is 21 years old and married with two children. For the past two years, she has worked selling milk. Nasyan has one cow and sells milk to many of her neighbors along with butter that she makes. Her business is good enough to lead a decent life. Nasyan is very motivated to provide her children with a beautiful life with a good education, food, and clothing.  It’s her third year with Kashf Foundation and she is happily running her business with their support to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. 

Nasyan is requesting a 30,000 PKR loan to purchase another cow. She hopes that her loan will increase her capacity to produce milk and ultimately generate more cash.

loans.use: to purchase one more cow

loans.name: Shameem

texts.en: Shameem is a 40-year-old married woman. She has been stitching clothes for the past two years. Shameem sews for the people of her community and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to a lack of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, Shameem requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread in different colors, as well as packs of laces, zippers, and buttons to create a means of increasing revenues so she may generate a healthier income. Shameem is in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread in different colors, as well as packs of laces, zippers, and buttons.

loans.name: Oretha

texts.en:
Oretha is 48 years old and lives in Nimba, a county in Liberia that shares a border with Guinea and Cote D’Ivoire.  Because of its status as a border county, trade is the primary activity in the region. Nimba also has the second highest population in Liberia. Oretha is married and has five children between the ages of four and 22; only four of her children are presently in school and two of them live at home. She did not attend school due to some financial problems according to her parents. 

Oretha has been selling red oil in the local market for the past year. She has a lot of customers and makes lots of profit every day. Oretha is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil. In the future, she plans to expand her business and educate all her children.

loans.use: to purchase red oil for her business

loans.name: Musarat

texts.en: Musarat, age 51, deals in the business of animal sales. She buys animals - baby goats and calves - at low prices, brings them up, and then sells them out in the market at higher prices. Musarat makes enough through her business to contribute to her family's income. However, she needs to improve her business to meet her household expenses efficiently. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 to purchase two more goats. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, Musarat will definitely expand her business and increase her income level.

loans.use: to purchase two more goats.

loans.name: Azra

texts.en: Azra is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of five children.  She has been operating a business making boxes for many years. With the passage of time, Azra has improved her business and gained a lot of regular customers. This is her third year with Kashf Foundation and she is happily running her business with its support. Currently, she has requested a loan of PKR 35,000 to buy bundles of thick paper and cardboard at lower rates from the market to enable her to complete orders on time. Azra hopes to have an increase in sales. She wants to use the earned profits for the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy bundles of thick paper and cardboard.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 46-year-old married woman who has been selling milk for many years with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. Nasreen sells milk to many of her neighbors. Her business is good enough to give her a decent life. She has five children, and she is very motivated to provide them with a beautiful life. Nasreen has improved her business to meet the day-to-day expenses of life. This is her second year with Kashf Foundation.

Nasreen is happily running her business, but she needs money to purchase another buffalo. So, she requested a loan of PKR 20,000. She expects a boost in her earnings and dreams of expanding her business in the near future.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Theres

texts.en:
Theres is 30 years old and lives in Ganta city, one of the most talked-about cities in Nimba county, which is the second largest populated county in Liberia.  She is married and her husband is not working. Theres and her husband have four children between the ages of five and 15. Her children are presently attending school and they all live at home. For the past three years, Theres has been selling clothes such as blouses, tee-shirts, jeans and other items. She enjoys her business because of the profit she makes every day. Theres did not attend school.  

Theres is requesting a loan to purchase additional clothing such as blouses, tee-shirts, and jeans. Her plan is to build a house for her children in the future.

loans.use: to purchase clothing such as blouses, tee-shirts, and jeans

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Saira is a vigorous 34-year-old lady. She has been working in business of clothes sales for a period of about three years with the support of her husband, who is also shown in the photo. After purchasing cloth, she stitches clothes for ladies and children and then sells them to the people of her community and earns a good amount to contribute to her family's income. 

By this time Saira has attained good number of customers, but due to a lack of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. Saira intends to use this loan to buy more spools of thread, along with bundles of cloths in different colors. This will help her to sew more dresses on time to generate a healthier income. In addition to repaying the loan, Saira will use part of the revenues to deal with personal expenses.

loans.use: to buy more spools of thread, along with bundles of cloths in different colors.

loans.name: Munira

texts.en:
Munira is a 28-year-old married woman. She, along with her husband, has been in the business of making artificial jewelery for many years. The business has great potential for growth and Munira is actively helping her husband as this business is the only source of income for them. 

In order to meet orders on time and boost her sales, Munira applied for a loan of PKR 25,000 through Kashf to buy materials such as silver and gold, as well as artificial gems and pearls. She hopes to get an increase in her income and wishes to spend part of the profits on providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to buy materials such as silver and gold, as well as artificial gems and pearls.

loans.name: Ma. Andralyn

texts.en:
As a married mother of five children, Ma. Andralyn works hard to support her family. She has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from selling personal products and charcoal retail. 

Ma. Andralyn is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her nipa roofing business. She has been sustaining her business activities through one past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money that she can continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her nipa roofing business.

loans.name: Petra

texts.en:
Petra is 51 years old and married with five children. For the past 20 years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and she also earns additional income from having a computer gaming station. Petra works hard to provide for her family and has borrowed and repaid three previous loans from NWTF.

Petra is requesting a 12,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell such as canned goods, soft-drinks, biscuits, cooking oil, eggs, and other items. She aspires to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase canned goods, soft-drinks, biscuits, cooking oil, eggs, and other items

loans.name: Alma Fe

texts.en:
Alma Fe works hard to support her family. Alma Fe is single and selling footwear in the Philippines.

Alma Fe requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase more footwear to sell. She has been in this business for two years now, and also earns additional income from food vending.

In the future, Alma Fe would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more footwear to sell.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana works hard to support her family. Susana has a live-in partner and has a rug-making business in the Philippines.

Susana requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for making rugs. Susana has been in this business for three years now.

Susana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for making rugs

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Nazia is a 25-year-old married woman who financially helps her husband. Four years ago, she took the initiative in her area and started a school that offers educational services to poor students at cheap rates so they can have a better future. Nazia is satisfied by doing this sort of business as it is beneficial for her household and society as a whole. 

Nazia applied for a loan of PKR 35,000 through Kashf Foundation to purchase furniture, such as chairs and tables, for her school to accommodate more students. She is hopeful to have more students in her academy in the coming days.

loans.use: to purchase furniture, such as chairs and tables, for her school.

loans.name: Ely Maribel

texts.es:
Ely es una joven mujer con muchas fuerzas, mucha alegría y muchos deseos de salir adelante con 24 años de edad ella ve y confía mucho en lo que a diario realiza en compañía de su compañero de hogar ya que desde muy joven aprendió a trabajar la tierra por medio de sus padres especializándose en la siembra de granos básicos como maíz y frijol. Ella es madre de un hijo el cual es menor y depende de ella el aun no asiste a la escuela. Ella tiene un grado de educación primario completo el cual pudo terminar gracias al apoyo financiero y moral por parte de sus padres a quien ella agradece la enseñanza y disciplina inculcada desde muy joven. Sus clientes son las bodegas, pulperías e intermediarios que llegan a la zona para comprar y re vender en otras zonas.

Ella ha solicitado un financiamiento a COMIXMUL el cual invertirá en la compra de insumos agrícolas que ayudaran a sus cultivos a fortalecerse y evitara que sean contaminados y dañados por bichos entre otros. 

Los planes a futuro son los de hacer mejoras a su casa de habitación ya que son necesarias reparaciones como el  techo y repello en las paredes evitando así la humedad y al mismo tiempo enfermedades respiratorias. Sus prioridades son para con su hijo brindarle una excelente educación darle la oportunidad y apoyarlo para que el asista a la universidad y pueda ser una mejor y preparada persona.
texts.en:
Ely is a young woman of 24 years with a lot of strength, happiness and desire to get ahead. She believes in what her and her partner do every day. She learned from her parents about working the land from a very early age, especially the growing of basic grains like beans and corn. She is the mother of one child, who depends on her and does not yet attend school.She has a degree in Primary Education which she could finish thanks to the moral and financial support of her parents, to whom she is grateful for the teachings and discipline instilled in her when she was young. 

Ely has requested a loan from COMIXMUL which she will use to buy agricultural supplies to help strengthen her crops and protect them from being invaded and damaged by insects, etc. She will sell her harvest to warehouses, stores and intermediaries who come to her area and then re-sell in other areas.  

Her future plans are to fix up her house. The roof needs work on it and the walls have to be whitewashed to keep out the humidity and avoid respiratory diseases. Her priorities with her son is to give him an excellent education. And give him the opportunity and support to attend university, so he can be a well prepared, better person.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies for her corn and bean crops.

loans.name: Georgen

texts.en:
Georgen works hard to support her family. She is single and has a fitness gymnasium in the Philippines.

Georgen requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to buy additional equipment for her gymnasium. She has been in this business for twelve years.

In the future, Georgen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment for her gymnasium.

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
As a married mother of nine children, Merly works hard to support her family. Three of her children are in school. Merly runs a junk-shop business in the Philippines. She has been sustaining her business activities with a previous loan from NWTF.

Merly is requesting a 4,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy recycled materials to sell. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy recycled materials to sell

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 38-year-old businesswoman from Liberia.  She is presently unmarried and has four children between the ages of nine and 19. Rebecca describes herself as hardworking. She lives in Nimba, a county in Liberia that shares a border with Guinea and Cote D’Ivoire.  Because of its status as a border county, trade is the primary activity in the region.  It also has the second highest population in Liberia. 

For the past five years, Rebecca has run a restaurant where she sells rice and soup. She started her business with money from her husband and she works 13 hours a day. Rebecca’s greatest business challenge is the price of rice and oil. She is requesting a loan to buy more rice and oil for her business. Rebecca likes her business because it keeps her busy and she hopes to one day to buy a car.
  
Rebecca is grateful for your support!

loans.use: o buy more rice and oil

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a 49-year-old man, living with his spouse and 19-year-old daughter in the Gori District. David’s daughter is a consultant at the local supermarket and makes a small monthly income. David is jobless at the moment. He has recently returned from Russia, where he used to work as a car mechanic. He tirelessly sought a job, but there is a high unemployment rate in the region and it is very hard to find a suitable one. That's why he decided to start his own business.

With this start-up credit David will rent a workshop, purchase all the needed equipment, and set up an auto repair shop. He will work as a tinman and serve the local drivers in return for a fee. David hopes that his business initiative will be lucrative and he will make his family members' life easier.

loans.use: to start up an auto repair shop

loans.name: Lismarly

texts.es: Lismarly es originaria de Siuna. De 33 años de edad, casada y madre de tres hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería y servicio de molino desde hace 2 años, actividad que ha realizado con esfuerzo y dedicación para el bienestar de su familia. Tiene como otra fuente de ingreso  la ayuda económica que recibe de su esposo. Su expectativa es prosperar y superarse con el fin de obtener mayor inventario en su negocio. Solicita el crédito para comprar productos tales como: Arroz, azúcar, frijoles, gaseosas, golosinas y darle mantenimiento al molino. Su plan futuro es mejorar la infraestructura de su hogar.
texts.en:
Lismarly is 33 years old, married and the mother of three children. She is originally from Siuna. She is a business person. She has a small store and mill service which she had had for the past two years. She has achieved this through hard work and dedication for the well-being of her family.
