She also has financial support from her husband. Her hopes are to  be successful and get ahead with the goal of better stocking her business. 

Lismarly is requesting this loan to buy products like to buy rice, sugar, beans, soft drinks, sweets and do maintenance work on her mill. Her plan is to improve the infrastructure of her store.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, soft drinks, sweets and do maintenance work on her mill.

loans.name: Farida

texts.en: Farida is a single mother of two children, both of whom go to school. She also takes care of additional family members. She has a stone quarrying business and has applied for a loan of 300,000 Uganda shillings from MCDT-SACCO to buy more hammers and pangas. She has been in this business for 10 years. She doesn’t have any other income-generating activity. She sells at retail six days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and the law enforcement officer. She is hoping to invest in used clothes. She resides in the family house and the family has access to electricity and piped water. Her monthly expenses include school fees and feeding the family.

loans.use: To buy more hammers and pangas

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en: Hassan is a young Cameroonian, age 27, married with three children. The oldest is in primary school, while the youngest is just 8 months old. He has been in his business for the past ten years, which makes him very experienced and stable. This business is successful because it is located in an urban area and more so because of the experience he has gained over time. He is likely to succeed because mobile phones are a new phenomenon where he is located, so many people are anxiously buying and repairing their mobile phones. This loan will help him open two new phone-repairing shops.

loans.use: to buy new software for phone repairs

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther lives in Compound #3 of Grand Bassa County. She is 34 years old, married and has seven children between 8 and 18 years old. They all live at home and her children are attending school. For 15 years now, she has been running a table business selling fish in the local market. She is requesting a loan to buy more fish for her business. She wants to educate her children and expand her business for her children.

loans.use: to buy more fish for her business.

loans.name: Hemeterio

texts.es: El señor Hemeterio, es una persona de 32 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, alcanzo a estudiar la primaria, cuenta con cuatro dependientes económicos a cargo, los cuales son sus pequeños hijos, vive en su propio domicilio de tipo rustico construido con material local, que se halla situado en el Comunidad de Tíraque, la actividad económica que se dedica es la agricultura, en tal entendido produce anualmente los siguientes productos agrícolas, papa 120 cargas, haba (verde) 70 cargas, arveja (verde) 40 arrobas, maíz (grano) 15 cargas, trigo (grano) 15 quintales, avena (forraje) 30 calchas, por la venta de estos productos genera sus ingresos económicos y con ello sostiene a su familia, el préstamo solicitado requiere para capital de operación para la compra de insumos agrícolas, y de esa manera en el futuro incrementar sus ingresos y de esa forma mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Hemeterio is 32 years old, single, and finished primary school. He has the responsibility of four economic dependents, who are his small children. He lives in his own home of the rustic type, constructed with local materials, which is located in Tíraque Community. He works in agriculture, in which he produces annually the following agricultural products: 120 bundles of potatoes, 70 bundles of fava beans, 40 arrobas (unit of measure equal to 25 pounds) of peas, 15 bundles of corn, 15 quintales (unit of measure equal to 100 pounds) of wheat, 30 calchas (unit of measurement) of oats. 

He generates his income through the sale of these products, and with it he supports his family. The requested loan requires operating capital to purchase agricultural supplies, and in this way in the future increase his income, and improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Teimuraz

texts.en:
Teimuraz is a 25-year-old married man. He lives in Kutaisi district with his wife, infant daughter, parents, and grandmother. His grandmother is provided with retirement pension. Teimuraz and his father are artisans; they get orders to renovate houses. 

As the income is not stable and not enough for such a big family, Teimuraz decided to start his own business and seek credit among local financial institutions. His attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. 

The Start-up program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of $3,000. 

He will purchase auto spare parts at wholesale prices and then resell them at higher prices. This will increase the income of his family. With the increased income, they will be able to improve their living conditions. The new business initiative will give Teimuraz a chance to have financial stability and monthly income.

loans.use: to begin trade with auto spare parts.

loans.name: Anvar

texts.ru: Анвар добрый и честный человек. Ему 48 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 2 детей. Старшему 21 года, а младшему 15 лет. Он вместе с семьей живет бедно, так как он является единственным кормильцем в семье. Его жена домохозяйка. Анвар более 15 лет занимается выращиванием сельхозкультур как рис, баклажан, репа и т.п. Он имеет большой опыт по земледелию. Данное время он выращивает сельхоз культур на 1 га и 15 соток земли. Анвар с полученного дохода начал стройку дома, но не достроил свой дом, так как у него не хватило денег. В этом году он хочет достроить свой дом. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов для постройки дома. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Anvar is a kind and honest person.  He is 48 years old.  He is married and is raising two children.  His oldest child is 21 years old and the youngest one is 15 years old.  Because Anvar is the sole breadwinner for his entire family, they struggle financially.  His wife is a homemaker.  For more than 15 years Anvar has been cultivating crops such as rice, eggplants and turnips.  He has a lot of experience in farming.  Currently, he is growing vegetables on 1.15 hectares of land.  Using the profits from his farming, Anvar began to build a house, but he was unable to finish its construction when the money ran out.  This year, he wishes to complete the construction of his home.  He is asking for a loan of 5,000 Somoni to purchase the building materials needed to complete his house.  He is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials for the construction of his house

loans.name: Abdukomil

texts.ru: Абдукомил трудолюбивый человек. Ему 43 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 5 детей. Его жена домохозяйка и поэтому Абдукомил является основным кормильцем семьи. Абдукомил более 17 лет работает в государственной организации. Он является одним из лучших работников и выполняет свою работу на высшем уровне. Абдукомил планирует отремонтировать свой дом, но не имеет денег. Его дом старый и имеет плохое состояние. Он срочно должен отремонтировать свой дом, но наступления холодов. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 4500 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, древесина и т.п. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Abdukomil is a hardworking 43-year-old man.  He is married and raises five children.  His wife is a homemaker, so Abdukomil is the only breadwinner in his family.  He has been working for a public  administration for more than 17 years.  He is one of the best employees there and he carries out his duties at a very high level of competence.

Abdukomil is planning to renovate his house, but he doesn't have the money to do so.  He lives in an old house which is in poor condition.  He urgently needs to repair his house before the beginning of the cold season.  He is asking for a loan of 4,500 somoni to buy building materials such as cement and wood.  He is awaiting your kindness and relying on your charity.

loans.use: to buy building materials such as cement and wood to repair his house.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en: Rosalie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a boarding house rental business in the Philippines. She is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF to buy raw materials for the extension of her boarding house. Rosalie has been in this business for 12 years. Rosalie earns more income from land rental. Rosalie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for the extension of her boarding house.

loans.name: Eliso

texts.en:
Eliso is a 34-year-old single woman and lives in the Terjola district with her mother, brother, sister-in-law and two nephews. Eliso’s mother works as a cleaner at the local financial institution; her brother is employed at the regional sport palace; and her sister-in-law works at the municipality. They get monthly salaries but existing revenues are very small and not enough to cover everyday expenses. 

Eliso decided to start trading. She requested a loan from the local credit providers, but they usually demand some stable income from the borrowers. Eliso’s credit requests were rejected several times as she didn’t satisfy their requirements. She received this credit within the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, the so-called "Start-up Program" that gives rural poor the chance to start or re-start their businesses. With this loan of 1,200 USD, she will purchase clothing at wholesale prices and resell it in her community door-to-door. It is obvious that the work is hard for Eliso, but she is ready to deal with the difficulties and develop her business gradually. The start-up credit will be a great support for the family as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for resale.

loans.name: Eldar

texts.en:
Eldar is 66 years old. He lives with his mother in a small village in Sagarejo district. His mother is provided with a retirement pension. Eldar has a car and serves local people as a taxi driver. As his income is not stable, Eldar decided to begin an additional business and seek credit among local financial institutions. His attempts were unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. 

The Start-up program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. His application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of $1300. 

With the received credit, he will begin trading in vegetables. He will purchase stocks of groceries and transport them to different villages to resell. This will give him a chance to generate additional income and improve his living conditions. 

This credit will be a great support for the family. Eldar is thankful to Kiva Lenders for giving him a chance to generate income.

loans.use: to begin trading in vegetables.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: As a single mother of two children, Rowena works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from frozen foods. Rowena is borrowing 5,000 PHP through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to resell to her customers. Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her previous loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to resell.

loans.name: Dali

texts.en:
Dali is a 43-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband in the small village of the Tianeti district. Her husband works at the local government municipality and gets a small monthly income. Dali runs a shop. She needs money to purchase additional stock of groceries and sought credit from local financial institutions; however, her attempts were unsuccessful because of her poor living conditions. 

The start-up program that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting their businesses. Her application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 1,000 GEL. With the received credit, Dali will purchase additional stock for her shop, offer her clients a wide assortment of products, and thus increase sales and income. With the increased income, she will be able to expand her business in the future and thus improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase stock for her shop.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a gown rentals business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 5,000 through NWTF in order to purchase additional gowns to rent.

Lilia has been in this business for seven years. Lilia earns more income from general store.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional gowns to rent.

loans.name: Jenylyn

texts.en:
Jenylyn is 33 years old and married with two children.

Jenylyn works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Jenylyn has borrowed and paid a loan from NWTF before. She has been running the general store for 13 years and earns an income from selling personal products.

Jenylyn aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alizhon

texts.ru: Алижон 47 лет. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Он работает в заводе по разработки алюминий. Алижон выполняет свою работу отлично, и все его сотрудники очень любят и уважают его. Алижон является единственным кормильцем семьи и поэтому ему трудно справляться одному с семейными расходами. Его сын хочет уехать в Российскую Федерацию, так как он не имеет место работы на родине. Алижон должен купить авиабилет для своего сына, но не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1600 сомони для покупки авиабилета. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Alizhon is 47 years old.  He is married and raising three children.  He works in an aluminum manufacturing plant and does an excellent job there.  He is very much liked and respected by all his co-workers.

As the only breadwinner in his family, Alizhon finds it difficult to meet all of his family's expenses on his own.  His son now wants to go to Russia because he cannot find work in his country.  Alizhon needs to buy a plane ticket for him, but he doesn't have enough money to do so.  He is therefore asking for a loan of 1,600 somoni to buy a plane ticket for his son.  He is awaiting your kindness and relying on your charity.

loans.use: to buy a plane ticket for his son.

loans.name: Princess Unique

texts.en: Princess Unique works hard to support her family. Princess Unique is single and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Princess Unique requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production. Princess Unique has been in this business for one year now and also earns additional income from clothing sales. In the future, Princess Unique would like to save money to expand her business. She is a transgender client.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Gbassay

texts.en:
Meet 19-year-old Gbassay from Tombo in the Western Area Rural District near Freetown. She is single without children. After the death of her mother, she decided to start a business. Gbassay established her bread business at her house. She began her business because she was trained in business. She needs to generate income to support her younger sisters and brother. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge of her business is lack of capital to run her business.

Gbassay requires a loan in order to buy bread to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and renovate her house. In the future, Gbassay plans to expand her business even more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bread to expand her business.

loans.name: Koba

texts.en:
Koba is 28 years old. He lives in the Tskaltubo District with his father and a brother. His brother is a builder and works on special orders to earn a small monthly income. Koba and his father are involved in the agricultural business. Specifically, they have a milk cow and two calves. They produce cheese from the milk and sell it locally. Koba is very hard-working and the type of person who has a great desire to get ahead.

With this loan, Koba will purchase all the building materials for a greenhouse. After the greenhouse is built properly, Koba will grow greens and tomatoes, and harvested products will be sold for a good price. The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the family income, and all members will improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to construct a greenhouse.

loans.name: María Angela

texts.es: La cliente vive en Machala.  Empezó en esta actividad cuando decidió ir de casa en casa de vecinas y conocidas realizando manicure y pintando uñas.  Ahora pudo montar su local propio y las clientes la buscan en su domicilio.  Es madre soltera y tiene 2 niños pequeños, quienes estudian en la escuela fiscal de su zona.  Desea el crédito para invertir en la compra de materiales e insumos de gabinete.
texts.en:
This borrower lives in Machala.  She started her business when she decided to go house-to-house and provide manicure and nail polish services to her neighbors and acquaintances.  She now has her own shop in her home where customers can find her.  The borrower is a single and has two young children who attend a state school in the area.  

She wants to invest her loan in the purchase of salon supplies and materials.

loans.use: to buy salon supplies and materials.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en: Mary Jane is 49 years old and married with one kid. Mary Jane works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries and herbal medicines to resell at her store. Mary Jane has borrowed and paid back one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from room rentals and selling herbal medicines. Mary Jane aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries and herbal medicines to resell at her store.

loans.name: Johnaby

texts.en:
Johnaby is 37 years old and married with four children, one of whom is in school.

Johnaby works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stock to sell.

Johnaby has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for one year. She also earns an income from frozen foods.

Johnaby aspires to save money to expand her business and build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Andrey

texts.en:
Andrey is from Lusaghbyur village, where he lives with his wife and two little sons. 

Andrey is a policeman who has worked at local police station for many years. Together with his work, Andrey is also involved in an agricultural business. Currently, he keeps livestock (pigs, chickens, cows, and sheep) and cultivates wheat, barley, and grass. Andrey's wife doesn't work, as she takes care of their little children, so Andrey is the only breadwinner of the family. 

As it is very difficult for Andrey to manage the farming business and his work as a policeman, he needs help. By applying for this loan, Andrey asks for $2,000 in order to hire workers who will gather his harvest. The loan will also be used for purchasing forage for feeding the livestock and also wheat seeds for increasing the cultivation process. The loan is very important for Andrey to be able to continue his farming business and improve his business.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock, and wheat seeds, and to hire workers for gathering the harvest.

loans.name: Isatu

texts.en: Meet 30-year-old Isatu from Tombo in the Western Area Rural District near Freetown. She is married with two children between the ages of 5 years and 8 years old. Her children are currently attending school. After she got married, Isatu established her rice business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is lack of enough capital to run her business. Isatu requires a loan in order to buy a bag of rice for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and establish a permanent business location. In the future, Isatu plans to own a big shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy a bag of rice for resale.

loans.name: Binta

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Binta from Tombo (Western Area Rural District) near Freetown. She is married with two children. After her wedding, Binta established her cookery business. She began her business because she needs to create income to support the home. She works at her business ten hours per day and seven days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business lack of enough capital to run her business.

Binta requires a loan in order to buy more rice, onions, and cooking seasonings for her business. She hopes that the extra income resulting from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, Binta plans to own a full restaurant. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rice, onions, and cooking seasonings to prepare dishes for her business.

loans.name: Olive

texts.en: Olive is 38 years old and lives in Compound #3 with her eight children between the ages of 12 and 20, who are in school and live at home. For the past 14 years, she has been selling bread. Some problem she faces is the high price of flour. She says she makes a lot of profit since she is one who sells different kinds of bread. She started this business with help from her mother and learned this way of selling from her. She is requesting a loan to buy more flour, butter, etc., for her business. Her plans are to educate her children and build a house.

loans.use: to buy more flour, butter, etc., for her bread business.

loans.name: Grace Wambui

texts.en:
Grace is married with three children, all in primary school. She and her husband practice farming; they grow coffee and keep dairy cows on zero grazing. Seasonally, they are also employed as casuals at a tea farm to pick tea, and this supplements what they get from the farming business. With three children in school, they barely have enough to save and have electricity installed for them. 

Their source of energy for lighting is kerosene, and for cooking it is firewood and charcoal. Every month, they spend at least $35 on purchasing fuel, and this is a huge sacrifice, since they have to cook and the children need light to study in the evening.  

With their four cows, Grace can be able to save this money and enjoy cleaner, better, cheaper fuel for cooking and lighting by having a bio-digester constructed for her. With a loan VEP hopes to assist Grace in getting this bio-digester. In addition to cleaner fuel, she will also be using the bio-slurry to grow fodder and food crops so that she can also save money used on buying manure from other farmers. This will increase her crop production, and we hope in the future, she can start up a business of selling green groceries.

loans.use: To construct a bio-digester.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Meet 40-year-old Lucy from Tombo Western rural area in Freetown. She is married with three children. Two of her children are going to school. 

After the death of her mother, Lucy established her cookery business. She began her business because she needed to create income to support the home. She works at the business 10 hours per day and 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge for her business is lack of enough capital to run it.

Lucy requires a loan in order to buy more rice, onions, and cooking seasonings for resale. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and repay her loan. In the future, Lucy plans to own a restaurant. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more rice, onions, and cooking seasonings.

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice is 43 years old and lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. She lives with her husband and three children between the ages of 24 and 26; all three of them are in school. She been selling red oil, pepper, salt etc for the past 2 years in the local market. She is requesting a loan to purchase more red oil, pepper, salt etc for her business, She likes her business because it helps to support her home.  She hopes one day to own a house.  
She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to purchase more red oil, pepper and salt for her business

loans.name: Annie

texts.en: Annie lives in Buchanan. She is 33 years old, and married with six children between the ages of 1 and  13; only four are in school and they all live at home. She did not go to school. For twenty years she has been selling rice, pepper, bitter ball, okra and palm oil in the local market. She started this business  with money given to her by her mother and learned it from her. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, pepper, bitter ball, okra and palm oil for her business. Her plans are to buy a piece of land and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, pepper, bitter ball, okra and palm oil for her business

loans.name: Maron

texts.en:
Maron is a Liberian.  She resides in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County.  The county is located by the sea and is known for its beaches and fish.  In addition, many logging companies are located in the city.  People in Buchanan are known in the country for their love of fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. 
Maron is 22, single, with two children aged 3 and 7 who are currently living at home and attending school.  
Maron has a table business and has been selling fresh fish in the local market for the past two years.  She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more fresh fish for her business.  On average, she works eight hours each day at her business from Monday to Saturday.  She started her business with a small amount of money from her fiancée. She transports her merchandise by shared taxi.  She cites the rainy season as her biggest challenge.  Her favorite part of her business is the money she makes.  In the future, she would like to build a house.  
She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more fresh fish for her business.

loans.name: Maria Hortencia

texts.es: Doña Maria es una mujer muy trabajadora y responsable vive en casa propia tiene una buena estabilidad domiciliaria  es muy amable y por su atención hacia los clientes a logrado alcanzar una buena clientela en lo que es su negocio de tienda , ella ahora solicita un  crédito para poder invertirlo en su negocio y poder hacer las compra de lo que son mas productos como: detergentes, cereales, bebidas, granos básicos, azúcar, golosinas, entre otros, es por esa razón que ella desea invertir en su negocio para poder ofrecer una amplia variedad en su tienda y de igual manera generarse mayores ingresos y ganancia para alcanzar una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is a very hard working and responsible woman. She lives in her own house and her home is well established. She is very kind and her attentiveness towards customers has earned her a good clientele base at her store.

Maria requests a loan to invest in her business and make purchases of more products such as: detergents, cereals, drinks, basic grains, sugar and sweets, among other things. She wishes to invest in her business in order to offer a wide variety in her store. In this manner she will generate greater income and earnings to achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase items such as detergents, cereals, drinks, basic grains, sugar and sweets.

loans.name: Macario

texts.es: El señor Macario, es una persona de 27 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, alcanzo estudiar hasta el bachillerato, vive en la casa de su padre en la comunidad de Tiraque, tiene tres dependientes económicos a cargo los cuales son sus hijos, La actividad económica del señor Macario es la producción agrícola, que en promedio anualmente manifiesta que realiza la venta de los siguientes productos y en las cantidades siguientes: Papa 40 cargas, Arveja (verde) 38 arrobas, Avena 30 calchas, Trigo (Grano) 9 cargas. Cebada (Grano) 10 cargas. La siembra de estos cultivos lo realiza en terrenos de sus padres sin costo alguno en una superficie de 3 hectáreas los terrenos mencionados con anterioridad se hallan situados en la misma comunidad, los trabajos agrícolas los realiza con la colaboración  de sus vecinos, vive en una casa rustica de adobe, con este préstamo que solicita comprara abono de gallinaza y comprara semilla de papa; así con la producción  en el futuro mejorara sus condiciones económicos y por tanto también la calidad de vida de sus dependientes.
texts.en: Macario is 27 years old, single, and managed to finish high school. He lives at his father's, in the village of Tiraque, and has three children he raises on his own. Macario is a farmer, and reports that he sells, annually, a mean of 40 loads of potatoes, 38 loads of green peas, 30 loads of oats, 9 loads of wheat, and 10 loads of barley. He grows these crops on fields owned by his parents, so it does not cost him anything to use the land. The 3 hectares of land are located in the same village where they live. The whole community helps each other for agricultural work. Macario lives in a rustic house built out of sun-dried brick. He will use the loan to buy chicken guano and potato seeds, in order to improve his economic situation by selling the harvest, so as to give his children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy chicken guano and potato seeds.

loans.name: Artyom

texts.en:
Artyom is from Bandivan village in the Shirak region. He is an attractive farmer with many years of experience in this field. Currently, he works as a grazier and breeds his co-villagers' livestock. This provides Artyom with income, which is very important for him to sustain his family. Artyom lives with his wife and is a father of three children (shown in the photo). Besides working as a grazier, Artyom runs his own farm. It includes chickens, calves and cows.

Artyom asked for a loan to purchase three calves and wheat seeds. As this is Artyom's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance-loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. Thus, this loan is very important for Artyom to enlarge his farm and be able to ensure a better life for his family.

loans.use: to buy three calves and wheat seeds

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
This is Sarah from Liberia.  She resides in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County.  The county is located by the sea and is known for its beaches and fish.  In addition, many logging companies are also located in the city.  People in Buchanan are known in the country for their love of fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. 
Sarah is 34, married with two children aged 1 and 10.  They all are currently living at home and only one is in school. Sarah has owned her own small local shop business selling soap, flour, sugar, rice etc for the past 10 years.  She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more goods such as soap, flour, sugar and rice. On average, she works 12 hours per day at her business from Monday to Saturday.  She started her business with a small amount of money from her husband. She transports her merchandise by shared taxi.  She cites the rainy season as her biggest challenge.  Her favorite part of her business is the profit.  In the future, she would like to build a modern house.  
She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as soap, flour, sugar and rice

loans.name: Zenon

texts.es: El señor Zenón es casado más de 32 años, tienen 2 hijos dependientes que estudian, la familia vive en la comunidad de Colomi hace 42 años, es una familia humilde de bajos recursos económicos. El señor Zenón y su esposa se dedican a la producción agrícola, tienen  ingresos económicos de la venta de sus productos agrícolas los cuales son estacionales dentro del año, de esta forma el junto a su esposa mantienen a su familia, cuenta con 4 cabezas de ganado vacuno de trabajo (2 pares de yunta) que los utilizan en las faenas agrícolas, el señor Zenón necesitan crédito para compra de insumos agrícolas abono orgánico (gallinaza) y productos agroquímicos, no tienen para comrpar estos insumos ya que sus ahorros los invirtieron en la compra de techo para su vivienda. El señor Zenón trabajara arduamente  para ayudar en los estudios de sus hijos hasta que salgan profesionales y  tengan un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
Zenón is a 32-year old married man who has 2 dependent children attending school. They have lived in Colomi for 42 years and have limited financial resources. Zenón and his wife work in agriculture and earn income from selling their seasonal products. This is how they both support their family. They have 4 cows that are used to work in the land. 

Zenón needs financial assistance to buy farming supplies, such as organic fertilizer and agrochemical products. They have invested their savings in their house ceiling and don't have more resources to spend. Zenón works hard to pay his children's tuition, to help them until they start their professional careers and to provide them with a better future.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Please meet Elizabeth. She is 39 years old. Buchanan is the capital City of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Elizabeth did not go to school and is married. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. She has three children between the ages of 11 and 9.  They are in school and live at home. 

Elizabeth has a table business which sells toothpaste, soap, candles, etc. She has been in business for three years and works 10 hours each day at her business. With this loan, she will buy toothpaste, soap, candles etc. One of the greatest challenges that she faces is less income. She transports her goods by taxi. She started her business with money from her husband. She is proud of her business because of the profit she makes. Her future plan is to build a house. She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy toothpaste, soap, candles, etc.

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a 30-year-old businesswoman from Liberia.  She is married and has three children between the ages of 1 and 17 years old.  Two of the children are currently attending school and they all live at home.  She completed 7th grade before starting her business. She describes herself as a hard working woman.

She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia.
 
Rebecca has had a cook shop business (restaurant), which sells rice and soup for the past 10 years.  She works from 7 am to 6 pm each day at her business.  Her greatest challenge in business is limited income. She intends to use the loan to buy more rice, pepper, onion, oil, fish, meat, etc. She started her business by selling for her mother.  She likes her business because it helps to support her home. She hopes to one day to own a house. 
 
She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy more rice, pepper, onion, oil, fish, meat, etc

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Please meet 40-year-old Hawa from Buchanan. Buchanan is the capital city of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia.
 
Hawa did not go to school and she is married.  She describes herself as a hard working woman. Her spouse works as a security man.  They have three children between 2 and 16 years old, only two of whom are in school and live at home. 

Hawa has a table where she sells fish.  She has been in business for two years and works from Monday to Saturday, spending 10 hours per day.  With this loan, she will buy more fish.  One of the greatest challenges that she faces is to increase her sales.  She transports her goods by taxi.  She started her business with money from her husband.  She is proud of her business because of the profit she makes. Her future plan is to build a house.  She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Marthline

texts.en:
Marthaline is a 32-year-old businesswoman from Liberia.  She is unmarried and has five children, aged between 3 and 19.  Only four are currently attending school and they all live at home.  She was unfortunate not to attend school.  She describes herself as a hard working woman.
She lives and works in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County, which is located by the sea.  It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish.  Many logging companies are also based in the city.  Residents of the city love eating fufu, cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce.  Most people in the city are Bassa speakers, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 
Marthaline has a table business which has been selling palm oil, soap, pepper, milk, sardine, etc for the past four years.  She works from 8am to 5pm every day at her business.  Her greatest challenge in business is making enough income. She intends to use the loan to buy more palm oil, soap, pepper, milk, sardine, etc for her business. She started her business by selling for her mother.  She likes her business because it helps to support her family.  She hopes to one day own a house.  
She wants to thank the Kiva lenders in advance for their help.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil, soap, pepper, milk and sardines for her business.

loans.name: Alida

texts.es: Alida, es una mujer trabajadora de 26 años, que está casada con Percy. Ambos tiene 3 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Hace 5 años empezó con la agricultura,está es su principal actividad económica ya que desde las primeras horas del día, Alida cuida de sus cultivos de papa, alverja y flor de gladiolo. Lo que más le gusta a ella es estar junto a su familia. De igual manera, le agrada vender su producción en el mercado mayorista de de su localidad. Pero como padre responsable su esposo, también se dedica al arado de la tierra con los 2 toros que poseen; ganando un buen dinero diario. Ahora ella desea mejorar sus sembríos, pues los planes son aprovechar al máximo su cosecha de flor de gladiolo que se encuentra en la mitad de su crecimiento. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Alida, invertirá los S/.3500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Alida is a 26 year old hardworking woman.  She is 26 years old and married to Percy.  They have three children and live in their own home.  She began farming five years ago and this is their main financial activity.  Aida cares for the crops, potatoes, peas and gadiolo flowers, from the first daylight hours.  What she likes the best is being close to her family.  She also likes selling her harvest in the large local market.  As a responsible farmer she is also responsible for plowing the land with the two bulls they have, earning them a good daily income.  Now she wants to improve her crops and take maximum advantage of the gladilo flower harvest, which is half way through its growth cycle.  This will be her fourth loan through Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support she is getting.  She also promises to make her payments on time.  Aida will use the S/ 3,500 Soles to buy compost to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy compost

loans.name: Wilfredo

texts.es: Wilfredo, es un hombre soltero y trabajador de 34 años, que vive en compañía de sus padres en su casa propia. Como joven tiene muchas ambiciones. Estudió Farmacia en un instituto reconocido de la localidad; pero sus deseos son consolidarse en un negocio propio, por ello hace 5 años comenzó a dedicar su tiempo y sus fuerzas en la agricultura. En los terrenos de sus padres siembra una variedad de productos como: alverja, papa y flor de gladiolo a gran escala. Asimismo, tiene un botiquín lleno de medicinas, que vende a los pobladores de su localidad cuando se sienten enfermos. En todo este tiempo le fue muy bien, tanto así; que logró obtener un auto propio con el que también hace trasporte público. Ahora consiente de que el precio de venta de los productos en el mercado central de su ciudad son muy buenos, desea mejorar la calidad de sus productos. Por eso comenzó a buscar tierras nuevas y descansadas para obtener frutos nutritivos. Este es su cuarto préstamo con KIVA y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Wilfredo, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Wilfredo is a single, hardworking, 34 year old man who lives with his parents in his own home.  He has many ambitions as a young man.  He studied to be a pharmacist at a well-known local school, but he wants to have his own business, so he started focusing his efforts on farming five years ago.  He raises a variety of products on his parents’ farmland, including peas, potatoes, and gladiolo flowers on a large scale.  He also has a chest full of medicines that he sells to the local people when they are feeling sick.  Things have been going well for him all this time, so he was able to buy his own car and also uses it to provide public transportation services.  The prices for his products in the central market are very good and he wants to improve their quality, so he is wants to find good land for new crops.  This will be his fourth Kiva loan and he is grateful for the financial support so that he can continue forward.  He is also committed to making his payments on time.  Wilfredo will use the S/ 2,000 to buy compost to feed his crops.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es: Yolanda, es una mujer luchadora de 51 años, que vive junto a su esposo Antonio, con el que educó y sacó adelante a sus 3 hijos, de los cuales solo vive con uno de ellos en su casa propia. Yolanda se dedica a la agricultura, está es su principal actividad económica desde hace 20 años. Sus principales cultivos, son de flor de gladiolo, alverja y papa, los que cuida y abona; pues sabe que de eso depende la buena venta en cada cosecha, ya que vende en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad, y dependiendo de la calidad, los lleva a la capital del país, donde le pagan un mejor precio. Ella tiene sembrado gladiolo y alverja que pronto cosechará y para lo cual se está preparando. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Yolanda, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Yolanda is a hardworking 51 year old woman who lives with her husband, Antonio, with whom she educated her three children and got them ahead.  Only one lives with them now.  Yolanda is a farmer and this has been her main financial activity for 20 years.  Her main crops are gladiolo flower, peas, and potatoes, which she cares for and fertilizes, because she knows that the sale of each harvest depends on that.  She sells at the main market in her city and takes some to the national capital, where they pay better prices, depending on the quality.  She has gladiolo and pea crops that she will harvest soon and is preparing for that.  This will be her fourth Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support that allows her to move forward.  She promises to make her payments on time and will use the S/ 2,000 to buy compost to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy compost

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es: Angélica, tiene 39 años, se caracteriza por ser alegre. Vive junto a su esposo Luis y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Angélica se dedica a la agricultura por eso todas las mañanas se dirige a sus sembríos de papa, oyuco, alverjas y habas, los cuales siembra en sus propios terrenos agrícolas, que gracias al trabajo conjunto que realizan como socios y esposos lograron adquirir. Ya tienen 11 años dedicándose a la agricultura, y lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder pasar la mayor parte de su tiempo en compañía de su familia. Por el desarrollo y éxito de su negocio, desea más adelante ahorrar el dinero suficiente para poder adquirir un camión y, de esa manera minimizar los gastos de trasporte que realizan desde sus terrenos al mercado mayorista de la ciudad, donde lleva a comercializar su cosecha. Además de ayudarle en su negocio de compra y venta de animales, que consiste en llevar toros, vacas, burros y carneros a la feria ganadera que se realiza en una ciudad cercana donde vende a un buen precio cada ejemplar. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar todas sus cuotas de manera puntual. Angélica, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Angelica is 39 years old and is known for being a happy person.  She lives with her husband, Luis, and their three children in a home of their own.  Angelica is a farmer and every morning she goes to her potato, oyuco, peas, and bean crops, which she raises on her own farmland, thanks to the work they do together as partners and as a married couple.  They’ve been farming for 11 years and what she likes the best is that she can spend most of the time with her family.  Through her business’ success, she wants to save up enough money to get a truck so she can minimize the cost of transportation from her land to the market to sell her harvest.  It will also help her with her animal sales business, which consists of taking bulls, cows, donkeys, and steer to the livestock market in a nearby town, where each animal sells for a good price.  This will be her fourth Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support she will receive in order to move ahead.  She promises to make her payments on time.  Angelica will use the S/ 2,000 to buy compost to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Sinai Group

texts.es:
La señora Maria es madre soltera, tiene 35 años de edad, de escolaridad primaria completa, tiene 1 hijo que esta estudiando, se dedica a atender su tienda de artículos de consumo diario, inició este negocio con una tiendesita y a la fecha lleva 4 años de experiencia.

Organiza un grupo y solicita un prestamo que lo utilizará para la compra de productos de consumo diario para surtir su tienda, en el futuro desea tener una tienda grande en el centro del municipio. Las demás integrantes del grupo se dedican a actividades de comercio.
texts.en:
Maria is a single mother, with one child who is in school. She is 35 years old, and has a completed primary school education. She works looking after her shop, selling daily staple items. She began this business with a very small shop, and now has four years of experience.

Maria is a group organiser. She is seeking this loan in order to buy staple goods to stock her shop. In the future she would like to have a large shop in the centre of her town.

The other members of the group also work in commercial activities.

loans.use: to buy staple goods.

loans.name: Siah

texts.en:
Please meet 31-year-old Siah from Buchanan, which is the capital city of Grand Bassa County and is located by the sea. It is well known for its beaches and delicious fish. Many logging companies are also based in the city. Residents of the city love eating fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. Most people in the city speak Bassa, one of the indigenous languages of Liberia. 

Siah is a college student and is married. She describes herself as a hardworking woman. Her spouse is a businessman. She has four children between 3 and 13. All of her children are in school and live at home. 

Siah has a shop where she sells used clothes. She has been in business for four years and works every day for five hours per day. With this loan, Siah will buy more used clothes to resell. One of the greatest challenges that she faces is to increase her sales. She transports her goods by taxi. She started her business with money from her husband. She is proud of her business because of the profits she earns. Her future plan is to complete her studies.  She thanks you in advance for your support!

loans.use: to buy more used clothes to resell.

loans.name: Mammie

texts.en:
This is Mammie from Liberia. She resides in Buchanan, the capital city of Grand Bassa County.  The county is located by the sea and is known for its beaches and fish. In addition, many logging companies are also located in the city. People in Buchanan are known in the country for their love of fufu, a cassava-based dough typically eaten with soup or sauce. 

Mammie is 30 and married with three children.  Her children are between the ages of 1 and 20. Only one child is currently living at home and two are in school.  

Mammie has had a business selling fish for the past four years. She will use the loan proceeds to purchase more fish for her business. On average, she works 10 hours a day at her business from Monday to Saturday. She started her business with a small amount of money from her fiancée. She transports her merchandise by a shared taxi. She cites the rainy season as her biggest challenge. Her favorite part of her business is controlling her own money. In the future, she would like to build a modern shop.  

She is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Natividad

texts.en:
Natividad is a tomato farmer from Mexico who is trying to reduce her operating costs. Her tomato greenhouse requires increasingly expensive, fossil-fuel based agrochemical fertilizers; the rising costs are cutting into her profits and putting into question the viability of her farm. As a result, she is investing in a 6-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigestor.

By investing in this 6-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigestor, she will eliminate the piled manure on her property, improving hygiene, reducing smells, and dramatically reducing the number of flies breeding on her farm. She will also shift from agrochemical fertilizer to biofertilizer for use on her farm.

This loan represents 39% of the total cost of her Sistema Biobolsa biodigestor.

loans.use: To purchase a 6-cubic-meter Sistema Biobolsa biodigestor.

loans.name: Julio

texts.es: Julio es un pequeño productor de café que vive junto a su esposa y 5 hijos en una comunidad rural al norte de Nicaragua. Él es parte del grupo de afiliados a la Asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC) que está certificado por Comercio Justo. En el último ciclo obtuvo 200 quintales de café pergamino, además de 40 quintales de frijoles. Para este ciclo de café, Julio está solicitando un crédito para garantizar la fertilización de su cafetal, con lo cual está seguro mejorará la calidad y productividad de este rubro. Su objetivo es seguir creciendo para darle un mejor futuro a su familia y considera que el rubro café tiene un gran potencial para lograrlo.
texts.en:
Julio is a small coffee producer who lives with his wife and five children in a rural community of Northern Nicaragua. He is a member of Asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC), which is fair-trade certified.

Last season, he produced 200 quintals of parchment coffee and 40 quintals of beans. For this coffee season, Julio is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for his coffee plantation, which will improve the quality and productivity of his produce. His goal is to continue growing and give his family a better future. He believes that growing coffee is a good way to achieve it.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his coffee plantation.

loans.name: Ileana Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Ileana es originaria de la ciudad de Managua. Tiene 59 años de edad, soltera y madre de 5 hijos. Es de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería desde hace 5 años. Esta agradecida con Kiva y MiCredito por la ayuda que le brindaron en el  financiamiento anterior  ya que pudo estabilizar su negocio y mejorar su nivel de vida. Solicita este nuevo crédito para comprar  productos tales como: Arroz, azúcar, frijoles, golosinas,  jabón, pasta dental, entre otros con el fin de surtir su negocio y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.  Estima que el préstamo será de mucho beneficio para crecer como comerciante. Su expectativa es cumplir sus planes futuros.
texts.en:
Ileana is originally from Managua. She is a 59-year-old single mother of five children. She works as a saleswoman and has had a grocery store for five years. She is grateful to Kiva and MiCredito for the help they have given her and the previous loan, which helped her to stabilize her business and improve her quality of life.

Ileana is requesting a new loan to buy products such as rice, sugar, beans, sweets, soap and tooth paste, stock her store and fulfill her customers’ needs. She believes that this loan will help her to grow as a saleswoman. She has some plans for the future that she wants to realize.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, sweets, soap and tooth paste, among other things.

loans.name: Lucio Vidal

texts.es: Lucio es un pequeño productor de la zona norte de Nicaragua. Cuenta con 36 años de edad y 3 hijos que ha procreado junto a su compañera, con los cuales vive en su pequeña finca de 4 manzanas, de las cuales 2 son de café. Este pequeño productor ha tenido obtenido 40, 35 y 50 quintales de café pergamino en los últimos 3 ciclos. Para este nuevo ciclo, él está solicitando un crédito para garantizar la fertilización y el foleo de su cafetal según los requerimientos técnicos de su plantación, a fin de mejorar la calidad e incrementar la producción. Considera que con su esfuerzo y cuidado podrá obtener mejores rendimientos y con ellos mayores ingresos que le permitirán darle mejores condiciones a su familia.
texts.en: Lucio is a small farmer in northern Nicaragua. He is 36 years old and has 3 children with his wife. They live on their small 7 acre farm, 2 of which are for coffee. This small farmer has produced 40, 35 and 50 quintals of parchment coffee the last 3 cycles. For this new cycle, he is asking for a loan to guarantee fertilizer and foliar for his coffee crop, according to basic technical requirements for his coffee, in order to improve the product quality. He believes that with his hard work and care he will be able to obtain better yields and with them better income that will allow him to give his family better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and foliar for his coffee crop.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: Juan tiene 49 años de edad, vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos en una comunidad rural de Nicaragua. Tiene más de 25 años de trabajar con café y actualmente, además de este rubro cultiva banano el cual comercializa a nivel local durante todo el año. Este pequeño productor ha tenido 3 créditos de la Asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC), a la cual está afiliado y forma parte del grupo de productores certificados bajo Comercio Justo. En el último ciclo el rendimiento de café por manzana de este productor fue de 24 quintales pergamino. Para mejorar la calidad y los rendimientos de su cafetal, está solicitando un crédito para la compra de insumos que le permita garantizar el mantenimiento adecuado de las plantaciones de café. El está seguro que con la aplicación oportuna de insumos podrá tener mejores resultados en el siguiente ciclo y podrá obtener mayores utilidades para el bienestar de su familia.
texts.en: Juan is 49 years old. He lives with his wife and children in a rural community in Nicaragua. He has been working with coffee for more than 25 years. Right now he is also working growing bananas, which he sells at a local level all year long. This small farmer has had 3 loans from the Asociación Pueblos en Acción Comunitaria (PAC), of which he is a member. He is a part of the group of certified Fair Trade farmers. In the last cycle, his coffee yield per 1.73 acres was 25 quintals of parchment coffee. In order to improve the quality and yields of his coffee crop, he is asking for a loan to buy materials that will allow him to guarantee sufficient maintenance for his coffee plants. He is sure that with the timely application of materials he will be able to have better results in the next cycle and be able to obtain better profits for his family's well being.

loans.use: to buy materials to do maintenance on his coffee crop.

loans.name: Medardo

texts.es:
Medardo, es un hombre de 48 años, está casado y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Medardo se dedica a la agricultura desde hace 10 años por eso se dirige siempre a sus campos de cultivo en donde cuida de sus plantaciones de alverja, papa, flor de gladiolo, habas y maíz. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder disfrutar de la tranquilidad del trabajo en el campo; “también me gusta comercializar mi cosecha, pues veo concretado tanto esfuerzo”, menciona. Ahora tiene pensado renovar sus plantaciones de flor de gladiolo, ya que se acerca la temporada de mayor demanda. Además de trabajar muy duro en sus cultivos de papa y alverja que cosechará en el próximo mes. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Medardo, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Medardo is 48 years old, married, and has two children who live with them in their home.  Medardo has been a farmer for 10 years and goes to his fields where he raises peas, potatoes, gladiolo flower, beans, and corn.  What he likes the most about his job is being able to enjoy the tranquility of the fields, “I also like selling my harvest because I can see the fruits of my labor,” he says.  Now he wants to renew his gladiolo flower crop because the highest demand season approaches.  He also works hard on his potato and pea crops, which he will harvest in the next month.  This will be his fourth Kiva loan and he continues to be grateful for the financial support he is getting.  He also promises to make his payments on time

Medardo will use the S/ 3,000 to buy compost to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es: Flora de 32 años, está casada con Elvis y tiene 2 hijos con quienes vive en una casa alquilada. Flora se dedica a la agricultura, siembra arvejas y papas, pero afirma que el conviene sembrar arvejas, por sus precios altos y por cosecharse 2 ó 3 veces al año.“Normalmente siembro 3 bolsas de semillas. De una bolsa cosecho 30 sacos.”, menciona. Además su esposo trabaja en la mina, aportando otros ingresos para su familia. Y cuando cesan sus labores en esa empresa, dedica su tiempo a cultivar la tierra. Flora está contenta con sus labores en el campo, por que le agrada su labor, a pesar de ser muy cansado y riesgoso. La ventaja que tiene ella, es que sus productos son vendidos al por mayor inmediatamente, por eso no duda en continuar con su actividad, a pesar de lo cansado que suele ser. Una de sus metas es adquirir otros terrenos para ampliar sus cosechas y seguir sembrando. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Flora, invertirá los S/.4000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Flora is 32 years old and married to Elvis.  They have two children and all live together in a rented home.  Flora is a farmer who raises peas and potatoes, but she says that its more advantageous to raise peas because of their high price and because they can be harvested two or three times per year.  “I usually plant three bags of seeds and I harvest 30 sacks per bag,” she says.  Her husband works in a mine, bringing more income into the family.  When he finishes his work with this company, he spends time working the land.

Flora is happy with her work in the field, because she likes her work even though it’s tiring and risky.  She has the advantage that her products are mostly sold immediately, so she has no doubts about continuing her activity, no matter how tiring it is.  One of her goals is to acquire more land on which to expand her harvest and keep planting.

This will be her fourth Kiva loan.  She is happy for the financial support  and promises to make her payments on time.  She will use the S/4,000 to buy compost to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Lidia

texts.es: Lidia, tiene 50 años, enviudó hace tan solo 4 meses y trabaja arduamente para sacar adelante a sus 2 hijos con quienes vive en su casa propia. Los días son aún difíciles pero a pesar de ello, sigue trabajando como hace 20 años; pero ahora los hace sola ya que quiere mantener a sus cultivos de la mejor manera. Sus principales sembríos constan de papa, alverja, maíz y habas. Lo que más le gusta, es la tranquilidad del campo, por ello sigue trabajando arduamente, ya que sabe que es el único aliado que tiene en estos momentos difíciles. Ahora tiene sembrado papa, los cuales están creciendo satisfactoriamente, y cuenta que ya están floreando, por ello dentro de 3 meses cosechará y venderá en el mercado mayorista de su ciudad. Los planes de ella son mejorar sus sembríos y darle una estabilidad a su familia.  Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Lidia, invertirá los S/.3800 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Lidia is 50 years old.  She became a widow only four months ago and she works arduously to get her two children ahead.  The days are still difficult but despite that she continues to work like she did 20 years ago, but now she works alone and she wants to maintain her crops in the best way possible.  Her main crops are potatoes, peas, corn, and beans.  What she likes the best is the tranquility of the fields and she continues to work arduously because she knows that the only allies she has are the difficult moments.  Now she plants potatoes, which are growing satisfactorily.  She says that they are flowering and she will harvest within three months and sell it in the main market in town.  Her plans are to improve her harvest and provide stability to her family.  This will be her fourth Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support so she can move ahead.  She promises to make her payments on time.  Lidia will use the S/ 3,800 from her loan to buy compost to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy compost

loans.name: Margot

texts.es:
Margot, es una mujer honesta de 34 años, que junto a su esposo Elmer, cuidan de sus 2 hermosos hijos. En unión familiar ellos viven en la casa que compraron hace 6 años. Para poder mantener a su familia, está valerosa mujer se dedica a la agricultura y al trasporte público. Todas las mañanas su esposo Elmer, sale a trabajar con su auto; trasladando a los pobladores del caserío a la ciudad principal,mientras que Margot, dedica su tiempo y esfuerzo a cuidar de sus sembríos de habas, alverja y flor de gladiolo, ya tiene 14 años realizando está labor. Lo que más le gusta a ella es viajar a la ciudad principal, en donde comercializa su producción. “Estar en el campo es maravilloso, no se ganará mucho pero te encuentras tranquila”, afirma; por esa razón desea seguir mejorando sus sembríos. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual.
Margot, invertirá los S/.3000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en:
Margot is an honest 34 year old woman who, along with her husband Elmer, cares for her two children.  They have lived together for six years.  This brave woman is a farmer and provides public transportation so that she can support her family.  Every morning her husband, Elmer, goes out with his car to work with the people in the main city, while Margot spends her time and energy caring for her bean, pea, and gladiolo flower crops.  She’s been doing this for 14 years.  What she enjoys most is going to the main city where she sells her products. “Being in the fields is marvelous.  I don’t earn much but it’s relaxing,” she says.  For this reason she wants to improve her crops.  This will be her fourth Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support she gets so she can move ahead.  She also promises to make her payments on time.

Margot will use the S/ 3,000 to buy compost to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Nerida

texts.es: Nerida, es una valiente mujer de 37 años; que en compañía de su esposo Manuel cuidan de sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Nerida se dedica a la agricultura, sus principales sembríos constan de alverja, papa, y flor de gladiolo. Lo que más le gusta a ella es poder ayudar a su esposo en los gastos familiares, “me siento realizada”, afirma. Pero está pareja de esposos, conjuntamente, viajan a la capital del país donde comercializan su producción después de cada cosecha. Para más adelante desea mejorar sus cultivos, en principal sus sembríos de flor de gladiolo; pues según afirma tiene mayor demando durante todo el año. Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Nerida, invertirá el dinero en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Nerida is a brave 37 year old woman.  She’s married to Manuel; they have two children and a home of their own.  Nerida is a farmer and her main crops are peas, potatoes, and gladiolo flower.  What she likes is that she is able to help her husband with the family expenses.  “I feel alive,” she says.  This couple travels together to the capital city to sell their harvest every season.  She wants to improve her production in the future, mainly her gladiolo flower crop because she says that she has a greater demand all year.  This will be her fourth Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support she receives so she can continue moving forward.  She also promises to make her payments on time.  Nerida will use the money from this loan to buy compost to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy compost.

loans.name: Nora

texts.es: Nora, tiene 46 años, y en compañía de su esposo Percy, salen adelante en su casa propia. Nora se dedica a la agricultura y siembra productos como: flor de gladiolo, habas, alverjas y papa; pero hace algunos años Percy, se fue a trabajar fuera de la ciudad, dejando en manos de Nora el cuidado de sus terrenos agrícolas, los que gracias a su buen juicio logró sacar adelante. Una vez al mes viaja a la capital de país a vender sus cosechas. Por toda la capacidad que está demostrando desea mejorar sus sembríos y así poder generar mejores ganancias. Por ahora está centrada en su próxima cosecha de papa y alverja, además de sentirse feliz de ayudar a personas como ella a salir adelante.Este es su cuarto préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecida por el apoyo financiero que recibe para seguir adelante, además se compromete a pagar sus cuotas de manera puntual. Nora, invertirá los S/.1000 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Nora is 46 years old and she and her husband, Percy, have their own home.  Nora is a farmer and raises gladiolo flower, beans, peas, and potatoes, but Percy went to work outside the city a few years ago, leaving Nora in charge of the farmland, which she did well with, thanks to her good judgment.  Once more she goes to the capital to sell her harvest.  She wants to use all her demonstrated ability to improve her crops and in this way generate greater profits.  For now she is focused on her next potato and pea crop, as well as being happy to be able to help others get ahead.  This will be her fourth Kiva loan and she is grateful for the financial support she receives to get ahead.  She also promises to make her payments on time.  Norma will invest the S/ 1,000 in compost to feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy compost

loans.name: Corina

texts.es: Doña corina  de 46 años de edad, vive en casa propia  con su esposo y  sus dos hijos , ella tiene un negocio de venta de tortillas ubicado en su lugar de residencia, por su amabilidad ha sabido ganarse la confianza sus clientes, doña corina está solicitando un crédito para poder invertirlo en capital de trabajo  y comprar maíz por mayor y cal y poder ofrecerle a  su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Corina is 46 years old and lives in a home of her own, along with her husband and two children.  She has a business selling tortillas located in her home and she has managed to win her customers’ trust because of her friendship.  Corina is asking for a loan to buy dried corn in bulk and lime so she can provide a better quality of life for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Sonia Leticia

texts.es: Doña Sonia de 32 años de edad, vive en casa alquilada junto a su compañero de vida y su hija, ella se dedica a la confección de ropa desde hace 8 años, es una persona amable, responsable, y con excelentes referencias, posee una  gran clientela que demanda su trabajo, de esta manera ha logrado solventar algunos de sus gastos, doña Sonia solicita un crédito para invertir en su negocio compra de telas, hilos, tijeras, botones, agujas, etc. para poder satisfacer  la gran demanda que posee, obtener mayores ingresos y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Sonia is 32 years old and lives in a rented home with her life partner and her daughter.  She makes clothing and has for eight years.  She is a friendly, responsible person with excellent references and she has a many customers.  In this way she has managed to pay some of her expenses.  Sonia is asking for a loan to invest in her business.  She will buy fabric, thread, scissors, buttons, needles, etc. so that she can satisfy the large demand, increase her income, and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es: Doña Ana de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a  su madre y su hija, ella posee un negocio de venta de medicina farmacéutica desde hace 5 años, los comercializa de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados  y en su casa por las tardes, es una persona responsable, honesta , con muy buen carácter y además posee valores cristianos, posee una gran clientela que demanda sus productos por la calidad y amabilidad con que los atiende, de esta manera ha logrado solventar muchos de sus gastos familiares, doña Ana solicita un crédito para invertir en su negocio y comprar  mas medicamentos por mayor  para surtir mas su negocio y aumentar su nivel de ventas  y así mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en: Ana is 38 years old and lives in her own home with her mother and daughter.  She has been selling medicine for five years and sells on foot in the different markets and from her home in the evenings.  She is a responsible, honest person of good character and with Christian values.  She has a large customer demand because of the quality of her products and her friendly service.  In this way she was able to pay many of the family expenses.  Ana is asking for this loan to invest in her business and buy more medicine in quantity, so that she can better stock her business, increase her sales, and improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to buy medications.

loans.name: Khurshed

texts.ru: Хуршед добрый человек. Ему 35 года. Он женат и на воспитании имеет 4 детей. Его жена трудолюбивая женщина, но она нигде не работает, так как она является домохозяйкой и занимается воспитанием детей. Хуршед имеет высшее образование. Он работает более 16 лет в Отделе Внутренних Дел на должности майора милиции. Он хорошо знает свою работу и выполняет на высшем уровне. Хуршед планирует отремонтировать свой дом. Он не имеет сбережения для покупки строительных материалов, как краски, цемент и т.п. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 6000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Khurshed is a good person. He is 35 years old. He is married and has four children in his care. His wife is a hardworking woman, but she does not work anywhere because she is a homemaker and raises their children. Khurshed has a higher education. He has worked for more than 16 years in the Ministry of Internal Affairs in the post of police chief. He knows his profession very well and fulfills his position to the best of his abilities. Khurshed plans to repair his house. He does not have the savings to purchase building materials such as paint, cement, etc. He is a requesting a loan in the amount of 6000 somoni for the purchase of building materials. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: To purchase building materials such as paint and cement for repairing his house

loans.name: Ismatullo

texts.ru: Исматулло 58 лет. Он женат на доброй женщине и всю жизнь прожил с ней счастливую жизнь. Они воспитали прекрасных детей. Исматулло всегда старался ради благополучия своих детей и жены. Он имеет средне- специальное образование по специальности педагог. Он более 35 лет работает в средней школе преподавателем. Он занимается еще и земледелием, так как его зарплата маленькая и не хватает для обеспечения семьи. Он год за годом развевает свой бизнес по земледелию. Он должен купить минеральные удобрения для выращивания сельхоз культур. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 7000 сомони. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Ismatullo is 58 years old. He is married to a kind woman and has had a happy life with her for his entire life. They raised wonderful children. Ismatullo always strives on behalf of his children and wife. He has a secondary specialized education in the field of pedagogy.  For more than 35 years, he has worked in a secondary school as a teacher. He also practices farming, as his salary is small and is not enough to provide for his family. Year by year, he develops his farming business. He needs to buy mineral fertilizer for the growth of his crops. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 7000 somoni. He awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: To buy mineral fertilizers for his land

loans.name: Jahongir

texts.ru: Джахонгир трудолюбивый человек. Ему 21 года. Он не женат. Джахонгир более 2 года работает в частной компании строителем. Он живет вместе со своими родителями и старается, чтобы их семья жила в достатке. Джахонгир несколько лет назад начал постройку нового дома. Он не закончил постройку дома, так как не имеет денег. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов как цемент, древесина, кирпич и т.п. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Jahongir is a hardworking person. He is 21 years old. He is unmarried. Jahongir has worked for more than 2 years as a builder in a private company. He lives with his parents and works hard so that his family can live comfortably. Several years ago, Jahongir began the construction of a new house. He did not finish the house because he did not have the money. He is requesting a loan in the amount of 5000 somoni to buy building materials such as cement, lumber, bricks, etc. He awaits your kindness and relies upon your generosity.

loans.use: To buy building materials such as cement, lumber, and bricks for building his new house

loans.name: Vera

texts.ru: Вера работает на ферме, получает стабильный доход. Живет в своем доме вместе с сыном, невесткой и своей внучкой. Вера хочет сделать ремонт в коридоре, комнатах и гостинной. Нужно снять старую штукатурку, заделать стены в тех местах, где отваливаются, затем наклеить обои, а также заменить двери. Вера просит предоставить ей кредит в размере 20,000 гривен.
texts.en: Vera works on a farm and receives a stable income. She lives in her home with her son, daughter-in-law, and granddaughter. Vera wants to make repairs in the hallway, bedrooms, and living room. She needs to remove the old plaster, repair the walls in places where it is falling off, and then put up wallpaper and replace the doors. Vera has asked for a loan of 20,000 hryvnia.

loans.use: to remodel her house

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.en: Alejandro comes from a farming family dedicated to innovation. As a result, he is always looking for ways to improve his yields while concurrently maintaining or reducing operating costs.
