This is Patrick O., he is 35 years old and lives in Nimba, a County in Liberia that shares a border with Guinea and Cote D’Ivoire.  Because of its status as a border county, trade is the primary activity in the region.  The town also has the second highest population in Liberia.
Patrick O. is married and has three children aged between 7 and 16. They are presently in school and live at home. He finished 12th grade then decided to start his business. For the past three years he has been running a shop which sells fashionable clothes in the local market. He has a lot of customers and makes lots of profit every day.  He is requesting a loan to purchase more fashionable clothes such as jeans, T-shirts, and blouses for his business. He plans to expand his business and send his children to a good quality school.

loans.use: to purchase more fashionable clothes such as jeans, T-shirts, and blouses for his business.

loans.name: Fedelina

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, four of whom are in school, Fedelina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns an additional income from buying and selling dried fish. Fedelina is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

Fedelina has been sustaining her business activities through the past eight loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her fishing boat.

loans.name: Hayitgul

texts.ru:
Хайтгул с 1999 года успешно продвигает свой торговый бизнес. Она обратилась в организацию за повторным кредитом. Предыдущие кредиты она брала для приобретения товара для оборота. У нее есть муж, сын и дочь. Дети еще учатся. Хайтгул любит свою семью и заботится о них, и они отвечают ей тем же. Сейчас у нее имеется торговая точка на рынке, где она занимается продажей разнообразной одежды, в частности она продает женские платки, носки, мужские и женские джинсовые брюки, детские формы, шорты и т.д. К тому же около ее дома расположен детский сад. Каждое утро и вечером когда приводят и уводят детей она ставит там столик и ее сын продает печенье, шоколад, игрушки и т.д.   
Свой следующий кредит Хайтгул берет для развития бизнеса. На часть суммы кредита она собирается купить ассортимент сезонной одежды, а часть использовать для приобретения детских игрушек, печенье, шоколада и т.д.
texts.en:
Hayitgul has successfully developed her own retail business since 1999.  She is once again turning to the organization (MLO Humo and Partners) to request an additional loan.  She used her previous loans to buy merchandise to renew her inventory.

Hayitgul is married and has a son and a daughter.  Her children are still in school.  She loves her family and wants the best for them.  Her family also cares a lot for her. 

Hayitgul currently has a vending outlet at the market and she sells a variety of clothes: women's scarves, socks, men and women's denim pants, children's school uniforms, shorts etc.  She also lives close to a preschool.  Every morning and evening, when parents take their children to school, she sets a table outside and her son sells such goods as cookies, chocolate and toys.

Hayitgul is taking this loan to develop her business.  She plans to use part of her money to buy a variety of seasonal clothes while the rest will be used to purchase toys, cookies and chocolate.

loans.use: to buy a variety of seasonal clothes as well as as other goods such as children's toys, cookies and chocolate to develop her business.

loans.name: Firuza

texts.ru: Фируза 29-летняя замужняя женщина, проживающая в районе Пяндж. Она в течение 5 лет занимается выращиванием крупного рогатого скота. У нее сейчас в хозяйстве две коровы. Ей необходимо увеличить поголовье скота для развития бизнеса. Фируза ждет вашей поддержки. Она очень хочет приобрести пару скотов и продолжить свой бизнес по животноводству. И таким образом улучшить свое семейное положение.
texts.en:
Firuza 29-year-old married woman who lives in the area of ​​the Panj. For 5 years she's been engaged in growing cattle and now has two cows on her farm. She would like to increase the livestock for her business development. Firuza is awaiting your support. 

She really wants to buy a pair of cattle and continue her animal husbandry business, and thus improve her family's well-being.

loans.use: to purchase a pair of cattle

loans.name: Rosa Emilia

texts.es: Doña rosa de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia  junto a su  hijo de 17 años de edad quien estudia actualmente,  su negocio consta de vender tortillas  en su lugar de residencia, ella es una persona muy amable y honesta por eso las clientes la prefieren,  doña Rosa está  solicitando un  crédito para poder invertirlo en lo que  es la compra de maíz  por quintales y así poder generar más fuentes de ingresos y una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Rosa is 49 years old and lives with her 17 year old son, currently attending school.  She sells tortillas out of her home and is a very friendly and honest person with many customers who prefer to buy from her.  Rosa is asking for this loan so she can invest in corn by the quintal so she can generate more sources of income and better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy corn.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en: Florence is 46 years old and married to James. Together they support a family of eight. Florence runs a retail shop selling general goods in Awasi, which is served by KADET’s Kapsabet office. This has been her income-generating business for the past two years; she receives an average monthly income of KES 20,000. She has taken out a fifth loan from KADET Ltd, of KES 70,000. She plans to use the whole amount she has borrowed to purchase more mattresses (ten 42x6 pieces and ten 48x6 pieces) and 50 sets of sofa cushions to sell, in order to boost her business. Her dream is to expand her business into a supermarket and to meet her family’s financial needs.

loans.use: to purchase mattresses and sofa cushions to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Eleonor

texts.en:
Eleonor is 57 years old and married with ten children, two of whom are in school.

She earns a living by farming rice and vegetables in the Philippines. She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requested a new loan to further build her business. Eleonor is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF to buy additional fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Eleonor has been farming rice and vegetables for five years and also earns additional income from raising livestock.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Edwin Roberto

texts.es:
Edwin es un hombre de 36 años, vive en la ciudad de Nazca con su esposa y sus dos hijos, el es muy trabajador y dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Edwin no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional.
Por iniciativa propia, Edwin trabaja como taxista brindando servicios de transporte, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien porque conoce las zonas donde encontrar mayor cantidad de pasajeros.
Edwin se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada cubrirá los gastos de mantenimiento y refacción de su taxi, de esta manera tendrá su herramienta de trabajo en mejores condiciones, así pues Edwin seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener su empresa de transporte.
texts.en:
Edwin is a 36 year old man. He lives in the city of Nazca with his wife and two children. He is very hardworking and devotes all his efforts to helping his family get ahead. Unfortunately, due to a lack of resources and to the need to work, Edwin was unable to study for a professional career.

On his own initiative, Edwin works as a taxi cab driver, providing transportation services. He works every day for approximately 10 hrs. and believes that he is doing well because he knows the zones where he can find the largest number of passengers.

Edwin is very grateful to Kiva lenders because, thanks to their help, he will cover the costs of maintaining and repairing his taxi. In this way he will have his work tool in the best condition. Thus he will continue working and striving to fulfill his great dream of having his own transportation business.

loans.use: to maintain and repair his taxi.

loans.name: Dayana Madelen

texts.es:
Dayana es una joven de 19 años, vive en la ciudad de Cañete, en el distrito de Imperial con su pequeño hijo, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Dayana no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Derecho.
Por iniciativa propia, Dayana trabaja como obrero de campo en un fundo agrícola, ella trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su dedicación y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Dayana se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada comprara una cama,ya que actualmente ella y su hijo comparten la misma cama, de esta manera Dayan brindara mayor bienestar para su familia, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Dayana is a young person of 19 years old and she lives in the city of Cañete in the district of Imperial with her young son. She is a very kind, hardworking person, who puts all her effort into taking her family forward; unfortunately due to lack of financial resources and because of the need to work Dayana has not been able to study for a professional career in Law. 

On her own initiative Dayana works as a field labourer in an agricultural estate. She works every day for approximately 8 hours and believes that it is going well because of her dedication and because of the kind way she treats others. 

Dayana is very grateful to the Kiva  lenders, because thanks to the help they have offered she will buy a bed as currently she and her son share the same bed. In this way Dayana will offer greater well-being for her family, so she will continue working and striving to achieve her great dream of studying for a professional career.

loans.use: to buy a bed.

loans.name: Robert L.

texts.en:
Robert L. is 49 years old and lives in Ganta city, one of the most talked about cities in Nimba County and the second-largest populated county in Liberia; it is rich in natural resources. He’s married with three children, ages 3, 8, and 21; all live at home and attend school. For the past 10 years, he has been running a gas station. Robert L. has requested this loan to purchase more gasoline in order to have his business turn into a bigger one. 

The problem he faces is the road's condition to his gas station, because some of his customers complain of bad roads leading to his station that cause them not to buy every day from him. He started this business by selling for his father on a table market, and learned this was of business from his friends. What he likes about this business is that he meets new people and makes profit every day; it makes him proud of having money in his home every day. He spends eight hours on his business each day, and tankers always bring his product. In the future, he wants to open another gas station in the next community.

loans.use: to purchase more gasoline in order to have his business turn into a bigger one.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Glenda

texts.en:
Glenda works hard to support her family. Glenda is married and has a motorcycle transport services business in the Philippines.

Glenda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Glenda has been in this business for three years.

In the future, Glenda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith, 45, is married with three children who are in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur who has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Judith requested a PHP 19500 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional items like fabric, needles, and a sewing machine.

Judith has been in this business for two years. In the future, Judith would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items like fabric, needles, and a sewing machine

loans.name: Lucilla

texts.en:
Lucilla is 63 years old, married and has seven children. 

Lucilla is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Lucilla requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lucilla has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lucilla would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is a 28-year-old man from a place known as Suna Migori county, which is located in the Western part of Kenya. He is a married man and supports four people in his family. His spouse is also in business in the same market. He has a metal shop where he does welding. He has been doing this for the last eight years, and he receives a monthly income of KES 15,000. He has applied for his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to increase his working capital by buying more metal for welding. He will use the anticipated profit to expand his welding business to be the preferred welding shop in the area in terms of quality and variety in welded items. His dream is to have a better life and to take good care of his family.

loans.use: to buy more metal for welding.

loans.name: Fadi

texts.en:
Fadi is a 24-year-old single man from Gaza city. He lives with his family in a small house. His father is an employee in a local company and earns a low wage. This wage barely covers the family's needs. Fadi decided to help his father cover part of the family's expenses so he is running an electrical appliance store. This store has been open for a year and a half. It is a profitable business but still needs improvement. 
Fadi took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy more stock for his electrical appliance store. This will help him to improve his business and also his income. 
Fadi appears in the photo while he was in his store

loans.use: to buy more stock for his electrical appliances store

loans.name: Enayat

texts.en:
Enayat is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online so her husband appears in the photo
Enayat is a 38-year-old married woman from Dier el balah near Gaza city. She is a mother of four children, two boys and two girls. Enayat's husband is an employee in the public sector who earns a low wage which is not enough to cover all the family's needs. So, he also works transporting goods for traders on his rickshaw. This gives him additional income so he can pay for all the necessities for his family. 
Enayat took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to repair the rickshaw that her husband uses for work. By applying this loan, Enayat's husband will be able to continue to use his rickshaw and earn a good income.

loans.use: to repair the rickshaw that her husband uses for transporting goods.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta es una persona muy emprendedora y responsable, vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y su hija de 3 años de edad, hace 4 años tiene una pequeña panadería en su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de su negocio  logra solventar algunos gastos de su familia, la clienta solita un crédito para la compra de insumos para su negocio tales como: moldes, harina, azúcar, batidora, etc.  con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
The client is a very enterprising and responsible person. She lives in her own house with her life partner and their three-year-old daughter. 

She has had a small bakery in her home for four years. With what she obtains from the business she manages to pay for some of her living costs. 

The client is applying for a loan to buy supplies for the business such as: molds, flour, sugar, a mixer, etc. With this she hopes to offer her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy molds, flour, sugar, a mixer, etc.

loans.name: Simion

texts.en:
Simion is 26 years old, married, and supports three of his children aged between six and two years old.  He has been earning a salary of KES 30,000 from his auto spare parts shop in Edama Ravine, Kenya. He has done this business for over eight years.

Simion is now servicing his 3rd loan of KES 100,000 from KADET LTD and intends to use this amount to purchase motor spare parts for resale. The anticipated profits will be used to plough back to his business and increase his stock.  

Simion's desire is to live happily with his family.

loans.use: to purchase motor spare parts for resale

loans.name: Benson

texts.en:
Benson, 30, is in the transport business. He is married to Evana, a pharmacist. They are blessed with one child.  Benson is also a real estate manager, a business he does to supplement his income. He uses his monthly income of 22,850 Kenyan shillings to support his family. 

Benson is applying for his fourth loan term with KADET, after repaying the previous loans successfully. He will use this loan to insure and service his two motorbikes and rickshaw (a motorcycle with a passenger trailer). 

With the expected profit, Benson will expand his real estate business. 

His hopes and dreams are to buy a piece of land and secure a home for his family.

loans.use: To insure and service his two motorbikes and rickshaw (a motorcycle with a passenger trailer).

loans.name: Arnovis Arney

texts.es: Arnovis, a sus 25 años de edad es padre de un hijo de 5 años. Por falta de empleo y la dificultad para conseguir oportunidades laborales, él decidió buscar opciones que le permitieran generar recursos por cuenta propia, por esta razón montó un café internet, en el que trabaja todos los días des 6:00 am a 7:00 pm, de esta forma ha logrado salir adelante y generar los recursos para brindar el sustento a su pequeño hijo. Arnovis ha tenido que sobrepasar diversos obstáculos, especialmente con las personas que ha contratado para que le ayuden en el negocio, pues han sido muy deshonestas y le llevaban doble contabilidad, lo que le estaba generando pérdidas, en 4 meses ya ha cambiado de empleado 2 veces, sin embargo ha sabido sobrellevar la situación y salir nuevamente adelante. Actualmente solicita el crédito para invertirlo en la compra de activos fijos (computadores) con el fin de incrementar su capacidad instalada y poder satisfacer la demanda que tiene; esto se verá reflejado en el aumento del margen de utilidades que le genera la prestación del servicio, con lo que podrá mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia y seguir fortaleciendo su negocio, generar oportunidad de empleo y brindar a su hijo un mejor bienestar y educación para que crezca con unas bases sólidas y sea un hombre de bien.
texts.en:
Arnovis is 25 years old and the father of a five-year-old son.  Due to the lack of employment opportunities and difficulties in securing a job, he decided to look for ways to generate his own income.  For this reason, he opened an Internet café where he works every day from 6:00 A.M. to 7:00 P.M. so that he can get ahead.  This allows him to earn the money he needs to support his young son.  

Arnovis has had to overcome a variety of obstacles, especially with the people that he hired to help him with the business.  They were dishonest and engaged in fraudulent accounting, which resulted in losses.  Within the past four months, he has had to replace his employees twice.  Nonetheless, he has coped with the situation and moved forward.  

Arnovis is currently requesting a loan so that he can invest in fixed assets (computers) in order to increase his capacity and meet the existing demand.  This will be reflected in an increased profit margin from the service that he provides.  As a result, he will be able to improve his family’s living conditions and continue strengthening his business.  Arnovis will also be able to create job opportunities and provide his son with a better well-being and education so that he can grow up with a solid foundation and become a good man.

loans.use: to buy computers.

loans.name: Jayzalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of a child in school, Jayzalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from fruit vending. Jayzalyn is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy materials to repair her motorcycle, for her motorcycle transport business.

Jayzalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair the motorcycle she uses for her business.

loans.name: Maribet

texts.en:
Maribet is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 12000 through NWTF to purchase materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Maribet has been in this business for two years. Maribet earns additional income from buying and selling fruit.

Maribet has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials for the maintenance of her transport business

loans.name: Edis Rosmeri

texts.es:
Doña Edis tiene 33 años de edad ella es agricultora y ama de casa con un gran experiencia en el cultivo de maíz, frijoles y café. Ella es madre de 5 hijos los cuales en familia se involucran para desarrollar las diferentes actividades que a diario se realizan en el campo como limpieza, recolección del grano, abono, etc. Ella tiene un grado de educación completo cursado gracias al apoyo de sus padres a pesar de las diferentes dificultades en su juventud que se presentaban ya que no habían muchas opciones (centros estudiantiles) para escoger sin embargo le enseñaron a trabajar la tierra. Su producto al final de la cosecha es comercializado en las bodegas de las zonas aledañas, pulperías y en ocasiones intermediarios que llegan para re vender el producto en otras zonas.

Ella ha solicitado a la cooperativa COMIXMUL un financiamiento con el comprara para extender sus cultivos 25 libras de semilla de maíz certificada, 25 libras de semilla de frijol certificado, 9 QQ de fórmula 18-46-0 y 8 QQ de urea para dar asistencia y mantenimiento a los mismos.

Sus planes a futuro son los de mejorar su área de cultivo ampliarla y fortalecerla ya que de esa forma ella podrá aprovechar para cultivar más producto. Como madre de familia ofrecer un mejor estatus de vida a sus hijos y cumplir su propósito que es dejarles un patrimonio fortalecido y poder enviarlos a la universidad.
texts.en:
Edis is 33 years old, a farmer, and housewife with lots of experience in raising corn, beans, and coffee.  She is the mother of 5 who got involved in field activities, such as weeding, collecting the grains, fertilizing, etc.  She has a full education thanks to her parents’ support, despite the difficulties that they had in her youth, since there were not many options (schools) to choose from, however they taught her to work the land.  She sells her final harvest in stores in the area and surrounding locations and also to intermediaries who arrive to resell the product in other areas.  

She has asked a loan through COMIXMUL that she will use to expand her crops.  She will buy 25 pounds of scientific corn seed, 25 pounds of scientific bean seeds, 9 QQ of formula 18-46-0 and 8 QQ of urea to help maintain her crops.

Her future plans are to improve her crops, and expand and strengthen them so she can increase production.  As a mother she wants to provide a better life status to her children, be a good parent, and be able to send them to university.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Amrullo

texts.ru: Амрулло с города Вахдат, расположенный в 20 километрах от столицы. У него есть маленький магазин, где он занимается продажей продуктов питания и хозяйственных товаров. Ему 44 года, он женат и имеет 6 детей. Амрулло в своем магазине продает разнообразные товары, в частности конфеты, печенье, чай, сахар, а также необходимые хозяйственные товары и другие вещи. Он в этой сфере уже 5 лет и ему нравится свой бизнес. Он очень серьезно относится к своему бизнесу и обслуживает своих клиентов быстро и качественно. Амрулло берет кредит, чтобы расширить свой бизнес и увеличить ассортимент товаров.
texts.en: Amrullo is from a town of Vakhdat, located 20 kilometers from the capital. He has a small shop where he sells food and household goods. He is 44 years old, married and has six children. Amrullo in his shop sells a variety of goods, including chocolates, biscuits, tea, sugar, as well as necessary household goods and other goods. He's been engaged in this field for 5 years now and he likes the business. He's very serious about his business and serving its customers quickly and efficiently. Amrullo takes out a loan to expand his business and increase the range of goods.

loans.use: to buy food items and household goods to develop his grocery store business

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru: Шавкат имеет свою скотную ферму. К этому шагу его подтолкнул отец и он же научил его ухаживать за скотом. В данный момент Шавкат женат. Ему 36 лет. Он отец двоих детей - у него сын и дочь, которым по 9 и 12 лет. Его жена работает швеей, а дети ходят в школу. Семье Шавката нравится чем он занимается. Ведь помимо дохода он обеспечивает семью еще молоком и молочными продуктами. Шавкат и его семья работают на этой ферме уже 9 лет. Он запрашивает кредит для приобретения трех голов коров и телят, а также их корма, чтобы расширить свою деятельность.
texts.en: Shavkat has his own livestock farm.  His father encouraged this step and also taught him how to care for livestock.  At the present time, Shavkat is married.  He is 36 years old.  He is a father of two children; he has a son and a daughter, who are 9 and 12 years old.  His wife works as a seamstress, and children attend a school.  Shavkat's family likes his business, especially because, besides the income, he provides the family with milk and dairy products.  Shavkat and his family have been working on this farm for nine years.  He is requesting this loan to purchase three heads of cows and calves and also feed for them in order to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase three heads of cows and calves and also feed for them in order to expand his business

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca lives in Sanniquelle, the capital city of Nimba County. Nimba County is rich in natural resources, and living conditions there are much better than in the capital city of Liberia. Nimba is the second most-populated county in Liberia.

Rebecca is 47 years old, and she did not go to school. She is unmarried, and she has five children, whose ages are between 15 and 33 years. Only one of her children lives at home and attends school. With a little money from her fiancee (who is not working now), she managed to establish her business eight years ago. She learned this way of selling from her friends. She spends 10 hours per day on her business, from Monday to Saturday. One problem she faces in business is small income. She is requesting a loan, which she will use to purchase more foods to sell at the market, including oil, pepper, bananas, plantains and rice. Her dream is to own a house.

loans.use: to purchase more foods to sell including oil, pepper, bananas, plantains and rice.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña María de 47 años de edad, viven casa propia junto a su padre y a sus 2 hijos mayores de edad  los cuales trabajan y ayudan  en los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica a la agricultura principalmente a la siembra de arroz y frijol,  es una mujer trabajadora para poderle dar lo mejor a su familia y ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, semillas, herbicidas, controles de plaga, etc. y de esa manera mejorar sus ingresos y alcanzar una mejora calidad de vida  para su familia.
texts.en: Doña María de 47 años de edad, viven casa propia junto a su padre y a sus 2 hijos mayores de edad  los cuales trabajan y ayudan  en los gastos del hogar, ella se dedica a la agricultura principalmente a la siembra de arroz y frijol,  es una mujer trabajadora para poderle dar lo mejor a su familia y ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes, semillas, herbicidas, controles de plaga, etc. y de esa manera mejorar sus ingresos y alcanzar una mejora calidad de vida  para su familia.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es: Don Antonio, quedo viudo hace siete años, tiene bajo su responsabilidad dos hijos que le ayudan en su actividad agrícola. Don Antonio radica en el trópico junto a su familia hace veinte años aproximadamente, decidió radicar para poder mejorar su calidad de vida de él y de su familia. Empezó trabajando en los chacos donde adquirió experiencia en la producción bananera, por lo que se compro un chaco, actualmente se dedica a la producción de banano, gracias a su esfuerzo Don Antonio  logro adquirir otro chaco, en este chaco se dedico a la  ganadería. Sin embargo con el pasar de los años y con la perdida de su esposa, se descuido en el mantenimiento de su producción bananera, para lo cual ahora solicita el crédito el cual le permitirá realizar este mantenimiento que le ayudara a generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en:
Antonio has been a widower for seven years. He is responsible for two children who help him with his farming. 

He has lived in the jungle with his family for about 20 years. He decided to live there so he could improve his quality-of-life and that of his family. He began working on the farms where he acquired experience in banana production. Consequently, he bought a farm. At the moment he works producing bananas. 

Thanks to his efforts, Antonio managed to acquire another farm. He allocated this farm to raising cattle. However with the passing of time and with the loss of his wife, he hasn't been maintaining his banana production, and he is now applying for a loan which will allow him to do this maintenance. This will help him to earn more income.

loans.use: to maintain his banana plantations.

loans.name: Patricia Alexandra

texts.es: La cliente reside en Machala.  Inició su negocio a raíz de que dejara su trabajo como empleada.  Posteriormente se dedicó a la venta de comida en su casa los fines de semana, desde entonces ha mantenido este negocio con su familia.  Labora junto a su hija.  También se dedica el resto de tiempo libre a la venta de cosméticos y productos de belleza.  Se encuentra en estado de unión libre y su cónyuge trabaja como taxista urbano. Su otro hijo asiste a la escuela fiscal del sector donde habitan.  Desea a futuro poder montar un restaurante en su casa y que su esposo compre un vehículo propio para laborar.  Al momento necesita el crédito para comprar mesas, sillas, perfumes y cosméticos.
texts.en:
This borrower resides in Machala.  She started her business after she left the job where was employed.  She decided to sell food from her house on the weekends and has been able to maintain this business with her family.  The borrower works with her daughter.  In her spare time, she also sells cosmetics and beauty products.  

The borrower is in a common-law relationship and her husband works as a city taxi driver.  Her other child attends a state school in the neighborhood where they live.  In the future, she wants to open a restaurant in her house and help her husband buy his own vehicle for work.  At the moment, she needs a loan in order to buy tables, chairs, perfumes, and cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs, as well as perfumes and cosmetics.

loans.name: Sinignessigui Ii Group

texts.fr:
Les membres du groupe SINIGNESSIGUI II sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 40 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des familles polygames à KOROBARRAGE, un des villages de SIKASSO, 3ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur troisième prêt avec l’institution, les prêts passés ont été bien remboursés.
La spéculation cultivée est le maïs avec Mme  AMI  debout au milieu sur la photo.  
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter de la semence, des engrais et payer les frais de labour  pour l'exploitation de 0,5 hectare de champ. La production est vendue au niveau du village, à SIKASSO après la récolte à une clientèle composée d’hommes et de femmes. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice de 100.000  francs CFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The members of the Sinignessigui II group are married women who are an average of 40 years old, and who have six children on average. They all live in polygamous families in Korobarrage, a village in Sikasso, which is in the 3rd administrative region of Mali. 

They work with the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to see their business through the rainy season. This is their third loan with the institution, and their previous loans have been repaid. 

They grow corn, and Madame Ami is in the center of the front row in the photo. With her loan, she would like to pay for seeds, fertilizer, and labor costs to maintain 0.5 hectares of land. 

After the harvest, the corn is sold in the village of Sikasso to both men and women. She would like to earn a profit of 100,000 FCFA per season. This profit will help her pay back her loan and help her husband with the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for seeds, fertilizer, and labour costs

loans.name: Horonya 3 Group

texts.fr:
Les dix  femmes de Horonya 3 sont toutes mariées dans les familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 46 ans et 5 enfants. Elles vivent toutes dans le village de Kondia dans la région de Ségou (4ème région administrative du Mali). Elles se sont connues à travers leurs activités agricoles hivernales, des liens de voisinage, de mariage et de parenté dans le village. Elles font la culture d’arachide, du mil et du riz. Dans le but de s’acheter de petits équipements, de s’approvisionner en intrants agricoles, les membres du groupe ont connu Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème    cycle du prêt de campagne.
Madame  Fatoumata  (au milieu des assises dans la photo) est une grande meneuse d’activités agricoles hivernales dans le village de   Kondia .Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour labourer son champ, s’acheter des semences et d’engrais puis payer les jeunes pour sarcler son champ. La vente de ses produits agricoles se fait au comptant à la fin de l’hivernage pour payer son prêt et afin d’avoir de revenu pour prendre la charge des enfants, et une partie de celle de la famille.
texts.en: The ten women of Horonya 3 are all married in traditional families. They are on average 46 years old and have five children. They all live in the Kondia village in the Ségou region (4th administratrive region of Mali). They know each other from their winter farming, their neighborhood connections, their marriages, and through family in the village. They farm peanuts, millet, and rice. In the goal of buying small equipment and agricultural resources, the group members went to Soro Yiriwaso and are on their 3rd loan. Mrs. Fatoumata (seated woman in the middle of the photo) is a leading winter farmer in the village of Kondia. She plans to use her loan to plow her field, to buy seed and fertilizer, and to pay young workers to weed her field. She sells her products for cash at the end of the winter to repay her loan and to be able to save up to pay the expenses of her children and her family.

loans.use: to buy small equipment, seed, and agricultural resources

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr: Le groupe a été crée le 14/05/2010 et est composé de femmes issues du même quartier. Leurs activités sont: l’élevage le commerce, la coiffure et la couture. Fatou l'emprunteur vedette est la responsable du groupe. Elle est âgée de 56 ans, mariée et mère de 08 enfants dont 05 filles avec 02 autres petits fils (une fille et un garçon. Elle fait de l'élevage de la volaille et le commerce de vaisselle, de natte. Elle s'approvisionne a Dakar et à Rossa et revend dans son quartier. Elle a de la clientèle et donne en générale sa marchandise à crédit. elle compte acheter 90000F de poussins 150 à 600f l'unité de l'aliment, 12 sacs a 15500F, vaccin 5000F. Le reste de l'argent elle va augmenter 150000 pour acheter la vaisselle à Rosso. Avec ses bénéfices elle compte épargner dans le Banc Villageois, appuyer son mari dans la gestion de la famille et gérer ses affaires personnelles
texts.en: This group was created on 14/05/2010 and consists of women from the same neighborhood. Their businesses are: breeding, retail, hairdressing and sewing. Fatou, the featured borrower, is the leader of the group. She is 56 years old, married and mother to 8 children of whom 5 are girls with 2 other grandchildren (one girl and one boy). She breeds poultry and sells dishes and braids. She gets her supplies in Dakar and Rosso and resells in her neighborhood. She has a clientele and generally sells her merchandise for credit. She plans to buy 90,000 F of chicks 150 at 600 F each, 12 bags of food at 15,500 F, vaccinations at 5,000 F. The rest of the money she is going to increase to 150,000 F to buy a dishwasher in Rosso. With her profits she plans to save in the "banc villageois", support her husband in the management of the family and manage her personal affairs.

loans.use: to buy chicks, bags of food, and vaccinations

loans.name: Gersom

texts.en:
Gersom is a farmer in Kitojo 2 – Sheema District. He mainly grows bananas, which he sells to get money for his family’s upkeep. He started banana growing in 2009 with a motive of getting a source of income which he would use to educate his four children. The business is located in his local cell in Kitojo – Sheema. 

In addition to the matoke (green banana) selling business, he also operates a grocery, which brings in additional income. Gersom’s clients are mainly the local people who have greatly supported him. His major challenge is lack of working capital, which has hindered him from growing the business to the required standards.

loans.use: to buy bananas for sale.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en:
Doris, 42, is married and the mother of three children. She runs a grocery stall in the outskirts of Narok town and has been in the business for the last 10 years. She makes a monthly income of 15,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) from the business. 

Doris has applied for her third loan. This time, she is applying for a lower amount, 15,000 KES, after having had difficulties with repaying a previous loan for a higher amount. She will use these funds to purchase and transport fresh produce from farmers to her stall.

She plans to use the proceeds to diversify into livestock rearing. Her dream is to be successful in life.

loans.use: to buy and transport produce to sell

loans.name: Djekafo Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe    DJEKAFO est constitué de 5 femmes toutes mariées ayant une moyenne d’âge de35 ans et 3 enfants. Elles vivent  dans des  familles traditionnelles élargies avec leurs maris, coépouses, frères et fils dans le village de  MERIDIELA. 
Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, d’amitié et de commerce. Pour renforcer leur capacité financière afin de mieux faire leur commerce, elles ont adhéré à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle elles sont à leurs 7éme prêts. Les 6 précédents prêts ont été correctement remboursés. Ce groupe de femmes fait le commerce de  condiments à l’image de DIATOU qui est la 1ére femme debout dans la photos de la droite vers la gauche Elle compte acheter avec son  prêt, 5 cartons de cube Maggi avec les grossistes de Bamako. Elle effectue ses ventes au marché  et à domicile, en détail au comptant et à crédit  à une clientèle composée essentiellement de femmes. 
Elle  envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 21.000FCFA qui sera  investi dans les activités et rembourser le prêt.
texts.en:
The Djekafo group consists of five married women with an average age of 35 years and three children. They live in traditional extended families with their husbands, co-wives, brothers and sons in the village of Méridièla. They are long-standing neighbours, friends and business partners. They are on their 7th loan with Soro Yiriwaso, a microfinance institution which they joined to support their businesses' financial capacity. The six previous loans have been repaid. 

This group of women trades condiments. Diatou is the woman standing at the far right of the photo. With this loan, she intends to buy with five boxes of Maggi cubes (a brand of bouillon cubes) from wholesalers in Bamako. She makes her sales at the market and at home, accepting both cash and credit, primarily to women. She hopes to make an average monthly profit of 21,000 FCFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and repay the loan.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Husneyeh

texts.en:
Husneyeh is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.

Husneyeh is a 53-year-old, married woman from a small village near Ramallah city. She lives with her husband and her youngest son who is still in the university. Her other four sons and three daughters are married. 

For the past five years, Husneyeh's husband has been working in a grocery store in the village. It is a profitable job, but needs a lot of improvement. Husneyeh is also working in her sewing workshop to help her husband with part of the family's expenses. This sewing business has its loyal customers from her area and outside of it. 

Husneyeh took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help her husband to buy more products for his grocery store. This will help them to increase their sales and also their income.

loans.use: to buy more products for her husband's grocery store.

loans.name: Annie

texts.en:
Annie is 37 years old. She has been living in Sanniquille, the capital City of Nimba County, which is rich in nature resources and the living conditions are much better than the capital city of Liberia. Nimba is the second largest populated county in Liberia. 

Annie's education ended in the tenth grade. Traditionally she is married, and her husband is a farmer. They both have five children between 13 to 23. Only four are in school and live at home. 

With little money from her mother, she was able to establish her business. Since 2006 she has been running a small local shop where she sells rice, salt, bitter-ball, okra, oil, etc; she spends nine hours each day on her business, from Monday to Saturday. 

One problem she faces is small income. She is requesting a loan to purchase more rice, salt, bitter-ball, okra, oil, etc for her business. 

Her plan is to one day build a modern house.

loans.use: to purchase more rice, salt, bitter-ball, okra, oil, etc for her business.

loans.name: Stanslous

texts.en:
Stanslous is 54 years old and lives in Kongowea area. He is married and has four children, two of whom are still in school. He has been selling secondhand clothes for the last three years and the business is really good. He knew about Milango Financial Services through friends and is now seeking a loan to buy some five bales of secondhand clothes to sell. 

He has an ambition of owning a large boutique to sell clothes. The major challenge he faces in the business is lack of capital. The extra income raised from the business will be used to educate the remaining children and improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy five bales of secondhand clothes to sell.

loans.name: Leece

texts.en:
Leece is a 54-year-old married woman. She has two children, ages 20 years and 30 years. She describes herself to be trustworthy and self-driven. She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows that produce milk for sale. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in an area conducive for business and her primary customers are common citizens. 

Leece describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of adequate funds. She will use the KES 35,000 loan to buy more dairy cows. Her business goal is to be a wholesale supplier of milk within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will provide better living standards for  her family. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Her previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more dairy cows

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
This is Mohammed from Liberia. He lives in Kakata Town, which is the capital city of Margibi County. The area is home to “round time marketers,” traders that travel to the interior to purchase various goods to sell throughout the county. As a result, there is a high concentration of wholesalers in the area who distribute to various markets around Margibi County, including Monrovia. He is 50 and married with nine children. His children's ages are between 21 and 32. They are currently living their own.  

Mohammed has owned his own shop selling engine oil, nails, car and motorbike plugs, etc. for the past four years. He will use the loan proceeds to purchase more goods such as engine oil, nails, car and motorbike plugs for his business. On average, he works 7am to 5pm at his business. He started his business by selling in the local market and communities with help from his father. He transports his merchandise by bus. He cites too little stock as his biggest challenge. His favorite part of this business is the flow of customers. 

In the future, he would like to build a modern house. He is grateful for your support!

loans.use: to purchase more goods such as engine oil, nails, car and motorbike plugs, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Melinda

texts.en:
Melinda is 39 years old and married. She has four children, three of whom are in school.

Melinda lives in the Philippines and earns a living by raising pigs. She also earns additional income from selling products for Natasha, a direct selling company. Melinda has been raising pigs for three years. She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Melinda works tirelessly to attain her dream: to save enough money to send her children to college and repair and renovate her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Felicidad

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children who are in school, Felicidad works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell ginger business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice. Felicidad is borrowing PHP 8,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks of ginger to sell through her buy-and-sell ginger business.

Felicidad has been sustaining her business activities through her past loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of ginger to sell.

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 46 years old and married, with two children.

She earns a living by farming and selling vegetables in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 8,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional seeds, fertilizer, and farm supplies.

Juliet has been farming and selling vegetables for three years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional seeds, fertilizer, and farm supplies.

loans.name: Fridah

texts.en:
Fridah is 55 years old and comes from Nyahururu. She is married to Samuel, who earns income for the family. They have five children, all of whom are adults. (They are aged 36, 34, 33, 20 and 25.)

Fridah is in the business of poultry raising. She has been in operation for the past two years. She has applied for her first loan of KES 30,000 from KADET. Her plan is to use it to buy more chickens and chicken feed. 

Her monthly income from her business at the moment is KES 10,000. Her hope and dream for the future is to be financially stable.

loans.use: To buy more chickens and feed for them

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna has three children, two of whom are in school. She works hard to support her family.

Myrna has a business selling rice in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from operating a general store and raising pigs. Myrna is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice to sell at her rice retail business.

Myrna has used her past seven loans from NWTF to sustain her business activities. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is 58 years old and married, with three children.

Luzviminda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 8,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks of soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc. to sell.

Luzviminda has borrowed and paid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 38 years and also earns an income from buying and selling vegetables.

Luzviminda aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of soap, milk, canned goods, eggs, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Ma. Fe works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice. Ma. Fe is borrowing PHP 8,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional stocks of bananas to sell through her buy-and-sell banana business.

Ma. Fe has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of bananas to sell.

loans.name: Kamil

texts.en:
Kamil is 44 years old. He is married and lives in his own house with his wife. He sells food products like milk, rice and sugar, among others. His store is set up in his house, which is on a corner with a lot of traffic. That is where he very kindly tends to his customers. 

Kamil has had this business for 10 years. He started with his own capital. Upon seeing the good results that his sales generated for him, he decided to continue. He started in this field due to the need to have an occupation and to support his life partner with the household expenses. Also, he feels like a productive and independent person. Kamil wishes to see his business grow, and he wishes to see that reflected in his family’s well-being.

He is now requesting 1,800 AZN. He is grateful for the opportunity provided to him in accessing the loan, which he needs to continue meeting his goals. He pledges to be a punctual and very responsible client. He will use the requested loan to buy food products like milk, rice, sugar and vegetables for his store. He has a good loan history. This is his fourth loan

loans.use: to buy food products like milk, rice, sugar and vegetables for his store

loans.name: Hursand

texts.ru: Хурсанд 52 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Она трудолюбивая женщина и поэтому более 6 лет занимается скотоводством. Хурсанд имеет 6 баранов и 1 коровы. Хурсанд покупает скот и дома откармливает несколько месяцев. Хурсанд планирует скоро провести мероприятие дома, но не имеет денег. Хурсанд запрашивает займ на сумму 5000 сомони для проведения мероприятия. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Hursand is 52 years old.  She is married and raising three children.  She is a hardworking woman who has been involved in raising cattle for more than six years.  She currently owns six sheep and one cow.  She buys livestock which she fattens at home over a few months period.

In the near future, Hursand is planning to have a party at home.  She is requesting a loan of 5,000 somoni to pay for this event.  She is counting on your kindness and mercy.

loans.use: to pay for a family party.

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргиза трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 34 года. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 несовершеннолетних детей. Она более 14 лет занимается скотоводством. Наргиза имеет большой опыт по данному бизнесу, так как она родилась и выросла в сельской местности и помогала родителям по земледелию. Данное время она имеет в оборотном капитале 2 голов коровы и голов бараны. Она откармливает скот дома и имеет большой коровник и хорошее условие. Ее супруг Кувватбек помогает ему по введению бизнеса. Наргиза планирует провести церемонию обрезания своего сына, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1000 сомони для проведения церемония обрезания. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nargiza is a hardworking woman.  She is 34 years old, married and raising three adolescent children.  She has been involved in animal husbandry for over 14 years.  Nargiza has a lot of experience in this business because she was born and raised in a rural area and used to help her parents with farming.  Currently, she has two heads of cattle and sheep in her business.  She fattens up livestock at home and has a large cowshed and good conditions.  Her husband, Kuvvatbek, helps her with running the business.  Nargiza is planning to hold a circumcision ceremony for her son, but does not have money.  She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1000 somoni to hold the circumcision ceremony.  She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to hold a circumcision ceremony for her son

loans.name: Zumrad

texts.ru:
Милая женщина из провинциального городка Вахдат, Зумрад воплощает свои фантазии в области дизайна женской одежды. Ей нравиться заниматься своим делом. Ее работа приносит ей удовольствие. Зумрад шьет на заказ женские национальные платья. Занимается она этим ремеслом на протяжении восьми лет. Зумрад замужем, имеет двоих детей - сына и дочь. 
Зумрад просит кредит, чтобы продвинуть деятельность. Она хочет приобрести модернизированную швейную машинку, с помощью которой она смогла бы улучшить процесс своей работы, так как ее старая швейная машинка отнимает у нее много времени. Зумрад надеется на вашу поддержку.
texts.en:
Zumrad is a nice woman who comes from the provincial city of Vahdat.  She unleashes her creative imagination to design women's clothes.  She loves her field of work and derives a lot of pleasure from it.   She takes orders and sews traditional Tajik dresses for women.  She has been involved in this activity for eight years already.  She is married and the mother of two children, a son and a daughter.

She is asking for a loan to further develop her activity.  She wants to acquire a modern sewing machine which will allow her to improve her work, as she loses a lot of time working on her current old machine.  She is relying on your support.

loans.use: to buy an electronic sewing machine to develop her sewing business.

loans.name: Israa

texts.en:
Israa is a conservative person who prefers not to have her photo published online, so her husband appears in the photo.

Israa is a 25-year-old, married woman from Deir el balah, near Gaza city. She lives with her husband and a small child. Israa's husband is a worker in the public sector and gets a low income which is not enough to cover all the family's needs. Israa works in a beauty salon she has, to help her husband with part of the family's expenses. It is a very profitable business and Israa has her loyal customers. 

Israa requested a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help her to improve her salon by painting it and by buying new furniture. This will improve the salon's conditions and attract more customers.

loans.use: to improve her salon by painting it and by buying new furniture.

loans.name: Kadrije

texts.en:
Kadrije is a 55-year-old villager who lives rurally with her grown up children and her husband. Currently she has only one dairy cow, and with this loan she wants to add two more dairy cows; this will enable her to sell some raw milk.

For almost ten years, she has been selling fresh agricultural produce to the local market of a nearby city. “I have made a little income, not much though, some changes here and there; but thank God, even with this money, I have been able to do something,” Kadrije said, sounding content.
 
Kadrije is happy also that she was selected from these special projects, because she does not have to worry about paying the interest, since it is being paid by World Vision Albania.

loans.use: To add more dairy cows

loans.name: Kholmat

texts.ru: Холмат жизнерадостный и позитивный мужчина в возрасте 47 лет. Он женат и имеет двоих детей. Живёт он со своей семьёй в маленькой деревушке. Всегда заботится о своей семье, очень любит своих детей и старается делать всё возможное, чтобы они ни в чём не нуждались. Он уже давно ведёт свой бизнес. Этим самым он зарабатывает на жизнь. Холмат очень трудолюбивый человек. Его бизнес заключается в выращивании и продаже скота. Холмат покупает скот, выращивает его и продаёт полученное от них мясо и молоко. Он имеет большой опыт в этой деятельности. Этот бизнес приносит ему стабильный хороший доход. И этот доход является основным в его семье, жена также помогает Холмату вести данный бизнес. Сейчас Холмат желает расширить свой бизнес, чтобы получать больше дохода и восполнять все нужды своей семьи. Для того, чтобы закупить ещё несколько голов крупно - рогатого скота ему необходимы денежные средства. Поэтому Холмат обратился в Арванд и хочет получить кредит на покупку рогатого скота. Он очень надеется на положительный результат и заранее благодарит Арванд за поддержку.
texts.en:
Kholmat is a cheerful and a positive 47 year old man.  He is married, has two children, and lives in a small village.  He loves his children and tries to make sure that they are never in need of anything.  He has been making a living from his business for a long time.  Kholmat is a very hard-working person.  His business consists of buying cattle, raising it and selling the collected milk and meat.  He has a lot of experience in this field and, with the help from his wife, his business provides him with a stable income.  In fact, this is the main source of income for his family.  

At present, Kholmat wishes to expand his enterprise in order to increase his profits, and ultimately, to provide financial stability for his family.  To achieve this, Kholmat is asking for a loan to purchase more cattle.  He is hoping for a positive outcome and thanks Arvand in advance.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Konstantine

texts.en:
Konstantine is a 32-year-old married man from the village of Kveda Simoneti. His family consists of his wife, child, parents and three brothers, one of whom is a school attendant. The family runs a small-scale dairy farm with two milk cows. Konstantine’s mother produces cheese with the cow's milk and sells it locally. Konstantine works at the local wire mesh manufacturing shop and earns a small monthly income. The family lives under the poverty line and gets a modest amount of social assistance from the government.

Konstantine works hard at the work but his wage is too simple and hardly enough to cover everyday costs. That is why he decided to set up his own workshop to manufacture wire mesh. He owns all the needed machines to do so. With the loan, Konstantine will purchase a stock of wire and weave the mesh to sell in his district.

Konstantine hopes that his business will be profitable and generate income for his family's well being.

loans.use: to purchase wire to weave mesh

loans.name: Anton

texts.en:
Anton lives with his four children and his wife in a village in the northern part of Albania.  He has been running a wholesale distribution type of activity for seven years. He buys mostly vegetables, grains and fruits in nearby villages and sells them to stores. 

“I have been able to establish a good clientele who I can sell to. As for buying the items, it’s not really a headache because villagers have plenty of produce and they can’t wait to sell it. What I found difficult in the beginning was to find buyers, because there were so many others like me who approached them,” said Anton.

Anton is requesting this loan to buy inventory items to sell.

loans.use: to buy inventory items for distribution to stores.

loans.name: Salomé

texts.fr:
Salomé est une femme mariée âgée de 54 ans. Elle a 06 enfants et vit dans le quartier Adidogomé.
Depuis 1990, Elle vend à domicile et au marché d’Assiyéyé les céréales et tubercules et s’en approvisionne dans les villages périphériques de la capitale togolaise. 
Elle s’approvisionne 04 fois par mois aux marchés d’Assrama et Kossidassi dans la ville de Gléï à 145 kilomètres de Lomé.
A cause des difficultés liées aux transports des marchandises à Lomé, vu  la faiblesse de son fonds de roulement et la fréquence de ses approvisionnements, Salomé sollicite un crédit pour acheter 02 sacs de Maïs, 01 lot d’ignames, 01 tas de manioc. Ceci lui permettra d’augmenter son stock et de réduire les frais de transport.
texts.en:
Salomé is a 54-year-old married woman. She has six children and lives in the Adidogomé neighborhood of Lomé. Since 1990, she has been selling grains and tubers at home and at the Assiyéyé market, buying her supplies from outlying villages around the capital of Togo.

She restocks four times per month at the markets of Assrama and Kossidassi in the city of Gléï, 145 kilometers from Lomé. Because of the difficulties related to the transport of goods to Lomé, paticularly given her limited funds and the frequency of her resupply trips, Salomé is requesting a loan to purchase two bags of maize, one lot of yams, and one batch of cassava. This will allow her to increase her stock and reduce transportation costs.

loans.use: to purchase maize, yams, and cassava

loans.name: Melba

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, three of whom are in school, Melba works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from farming rice. Melba is borrowing PHP 8,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more bananas to sell through her buy-and-sell banana business.

Melba has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, three of whom are in school, Vilma works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell sweet potato business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from a general store. Vilma is borrowing PHP 8,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional sacks of sweet potatoes to sell through her buy-and-sell sweet potato  business.

Vilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past one loan from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of sweet potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Bahar

texts.en:
Bahar is 37 years old. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her husband and children in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. She is a Fuzuli refugee.  Bahar has been raising cattle for the past 15 years. She says this is a very difficult job. Taking care of animals is a continuous effort, but her husband helps her to raise the cattle, fatten them and sell them in the market. 
Bahar usually buys cattle, raises them, fattens them and sells them in the central bazaar. Her monthly income of 150 AZ is the only source of income for her family. She plans to expand the business in order to bring more funds into her family. Selling meat is a very profitable business in Azerbaijan, due to its large use in everyday meals.

She is applying for a loan of 2000 AZN in order to buy more calves. This is going to be her fifth loan with Aqroinvest. She believes this loan will have a positive impact in the expansion of her business

loans.use: to buy more calves

loans.name: Muborakshoh

texts.ru:
Муборакшох из Хуросона трудолюбивый и миролюбивый человек. Ему 29 лет. Он женат и у него 3 детей, двое мальчиков в возрасте 5 и 1 года, и девочка в возрасте 3 года. Муборакшох продолжает ремесло отца. Он занимается животноводством. В частности Муборакшох в течение 3-х лет разводит крупно-рогатый скот для продажи. Деятельность ему приносит не только доход, но и то, что за счет животноводства он обеспечивает семью молоком и молочными продуктами. Сейчас Муборакшох запрашивает кредит для закупа пару бычков для продолжения деятельности.     
В будущем Муборакшох хочет провести ремонт в доме, чтобы улучшить условия проживания семьи, а также планирует увеличить поголовье скота для расширения бизнеса.
texts.en: Muborakshoh is a hardworking and peaceful man of 29 from Khuroson. He is married and has three children, two boys aged one and five and a three-year-old girl. Muburakshoh is an animal herder, as was his father. In particular, for the past three years he has been raising big-horned cattle for sale. This occupation doesn't just bring him an income; he is also able to provide his family with milk and dairy products. Now, Muborakshoh is requesting a loan to purchase a pair of steers to further his business. In the future he wants to renovate his home in order to improve his family's living conditions, and also plans to broaden his business by increasing his number of cattle.

loans.use: to buy a pair of steers to fatten and resell

loans.name: Nudee

texts.en:
Mrs. Nudee, 49 years old, lives with her husband and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in an old house on a plot of land.  She has been running a grocery store since 2010. Her husband works at a grindstone factory. Their two sons both go to high school.

She is requesting a loan of 7,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as cements, planks, fiberglass and foam in order to renovate her old house. After renovations, the family will live in a comfortable and warm place where they will burn less coal for heating, thus releasing less pollutants into the atmosphere. The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Jad

texts.en:
Jad is a 37-year-old, married man from Gaza city. He lives in a simple house with his wife and a small son. 

Jad is a worker in a local company where he gets a low income. His economic conditions are bad because he is sick and needs periodic medicine. 

Jad took a USD loan from Palestine for Credit & Development (FATEN). This loan will help him to have surgery outside of Palestine because it is a complex surgery. Jad hopes this surgery makes his health conditions better, so he will live a normal life with his wife and small child.

loans.use: to have surgery outside of Palestine.

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.en: Rahmatullo is 41 years old. He works as the director of a school. He has been doing this work for some years, and he has had many pupils. He lives with his wife and four children in a house that was build with great dedication by his father. His house is old, since it was built many years ago, and it needs some repairs. In the winter, it has heavy heat loss through the windows and doors, because they are damaged. So he decided to replace his windows and doors. He needs a loan to cover the cost of new windows and doors, cement and wood, and to cover the cost of hired workers.

loans.use: to buy building materials, such as windows and doors, cement and wood, and to cover the cost of hiring workers, to make repairs to his house.

loans.name: Bibirajab

texts.ru: Бибирачаб добросовестная женщина. Ей 53 года. Она замужем и имеет 6 детей. Она работает в государственной учреждение Таджиксий научно-исследовательский институт акушерство и гинекологии. Она трудолюбивая женщина и честно выполняет свою работу. Она старается для того, чтобы ее дети получили высшее образование. Ее сын учится в Таджикско-Российском Словянском Университете. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор своего сына, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 1500 сомони для оплаты учебного договора сына. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Bibirajab is 53 years old and a conscientious woman.  She is married and the mother of six children.  She works at the National Scientific Research Institute of Obstetrics and Gynecology.  She is very hardworking and carries out her duties very honestly.   She does everything she can so that her children can receive a higher education.  

Bibirajab's son is a student at the Russian-Tajik Slavonic University.  She needs to pay his university tuition fees, but does not have enough money to do so.  She is requesting a loan of 1,500 somoni to pay for her son's tuition.  She is relying on your kindness.

loans.use: to pay her son’s university tuition.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.ru: Парвина молодая скромная женщина. Она трудолюбивая и целеустремленная женщина. Она недавно развелась с мужем, и теперь воспитывает свою маленькую дочь Марям сама. Ей 1 года. Парвина живет с дочкой. Она работает в компании мобильной связи оператором. Парвина имеет хорошие знания и поэтому с легкостью выполняет свою работу. Она повторно кредитуется в ИМОНе и первый займ она погасила во время. Парвина хочет купить кондиционер для своего, но не имеет денег. Летом ей и ее дочери очень жарко. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 7500 сомони для покупки кондиционера. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Parvina is a young and modest woman. She is hardworking and purposeful. She divorced from her husband not long ago, and currently she is raising her young daughter Maryam herself. Maryam is 1 year old. 

Parvina lives with her daughter. She works at a mobile phone company as an operator. Parvina has good knowledge and therefore she carries out her work with ease. She takes a loan with IMON for the second time, and the first loan she paid back on time. 

Parvina would like to purchase air conditioning, but does not have the money. In the summer she and her daughter are very warm. She requests a loan in the amount of 7,500 somoni for the purchase of the air conditioner. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To purchase air conditioning for her household

loans.name: Dilbar

texts.ru: Дилбар трудолюбивая женщина. Ей 43 года. Она разведена и сама воспитывает 3 детей. Ее старший сын в этом году окончил среднюю школу и поступил в университет. Двое ее детей еще учатся в средней школе. Дилбар более 5 лет работает в государственной учреждении садовником. В ее должности входят посадка и ухаживание за цветами. Дилбар тратит свою зарплату для обеспечения детей со всеми необходимыми средствами. Она должна оплатить за учебный договор своего сына в университете, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 500 долларов США. Она ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en:
Dilbar is a hardworking woman. She is 43 years old. She is divorced and raises three children by herself. Her eldest son finished high school this year, and entered the university. Two of her children still go to high school. 

Dilbar has worked as a gardener at a government agency for more than five years. Her position includes planting and grooming of flowers. Dilbar spends her salary on providing her children with all necessary resources. She should pay the tuition for her son at the university, but does not have the money. She requests a loan in the amount of 500 US dollar. She awaits your kindness and hopes for your charity.

loans.use: To pay for her son's education

loans.name: Irma Aracely

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, conocida como la Ciudad de Los Reales Tamarindos desde épocas coloniales se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal Mi Mundo Natural.

En este lugar vive la señora Irma, tiene 43 años de edad, es madre solera de un hijo de 14 años el mismo que estudia en colegio. Ella vive con los padres.
 
Doña Irma para darle lo necesario a su hijo y ayudarles a sus padres con los gastos que genera el hogar desde hace 7 años hizo los trámites correspondientes he instalo una escuela. Son muchos los niños que llegan hasta su establecimiento el mismo que aun no cuenta que la infraestructura adecuada pero que pero poco a poco la va mejorando con la ayuda de los créditos, en su escuela además de ella trabajan 6 personas a quienes les paga un sueldo mensual.
 
Este crédito es para comprar materiales de construcción para realizar ciertos arreglos en su escuela. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos ha ido mejorando su escuela. 

Su sueño es tener una buena infraestructura educativa para que sus niños tengan la mejor educación.
texts.en:
In the city of Portoviejo, known as the “City of the Royal Tamarind Trees” since colonial times, the Communal Bank “Mi Mundo Natural” (My Natural World) meets every 15 days.

Sra. Irma lives in this place.  She is 43 years old and a single mother of a 14-year-old child who is in high school.  Irma lives with her parents.  

Doña Irma gives her son what he needs and helps her parents with the general household expenses.  Seven years ago, she made the proper arrangements to have a school built.  There are several children who come to her establishment even though it does not have adequate infrastructure, but it has been improving gradually with the help of the loans.  Her school also employs six people who are paid a monthly salary.  

This loan will be used to buy construction materials for making certain repairs to the school.  Irma has been with her Communal Bank from the beginning and enjoys being a member because the loans have helped to improve her school.  Her dream is to have suitable infrastructure so that the children can receive the best education.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for repairs to her school.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell banana business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years. She earns additional income from a general store. 

Vilma has sustained her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of loans from the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She is now borrowing 8,000 Philippine pesos through the NWTF to buy more bananas to sell in her buy-and-sell business.

She dreams of saving enough money to afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more bananas to sell

loans.name: Garik

texts.en:
Garik lives in the village Ddmanshen in Gegharkunik region. He is married and has two children. He lives with his mother, wife and children.

His mother works at the local school as a teacher of mathematics. His wife also has a specialty as a teacher, but now she does not work and she takes care of their children. Garik has a higher education as a lawyer and now he works at the municipality as the secretary of the staff. At the same time, Garik is engaged in farming and agriculture. He tends three cows, three calves, two piglets, twelve sheep, forty chickens and ten beehives. He also cultivates potatoes on his plot of land. He sells all of his farm products in fruit markets in his living region.

Garik is not a new client for Nor Horizon and this time he has decided to have a deal with Kiva. He asks a loan of 650,000 Armenian drams since he urgently needs some money for some health treatment.

loans.use: to pay for some health treatment

loans.name: Ramin

texts.en: Ramin is 57 years old. He is married and lives with his wife, daughter, and mother-in-law in the small village of Lesa. His mother-in-law is provided with a retirement pension. Ramin’s daughter is leaving the secondary school and is going to enter the university. Ramin is actively involved in agricultural activities. Specifically, he has milk cows and owns a plot of agricultural land, where maize and nut trees are grown. He cultivates the land and does all the agricultural work to ensure a good harvest. The harvested products are sold at local markets. Ramin owns a small car and uses it for displacements from his house to his plot of land. As the existing income is not enough for the family, he decided to start his own business. All the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial conditions and lack of experience. After several unsuccessful attempts, Ramin applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva that permits the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. A loan of 2,000 GEL will help Ramin start his own business. He plans to purchase nuts and then sell them at a higher price. This will increase the income of his family and increase his stability. With the support of the Start Up program, Ramin will get an opportunity to be involved in his own business and tackle his financial difficulties.

loans.use: to purchase stock of nuts to resell

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
Since 2005 Armen has been providing construction services to locals. He installs heating systems and does other interior work for locals to earn his living. Armen also works at a local school as a teacher. This hardworking man is very kind to his customers and does his best, and with great pleasure. As a teacher's salary doesn't allow Armen to cover his needs, the main source of his income is from his construction business. Armen has applied for this loan so that he can purchase tools that will help him to provide the construction services better. 

Armen has now been approved for a loan within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international.
