The start-up loan program provides business start-up loans with soft conditions to informal businesses that do not have access to credit products. The loan is important for him to improve his services and to gain more customers. Armen waits for your support.

loans.use: to pay for tools for the installation of heating systems and other interior work.

loans.name: Murad

texts.en:
Murad is 41 years old. He lives in the small village of Samtredia district with his parents. His father is provided with a retirement pension. Murad has been involved in the agricultural business from early childhood, as his parents were farmers and this is a traditional activity for the family. 

Sadly, for lack of economic resources and because he had to start working at a very young age, Murad was unable to study for a professional career. Murad works hard on the family-owned agricultural land, growing maize and 150 nut trees. He always has high-quality products, which are sold to local retailers for a good price. In addition, they have two milking cows and produce dairy products to sell. 

As the family has only seasonal income, Murad decided to start his own business and seek credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts was unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. The start-up program, which is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables the rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting businesses. Murad’s application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 1,600 GEL. 

With the received credit, Murad will purchase a stock of nuts to resell at a higher price. This will increase the income of his family. With increased income, they will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of nuts to resell.

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en: Anzhela is a 23-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband in the Telavi district in the Kakheti Region. Anzhela teaches children the Russian language from home and gets a small monthly income. Her husband works at the local petrol station as an operator and gets a small monthly salary. As the income is not enough to cover their everyday costs, she decided to get a loan to start her own business and seek credit among local financial institutions, but her attempts was unsuccessful because of her poor living conditions. The startup program, the  joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables rural poor and inexperienced people to get a loan to start or re-start businesses. Her application was approved under the framework of this program for a loan of $900. With the loan, Anzhela will open a clothing and bed linens shop. She will purchase clothing and bed linens from the wholesalers and then resell them at a higher price. Anzhela already owns a commercial place where her future shop will be opened. This will increase the income of her family. With support of the Start Up program, Anzhela will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle her financial difficulties.

loans.use: to open a clothing and bed linens shop

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.en:
Zhanna is married and has a son. She lives with her family in Berqanush village of Ararat region, where together with her family she runs a farm. 

In the farm, they currently keep two pigs and cultivate cabbage and potatoes in the greenhouse. Near the village where the family lives, they also own a plot of land where apple and plum trees are grown. The gathered harvest Zhanna's husband sells in the city market and so gathers income for the family's living. 

Now, this hardworking family needs financial support for improving their farm. As this is Zhanna's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance loan program provides loans to people who didn’t have access to credit products before, because they have no credit history. 

The loan will help Zhanna to renovate the greenhouse and expand the cultivation process. She will also purchase forage for feeding pigs and fertilizer,  which is very important for successful cultivation of the land.

Zhanna waits for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for the renovation of the greenhouse, forage for feeding pigs, and fertilizer

loans.name: Jambuli

texts.en:
Jambuli is 50 years old and married.  He lives with his wife and two children in the small village of Ambrolauri district. The family lives under poverty line and gets a small social assistance (24 GEL per person). 

Jambuli is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, he has a plot of agricultural land, where he grows potatoes and haricot.  He works hard and always has high quality products, which are sold to local retailers for a good price. Jambul also has a milk cow. His wife milks the cow every day and produces dairy products for selling. 

As the family has only seasonal income, Jambuli decided to start his own business.  He is seeking credit among local financial institutions, but his attempts have been unsuccessful because of his poor living conditions. 

The Start-up program, a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enables poor rural and inexperienced people to get a loan for starting or re-starting a business. Jambuli's application was approved under the framework of this program to get a loan of 1,600 GEL. 

With the credit, Jambul will purchase a stock of groceries and different kinds of vegetables and transport them in his car to different villages for resale. This will increase the income of his family. With increased income, he will be able to improve the living conditions of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of groceries and vegetables for resale

loans.name: Mohitobon

texts.ru:
Мохитобону 46 лет, она многодетная мать. Мохитобон живет с мужем, тремя сыновьями и тремя дочерьми в районе Хамадони. У нее высшее образование. Вот уже 20 лет как Мохитобон работает учительницей и преподает в местной школе. Ее муж тоже работает учителем в этой школе. Два старших сына занимаются торговлей в городе Душанбе, одна дочь учится в Университете, а остальные дети еще школьники. 
Мохитобон хочет открыть собственный бизнес по откорму и продаже скота. По ее словам зарплата, которую получают она и ее муж не хватает на нужды семьи. Поэтому Мохитобон решила одновременно заняться выращиванием крупнорогатого скота для дальнейшей продажи. Этим бизнесом она хочет нормализовать свое финансовое положение.
texts.en:
Mohitobon is 46 years old and the mother of many children.  She lives with her husband, three sons and three daughters in the Hamadoni district of Tajikistan.  She has a higher education and has been working as a teacher in a local school for the past 20 years.  Her husband also works as a teacher in the same school.  Mohitobon's two elder sons work in commerce in Dushanbe, one of her daughters is a university student, and the rest of her children are still in school.

Mohitobon wants to start her own cattle fattening and resale business.  According to her, the combined salaries that she and her husband make are not sufficient to meet the family's needs.  This is why she has decided to also get involved in animal husbandry and cattle resale.  Thanks to this business, she wants to normalize her financial situation.

loans.use: to buy some cattle in order to start her animal husbandry business and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.name: Mendbayar

texts.en:
Mr. Mendbayar, 47 years old, lives with his wife and son in a house on a plot of land in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as an electrician at a power station for the last two years. His wife makes clothes using her sewing machine at home on orders from retailers who later sell finished clothes to people at the market. Their son studies at the university. 

Mendbayar is requesting a loan of 6,000,000 MNT to purchase building and insulation materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass, and foam to renovate his house. After the renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where they will burn less coal for heating, thus releasing less pollutants into the atmosphere, which has a positive impact on the environment. 

The borrower is a very hardworking individual who strives for a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building and insulation materials

loans.name: Milijana

texts.en:
Miljana is 46, single, and lives alone in a minority community of Kosovo.  She has always lived alone and is used to this type of lifestyle.  Sometimes she feels lonely, but she has friends to keep her company.  She has a lot of friends, especially at her job, where she is working as a nurse.  Currently she lives in a house which is in need of renovations.  Due to the high cost of electricity, she wants to facade her house, so she is requesting a loan for the first time to pay for a new facade for her house. 
This loan will help improve her living conditions, insulate her hourse and save money on utility costs. She hopes by doing this she will be able to save some money to ensure financial security, since she lives alone and depends only on herself for income.  She is very happy for this opportunity and she thanks all Kiva lenders!

loans.use: To pay for a facade for her house

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
As a married parent of eight children, Nora works hard to support her family.

She has a rice-retailing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food-vending, raising pigs, and selling vegetables. Nora is borrowing PHP 6,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell through her rice-retailing business.

Nora has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Guillermo

texts.es: Don Guillermo  de 49 años de edad, es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable, vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 17 y de 20 años de edad  ellos estudian actualmente, hace 20 años se dedica al negocio del trasporta público, con lo que obtiene de su negocio  logra solventar algunos gastos de su familia, Don Guillermo solicita un crédito para comprar repuestos y darle mantenimiento al bus para poder seguir con su trabajo, con esto espera brindarle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Guillermo, age 49, is a very hard-working and responsible person.  He lives in his own house with his wife and their two children, ages 17 and 20.  The children go to school.

He has now been working in the public transportation business for 20 years.  With what he gets from his business, he manages to pay some of the family’s expenses.

Guillermo is requesting a loan to buy some replacement parts and for maintenance on the bus.  He will do this in order to be able to continue working.  With this he hopes to give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy some replacement parts and to provide maintenance on the bus.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: El señor Juan, es una persona trabajadora, tiene tres hijos a los cuales mantiene con lo poco que gana como chofer de volqueta en la alcaldía, trabaja todos los días durante todo el año, por otro lado su señora se dedica a la agricultura quien tambien trabaja todos los días del año para mantener su chaco y a sus hijos quienes estan estudiando y ayudando en la agricultura, el lugar donde viven actualmente es muy lejos para que puedan trasportarse a la escuela y siempre llegan tarde y en algunas ocasiones ni siquiera van a pasar clases, por este motivo estan solicitando el credito para poder terminar la construcción que tienen en un pequeño lote urbano, donde sus hijos puedan quedarse a vivir y puedan estudiar cómodamente.
texts.en:
Sr. Juan is a hardworking individual who has three children he supports with what little he earns from his job as a dump truck driver for the city.  He works every day of the year.  His wife is a farmer who also works every day of the year to maintain her field.  His children attend school and help with the farming activities.  The place where he currently lives is too remote to access transportation to school.  As a result, his children always arrive late and on some occasions they don’t go to class.  

Juan is requesting a loan so that he can finish the construction on his small plot of land so that his children can have a place where they can live and study comfortably.

loans.use: to finish the construction of his house.

loans.name: Herman

texts.es: El Señor Herman se dedica al servicio de construcción, empezó con su tío como ayudante de obras, posteriormente compro su propia maquinaria para poder independizarse, actualmente atraviesa un mal momento ya su madre se encuentra delicada y necesita hospitalizarse por lo que debe cubrir estos gastos médicos, por lo que necesita un crédito que le ayude a sobrellevar estos gastos y poder remediar la crisis económica que atraviesa; ya que para él lo más importante es poder colaborar a su madre para que pueda recuperarse y salir lo antes posible de esta situación.
texts.en:
Herman works in construction.  He started as a work assistant with his uncle.  He later bought his own machinery in order to be able to become independent.

He is now going through a bad time because his mother is not well and needs to be in the hospital.  Therefore, he needs to cover these medical expenses.

He needs a loan that will help him bear these expenses and to be able to fix the financial crisis he is experiencing.  To him the most important thing is to be able to support his mother so that she is able to recuperate and get out of this situation as soon as possible.

loans.use: to pay his mother's medical expenses.

loans.name: Narcista

texts.en:
Narcista lives in the Philippines. She is 43 years old and single. She works very hard to help her parents and nephews.

Narcista operates a retail store where she sells charcoal and dried coconut meat. She has been in this business for six years. She is requesting a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

In the future, Narcista would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional charcoal to sell

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en:
Elsie, 44, has three children who are in school. She works hard to provide for her family. 

She runs a general store in the Philippines and also earns income from food vending and raising pigs.

Elsie has requested a loan of 7,000 Philippine pesos through the Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation. She will use the loan to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, soap, milk, sugar and eggs. She has already borrowed and paid previous loans from NWTF. 

Elsie aspires to saving enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, such as shampoo, soap, milk, sugar and eggs.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 47 years old and married, with five children, who are in school.   Vilma works very hard to provide for them.

Vilma runs a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell, like soap, noodles, milk, eggs, etc.

Vilma has been in this business for three years.

In the future Vilma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell, like soap, noodle, milk, eggs, etc.

loans.name: María Efigenia

texts.es: María tiene 51 años de edad, es madre de dos hijos y vive en unión libre con su compañero sentimental. Lleva 27 años trabajando, en diversos negocios que ha tenido, entre ellos una chaza de picadura, venta de mercancía, cafetería y actualmente se dedica al reciclaje de vidrios, cartón, cobre, envases y otros artículos, esto le ha generado muy buenas utilidades, cuenta con el apoyo de un empleado por horas quien se encarga de separar los artículos, ella trabaja de Lunes a Sábado de 8:00 am a 6:00 pm y, de esta forma ha conseguido el dinero necesario para suplir las necesidades básicas del hogar y sacar a sus hijos adelante. El crédito que solicita lo desea invertir en la compra de reciclaje de diversos tipos (papel archivo, cartón, vidrio, envases, cobre), con lo que podrá mejorar el margen de ganancia y así capitalizará su negocio para que sea más rentable y productivo, que le garantice una estabilidad económica para mejorar las condiciones de vida y poder disfrutar al lado de su esposo los frutos de su arduo y largo trabajo.
texts.en:
María is 51 years old and the mother of two children.  She and her partner are in a common-law relationship.  María has been working for 27 years in a variety of businesses.  She has owned a food stall, sold merchandise, and managed a cafeteria.  María currently recycles glass, cardboard, copper, packaging, and other items.  She is able to generate a good profit.  María has the help of an hourly employee who is in charge of sorting the materials.  She works Monday through Saturday from 8:00 A.M. to 6:00 P.M.  Working in this manner allows her to earn the money she needs to provide basic household necessities and to help her children get ahead.  

The loan she is requesting will be invested in the purchase of different recyclable materials (paper, cardboard, glass, packaging, and copper) so that she can improve her profit margin.  Capitalizing her business will make it more profitable and productive.  This will guarantee her financial stability so that she can improve her living conditions and enjoy the fruits of her hard work along with her husband.

loans.use: to buy paper, cardboard, glass, packaging, and copper for recycling.

loans.name: Ma. Judith

texts.en:
Ma. Judith works hard to support her family.   She is married and has a restaurant business in the Philippines.

Ma. Judith has requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like vegetables, meat, fish, spices, etc.

Ma. Judith has been in this business for five years now.   In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: purchase additional ingredients like vegetable, meat, fish, spices, etc.

loans.name: Ailyn

texts.en:
Ailyn works hard to support her family.  She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.  She has been in this business for 18 years now.

Ailyn has requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her business.   In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for her business

loans.name: Firdavs

texts.ru: Фирдавс повторно обращается за кредитом. Первый раз он брал кредит для торговли сухофруктами. Он занимался этим делом почти 7 лет. Теперь он накопил сбережение и собирается осуществить свою мечту. Фирдавс давно собирался открыть Интернет-кафе и сейчас он думает настал момент. Специально для этого он в прошлом году проработал в Интернет-кафе, чтобы на практике ознакомиться всеми нюансами этого бизнеса. Фирдавс уже арендовал помещение, расположенное в хорошем людном месте и закупил пару компьютеров и его комплектующих. Ему еще необходимо закупить несколько компьютеров для полной готовности и открытия Интернет-кафе. С этой целью он обратился за кредитом и просит профинансировать его дело. Ему будет помогать его младший брат. У Фирдавса уже двое детей. Жена и дети для него самое главное. Они для него стимул, ради них он старается, и будет стараться. И никто не сомневается в его словах.
texts.en:
This is Firdavs' second loan.  He took a previous loan to buy dried fruits and was involved in that activity for almost seven years.  He has now saved some money and is ready to make his old dream come true: he has been thinking about opening an internet cafe for a long time, and he feels that now is the right time.  To prepare himself for this and to familiarize himself with all the nuances of this business, he has spent the last year working in an internet cafe.

Firdavs has already rented a space, located in a nice popular area, and he has bought a couple of computers and their components.  In order to be fully ready to open his internet cafe, he still needs to buy a few more computers.  With this goal in mind, he has applied for a loan as a way to finance his business.  His younger brother will help him run the business.

Firdavs now has two children.  His wife and children are the most important people in his life.  They give him the will to move forward and he is doing everything he can, and will continue to do so, for them.  No one doubts that he will work very hard.

loans.use: to buy some computers and their components, in order to open an internet cafe.

loans.name: John Mario

texts.es: John tiene 35 años de edad, vive con su esposa y su pequeño hijo de 2 años. Desde hace 7 años se dedica a trabajar en su negocio, un almacén de variedades, donde ofrece ropa, productos de aseo personal, artículos para bebé, entre otros. Inicialmente el negocio estaba ubicado en un local arrendado, pero luego pudo alquilar una casa más grande y allí montó su negocio, en el cual trabaja con su esposa todos los días de la semana. El cliente es un hombre pujante, trabajador, activo y dedicado a su familia y a su labor, siempre está buscando opciones que le ayuden a salir adelante, es por ello, que solicita el apoyo del crédito, que invertirá en la compra de surtido al por mayor (ropa, calzado, productos de aseo, sombrillas, útiles escolares, entre otros) esto le ayudará a incrementar sus ventas, pues tendrá más variedad de mercancía para satisfacer los gustos y necesidades de sus clientes, dando como resultado un incremento en el margen de utilidades. John sueña con fortalecer su negocio, acreditarlo para que sea rentable y sostenible en el tiempo, lo que le permitirá garantizar una estabilidad económica y brindar a su familia un mejor bienestar y calidad de vida.
texts.en:
John is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two-year-old son.  He has been working the past seven years in his business, a variety store where he sells clothing, personal grooming products, baby items, and other merchandise.  John initially set up his business in a rented location, but later on he was able to rent a much larger building where his store is currently located.  He and his wife work every day of the week.  

John is a determined, hardworking, and active man who is dedicated to his family and his job.  He is always looking for ways to get ahead.  For this reason, he is requesting a loan so that he can invest in merchandise in bulk (clothing, shoes, grooming products, umbrellas, school supplies, and other items) in order to increase his sales.  By having a wider variety of merchandise, John will be able to satisfy the tastes and needs of his customers.  This will result in an increase in his profit margin.  

John dreams of strengthening his business, building it up to make it profitable, and sustaining it over time.  This will guarantee his financial stability so that he can provide his family better well-being and an improved quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, grooming products, umbrellas, school supplies, and other items to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn works hard to support her family. Jocelyn is married, and she has a tricicad business in the Philippines.

Jocelyn has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for repair of her tricicad.

Jocelyn has been in this business for one year now.  In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for repair of her tricicad

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is 43 years old and married.  She works hard to help her husband to earn additional income.

Edna runs a general store in the Philippines.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, canned goods, milk, etc.

Edna has borrowed and repaid previous loans from NWTF before this loan. She also earns an income from buying and selling bananas.

Edna aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like shampoo, soap, canned goods, milk, etc.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.en:
Nelly is 35 years old and married. She works very hard to provide for her family.

Nelly runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc..

In the future Nelly would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Felicisima

texts.en:
Felicisima is 50 years old and married.

Felicisima works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like spices, milk, coffee, sugar, noodles, eggs, etc..

Felicisima has borrowed and paid her previous loans from NWTF before this loan. She also earns an income from coconut wine vending.

Felicisima aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like spices, milk, coffee, sugar, noodles, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is 52 years old and married with five children, two of whom are in school, Delia works very hard to provide for them.

Delia runs a charcoal selling business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell.

Delia has been in this business for 16 years.

In the future Delia would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna works hard to support her family. Edna is married and has a candy making business in the Philippines.

Edna requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional ingredients like sugar, flour, yeast, etc..

Edna has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Edna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like sugar, flour, yeast, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 47 years old and married with two children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Evelyn has been raising pigs for 10 years and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Jenie

texts.en:
Jenie is 28 years old with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Jenie has a buy-and-sell dried fish business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

Jenie has been in this business for one year. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Elena

texts.en:
Ma. Elena is married. For the past four years, she has run a butcher business in the Philippines. Ma. Elena works hard to support her family. 

Ma. Elena is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy a pig for her business. In the future, she would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy pig

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 54 years old and married. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 50,000 loan through NWTF to buy stock to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

Nenita has borrowed and repaid 25 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 18 years and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Nenita aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stock to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Narcisa Del Rocío

texts.es: La cliente reside en Machala.  Siempre ha tenido presente la superación de sus hijos para el emprendimiento comercial, es por esto que ahora está comprometida con su actividad actual que es la venta de cosméticos.  Trabaja todos los días, desde temprano en la mañana y de acuerdo a los pedidos que le realizan sus clientes en la ciudad.  Es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos que estudian en el colegio fiscal de su sector.  Desea en un futuro poder llegar a tener su casa propia y un local fijo para su negocio.  Ahora necesita el dinero del préstamo para la compra de más mercadería (perfumes, cosméticos) y una vitrina para su actividad.
texts.en:
This borrower resides in Machala.  Helping her children succeed is always on her mind as she conducts her business activities.  For this reason, she is committed to her present business of selling cosmetics.  The borrower works every day, starting in the morning, taking orders from her customers in the city.  She is a single mother and has two children who attend a state school in her neighborhood.  In the future, she wants to have a house of her own and a permanent location for her business.  

For now, she needs the money from her loan so that she can buy more merchandise (perfumes and cosmetics), as well as a display cabinet for her business.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, cosmetics, and a display cabinet.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 35 years old and lives in Bagalupa, Labangan, Zamboanga del Sur. She is married with three children.

Rowena has a store that sells consumer goods. She had this business for more than two years. She has requested a loan to purchase more stock for her store like detergents, canned goods, noodles and rice to sell.

Rowena has been a member of PMPC for less than a year. In the future, Rowena hopes to make her store into a bigger convenience store.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store like detergents, canned goods, noodles and rice to sell

location.town: Pagadian - Bagalupa, Labangan, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Miguela

texts.en:
Miguela is 56 years old and lives in Locuban Dumalinao . She is married with three children.

Miguela has a 'sari-sari' store that sells foods and dry goods. She has had this business for eight years. She requested a loan to purchase more stock for her store like detergents, canned goods, noodles and rice to sell. 

Miguela has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, Miguela hopes to have her store become a grocery store someday.

loans.use: to purchase more stock for her store like detergents, canned goods, noodles and rice to sell

loans.name: Leonarda

texts.en:
Leonarda is 62 years old and is married with six children. She lives in Navalan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur. Leonarda has a passenger jeep business and she earns approximately 20,000 PHP each month. She has been a member of PMPC for seven years.

Leonarda is requesting a loan to pay for repair and maintenance on her jeep. In the future, she would like to have another passenger jeep or a bigger bus to earn additional income.

loans.use: to pay for repair and maintenance on her jeep

location.town: Pagadian - Navalan, Tukuran, Zamboanga del Sur

loans.name: Cherry Mae

texts.en:
Cherry Mae is married and has no children. She is 34 years old and lives in Nazareth Pagadian City.

She has piglets to sell, and her other income is a manicure business to earn a living. She has been doing this type of work for three years. She requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy additional piglets to raise.

Cherry Mae has been a member of PMPC for three years. In the future, she hopes to build a poultry business.

loans.use: to buy additional piglets to raise.

loans.name: Severina

texts.en:
Severina is 40 years old and married with four children. She lives in Locuban Dumalinao. Severina is a farmer and has been gardening and growing crops for the past six years. She has been a member of PMPC for one year.

Severina is requesting a loan to purchase fertilizer for her garden. In the future, she hopes to become a vegetable supplier.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: El Tule Sur Group

texts.es:
El  banco comunal El Tule Sur está conformado por ocho integrantes madres responsables con 15 hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Ellas son originarias del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte del país. Estas mujeres se caracterizan por ser responsables, trabajadoras con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de sus hijos y les preparan platos típicos de la región como es el “ nacatamal” lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudieron cursar una carrera y se vieron obligadas a trabajar desde temprana edad.

Gracias a sus esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Berta Azucena y tiene por actividad económica la venta de pan de forma ambulante y en su casa de habitación el productos que vende es pan simples, reposterías, tortas de pina, pudin, empanadas, semitas, picos, cachos. Actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto con una pana en la cabeza de unos 20 kg. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos ella dedica a su negocio unas 10 horas diarias.  El banco comunal El Tule Sur agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener  un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The El Tule Sur communal bank is comprised of eight members.  They are responsible mothers with 15 children for whom they are responsible.  They are from El Sauce, which is in the northern part of the country.  These women are known for being responsible and hard-working, and they have a great desire for personal improvement.  In their free time they like to enjoy their children and prepare them dishes that are typical to the region like ‘nacatamal’ [a type of tamale].  Sadly, due to the lack of financial resources, they were not able to study.  They were obliged to work starting at a young age.

Thanks to her effort and her desire to get ahead, Berta Azucena is the coordinator.  Her business is selling bread in an itinerant manner and at her house.  She sells breads, pastries, pineapple cake, pudding, empanandas, ‘semitas, picos, and cachos’ [types of pastry and rolls].  She engages in this business activity with great pleasure and a 20 kilogram basket on her head.

The objective of this loan is to stock her business so that in the near future she is able to get better income.  She spends some ten hours a day on her business.

The El Tule Sur communal bank is grateful for the help that the Kiva lenders give to people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so that they will have a decent way of earning a living.

loans.use: to stock her business with bread, rolls, and pastries.

loans.name: Liberata

texts.en:
Liberata is single and has run a candy processing business in the Philippines for the past three years. She works hard to support her family.

Liberata is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy ingredients such as sugar and milk for her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as sugar and milk to make candy

loans.name: Penelope

texts.en:
As a married mother of one child, Penelope works hard to support her family.

She has a tricicad business in the Philippines, and she earns additional income from a general store. Penelope is borrowing PHP 8,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts for the repair of her tricicad.

Penelope has sustained her business activities through past loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the repair of her tricicad

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is 40 years old and married with one child. For the past five years, she has run a general store in the Philippines. Joyce works very hard to provide for her family.

Joyce is requesting a 5,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as shampoo, milk, soap, canned goods, and other items. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo, milk, soap, canned goods, and other items

loans.name: Juanita Madelaine

texts.es: La Sra. Madeilaine vive en la ciudad de Santa Cruz, en un barrio alejado de la ciudad, tiene 2 hijos pequeños que dependen de los ingresos de ella, ya que su esposo trabaja en el campo, y ella queda sola con sus hijos, actualmente vive en la casa de su suegra.  La Sra. Madelaine es costurera de profesión, y desde hace 3 años se dedica a la confección de ropa, y arreglos en general, tiene un pequeño taller en la misma casa donde vive, para poder generar mejores ingresos ella por las noches vende anticuchos de carne y salchipapas, la sra. Madelaine solicita este crédito para la compra de una maquina de costurar over collareta, ya que le hace falta porque  tendrá un pedido para este invierno que le permitirá incrementar sus ingresos. La sra. Madelaine ha demostrado ser una mujer capaz de sacar a sus hijos adelante y ser emprendedora.
texts.en: Señora Madelaine lives in the city of Santa Cruz, in a neighborhood outside of the city. She has two little children who depend on her income, since her husband works in the country and she remains alone with their children. Now she lives in the home of her mother-in-law. Señora Madelaine is a seamstress by profession, and for three years she has worked making clothing and doing alterations in general. She has a little workshop in the same house where she lives. To be able to generate a better income,  she sells meat anticuchos (meat on a skewer) and salchipapas (a french fry and sausage dish) in the evening. Señora Madelaine is applying for this loan to buy an overstitch sewing machine to sew collars, since she needs it because she will have an order for this winter that will allow her to increase her income. Señora Madelaine has shown herself to be a woman capable of raising her children and being an entrepreneur.

loans.use: to buy a overstitch sewing machine to sew collars.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 51 years old, and married with one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Nelia has a restaurant business in the Philippines; she has been in this business for eight years. 

She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like vegetables, fish, meat, etc..

In the future, Nelia would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like vegetables, fish, meat, etc.

loans.name: Marcelo

texts.es: El Señor Marcelo es un joven trabajador, curso hasta concluir el bachillerato, ya que por cuestiones económicas no prosiguió con sus estudios superiores, viéndose en la necesidad de buscar trabajo y por tanto dejar de lado los estudios; de estado civil soltero, pero tiene una hija pequeña. Pudiéndose evidenciar que el Señor Marcelo tiene gran experiencia en el rubro de la construcción civil ya que lleva más de 4 años en esta actividad;  hoy solicita el presente crédito para poder refaccionar la vivienda que actualmente habita. Indica que el préstamo que se le dé le ayudara a mejorar las condiciones en las cuales vive, indicando que son estas fechas de frio cuando más afectado se ve.
texts.en: Señor Marcelo is a young worker. He went to school until he finished his high school degree, since he did not continue with his higher level education for economic reasons, seeing the need to look for work and for that reason to set his studies aside. He is single, but he has a little daughter. With evidence that Señor Marcelo has a great deal of experience in construction work, since he has been in this work for more than four years, today he is applying for the present loan to be able to remodel the house where he now lives. He indicates that the loan granted to him will help him improve the conditions in which he lives, indicating that it is during these days of cold that he is most affected.

loans.use: to remodel his home

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a video-game machine.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is 24 years old. For the past three years, she has operated a tricad transportation business in the Philippines. Mary Grace works hard to support her family. 

Mary Grace is requesting a 7,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase materials to maintain her business. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure her financial stability.

loans.use: to maintain her transportation business

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita works hard to support her family. She is married, and has had a restaurant business in the Philippines for three years.

Amelita requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy more spices, vegetables, and meat for her business.

In the future, Amelita would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy stocks of spices, vegetables, and meat for her business

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 41 years old and married with three children who are in school. Janet works very hard to provide for them.

Janet runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, milk, soft drinks, soap, etc..

In the future, Janet would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, milk, soft drinks, soap, etc.

loans.name: Lezcil

texts.en:
Lezcil is 32 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a cellphone accessories business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of dry goods to sell.

Lezcil has borrowed and paid loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the cellphone accessories business for four years, and also earns an income from food vending.

Lezcil aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: purchase more stocks of dry goods to sell

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 43 years old and married with five children, four of whom are in school. Juanita works very hard to provide for them.

Juanita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP  loan through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, sugar, shampoo, etc.. Juanita has been in this business for 13 years.

In the future, Juanita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, sugar, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a welding machine and a machine to cut metal.

loans.name: Constantina

texts.es: Constantina, de 38 años, es una mujer trabajadora. Vive con su esposo Víctor y sus 2 hijos en la casa que compró hace 3 años. En compañía de su esposo trabaja todos los días por el bienestar de la familia. Su trabajo consiste en el traslado de diversos productos, como tierra, leche, leña y demás cosas que le requieran sus clientes, su principal instrumento de trabajo es la motocicleta que posee. Por lo que ahorró muy duro para poder comprarse una, “antes solo alquilaba una motocicleta, pero ahora ya tengo una propia”, menciona. Es por esa razón que le falta un porcentaje de dinero para terminar de cancelar el mototaxi y poder trabajar tranquila y así obtener mayor ingreso económico. Este es su segundo crédito con KIVA, esta muy contento de  tener un apoyo financiero, ya que siempre ha demostrado  ser responsable en sus pagos. Constantina, invertirá los S/.2000 soles en el mantenimiento de su mototaxi para trabajar con tranquilidad.
texts.en: Constantina, 38, is a working woman. She lives with her husband Victor and their two children in the house that they bought 3 years ago.  Constantina works with her husband every day for her family's well-being.  She works transporting products, such as soil, milk, firewood, and other items that her customers need.  Her main work tool is the motorcycle that she owns.  She saved a lot to buy it.  She mentions that, "before, I used to rent a motorcycle, but now I have my own."  She still needs to pay off a portion of the loan that she took to finance the motorcycle; paying off this loan would enable her to work tranquilly and have more income.  This is her second loan with Kiva, and she is very content to have financial support, as she has always demonstrated responsibility in her payments.  Constantina will invest the 2,000 Peruvian soles she is requesting in the maintenance of her motorcycle, so she can work without worries.

loans.use: to maintain her vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a sewing machine

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy works hard to support her family; she is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.  Mercy has been in this business for seven years now.

Mercy requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

In the future, Mercy would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Marciano

texts.pt:
Marciano tem 29 anos, é supervisor numa empresa de segurança. Vive maritalmente ha 3 anos ainda sem filhos, numa casa arrendada e adiquiriu um espaço próximo do sίtio onde arrendou e pretende  iniciar a sua obra.
Com o valor do emprestimo diz que ira comprar cimento, areia, pedra e ferro para iniciar a sua obra.
Para o futuro tem como planos mobilar a casa, vedar com muro e comprar uma viatura.
Diz que gostaria de concluir os pagamentos e voltar a solicitar mais creditos para realizar seus planos.
texts.en:
Marciano is 29 years old and works as a supervisor for a security company. He's been married for three years and doesn't have children yet. He lives in a rented house and he has acquired a space near the place he rents where he intends to begin his construction work.
He states that with the amount of the loan he'll purchase cement, sand, rocks and iron so he can get the construction work started.
His plans for the future are to furnish the house, put up a wall around it and purchase a vehicle.
He states that he'd like to finish the repayments and apply for more loans again so that he can achieve his plans.

loans.use: to purchase cement, sand, rocks and iron in order to start building his house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to stock more grocery goods and cleaning products.

loans.name: Lina

texts.pt:
Lina de 25 anos de idade,  é operaria Agrίcola tem 2 filhos ainda sem idade escolar e vive maritalmente.
Com este valor ira comprar chapas, cimento, barrotes, carrada de areia e pagar o pedreiro para continuar a construção da sua casa.
Para o futuro tem como planos legalizar sua relação casando e fazer uma mercearia na sua casa para reforcar a sua renda familiar.
Diz que gostaria de honrar com o contrato assumido com a Hluvuku e voltar a solicitar mais mais emprestimos como forma de realizar seus projectos.
texts.en:
Lina is 25 years old. She's a farm worker and has two children who haven't reached school age yet. She's married.
With this loan she'll purchase metal sheets, cement, beams and a truckload of sand, and she'll pay the bricklayer so she can continue building her house.
Her plans for the future are to make her marriage official and set up a grocery store in her house in order to increase her family's income.
She states that she'd like to abide by the contract she signed with Hluvuku and apply for more loans again as a way of accomplishing her projects.

loans.use: to purchase metal sheets, cement, beams and a truckload of sand, and to pay the bricklayer so she can continue building her house.

loans.name: Qosimjon

texts.ru:
Косимчон проживает в Гиссарском районе, который является районом республиканского подчинения. Косимчон женат. У него большая семья. Двое сыновей, невестки, дочь и маленький внук. Косимчон молодой дедушка. Он добрый человек. Жена Косимчона портниха. Она вместе с дочерью шьет платья женщинам-клиенткам. 
Косимчон занимается разведения и продажей скота. В этой области ему также помогают его жена и невестка. У Косимчона имеется богатый опыт в этой области. Косимчон раньше работал в частной ферме, где изучил как правильно разводить скот. Он берет кредит для приобретения коровы, коз и корма, чтобы увеличить поголовья скота и построить большой коровник.
texts.en:
Qosimjon lives in the Gissar region.  Qosimjon is married and has a large family: two sons, a daughter, daughters-in-law and a small grandson.  Qosimjon is a young grandfather.  He is a kind man.  Qosimjon's wife works as a seamstress.  Together with her daughter, she sews dresses for her female clients.  

Qosimjon raises and sells livestock.  His wife and his daughter-in-law are helping him with this work.  Qosimjon has a lot of experience in this area.  Previously, Qosimjon worked on a private farm, where he learned how to correctly raise livestock.  He is taking out a loan to purchase a cow, goats, and feed to increase his herd and to build a cowshed.

loans.use: To purchase a cow, goats, and feed to increase his herd and to build a cowshed.

loans.name: Zarina

texts.ru: Зарина сильная женщина. После трагической смерти мужа она начала свой бизнес, так как ей надо обеспечить своих 3 детей. Детям 2, 3 и 5 лет. Зарина 1 год назад начала свой бизнес купле продажей парфюмерия. Она имеем свой магазин. Ее сестра помогает ей по введению бизнеса. На сегодняшний день она введет свой бизнес успешно. Она использует полученный доход для обеспечения своих маленьких детей. Она сделала немного сбережения и начала ремонт дома, так как ее дом имеет плохое состояние. У нее не хватает денег для завершения ремонта. Она запрашивает займ на сумму 10000 сомони для покупки строительных материалов, как цемент, древесина и т.п. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Zarina is a strong woman. After the tragic death of her husband, she started her own business, as she needed to support her three children. The children are 2, 3 and 5 years old. One year ago, Zarina started buying and reselling perfume. She has her own store. Her sister helps her with managing the business. 

Currently Zarina manages her business successfully. She uses the income received to support her small children. She saved up some money and started to repair her house, as it is in a bad shape. She does not have enough money to complete the repair. She requests a loan in the amount of 10,000 somoni for the purchase of building materials, such as cement, wood and similar. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy building materials, such as cement and wood, for repairing her house

loans.name: Inomjon

texts.ru: Иномджон молодой и начитанный молодой человек. Ему 19 лет. Он студент 1 курса Худжандского Государственного Университета. Он учится по специальности Кибернетика. Иномджон отлично учился в средней школе и всегда мечтал поступить в университет и получить высшее образование. Его мечта сбылась, и он данное время является студентом 1 курса. Его родители имеет маленький доход. Его отец таксист, а мать преподаватель. Иномджон должен оплатить за учебный договор. Он запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Inomjon is a young and well-read man. He is 19 years old. He is a first year student at the Khujand State University. He studies cybernetics. 

Inomjon studied well in high school and always dreamed of going to university and get a higher education. His dream came true, and he is currently in his first year. His parents have a small income. His father is a taxi driver and his mother is a teacher. Inomjon needs to pay his tuition. He requests a loan to pay for it. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay his tuition fee

loans.name: Bayan

texts.en: Bayan is 19 years old. She lives with her parents and three brothers in a sector called Marka in Jordan. Bayan is in her 2nd year of studying for a Bachelor of Agriculture degree. She is planning to work in her field after graduation. Her parents are currently facing financial problems and, as a result, they are not able to pay for her study fees. For this reason, she applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her study fees

loans.name: Doris Maritza

texts.es:
Doña Doris es una mujer de 30 años de edad en un estado civil en unión libre y madre de 3 hijos con un grado de educación primaria completa. Ella es agricultora hace 10 años y junto a su compañero de hogar se dedican al cultivo y siembra de café mismo que es comercializado en los alrededores de la zona donde ella habita, con los diferentes compradores, intermediarios y en el mercado local. Ella aprendió dicha actividad en compañía de sus padres y hoy en día lo elabora en compaña de su pareja siendo los únicos 2 involucrados en todas las actividades que realizan en el campo como ser: riego, mantenimiento, limpieza entre otros.

Actualmente ella solicita un financiamiento para la compra de 12 QQ de fertilizante, 10 QQ de formula cafetalera y 12 QQ de urea para dar mantenimiento y asistencia a sus cultivos de café ya que con ello espera que su cosecha mejore y de excelentes resultados.

Sus metas para el futuro son ampliar sus tierras, sembrar una variedad de granos que ayuden al crecimiento de su negocio, a mejorar los ingresos para su familia y sobre todo a generar ingresos para darles a sus hijos una mejor educación, y enviarlos a la universidad.
texts.en:
Doris, 30, is in a common-law marriage and the mother of three children.  She finished elementary school.

Doris has been a farmer for 10 years.  She and her companion earn a living growing coffee, which they sell to different buyers and intermediaries around the area where she lives as well as in the local market.  She learned this job from her parents and currently does it with her partner.  Both of them are involved in all the farming activities such as irrigation, maintenance, weeding, and other tasks.

Currently she's requesting a loan to buy 12 quintals of fertilizer, 10 quintals of coffee formula, and 12 quintals of urea to take care of her coffee crops.  She hopes her harvest will improve and give excellent results.

Doris's goals for the future are to expand her land, plant a variety of grains to help her business grow, improve her income for her family, and, above all, earn income to give her children a better education and send them to college.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам заботливый отец 6 детей. Он живет в сельской местности, где основным источником является земледелие и скотоводство. Рустаму 46 лет, женат на прекрасной женщине. С целью получение дохода более 15 лет он занимается земледелием. Он занимается выращиванием сельхоз культуры, как рис, пшеницу, кукуруза и т.п. Полученный доход он продает на рынке. Так как у него высококачественный урожай, так и его товары имеют большой спрос. Его жена и сын помогают ему в ведении бизнеса. С целью обеспечения семьи со всеми необходимыми средствами он хочет развевать свой бизнес, а для этого он должен получить больше урожая. Он запрашивает займ на сумму   7000 сомони, чтобы купить минеральные удобрения. Доход, который он будет получать от бизнеса, будет использовать для образования своих детей и улучшения условия жизни. Он нуждается и ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Rustam is a caring father of six children.  He lives in the countryside where the main source of income comes from farming and raising livestock.  Rustam is 46 years old and married to a wonderful woman.  For more than 15 years, he has made a living from farming.  He raises crops such as rice, wheat and corn, which he sells at the market.  Since his harvest is of the highest quality, there is always great demand for it.  His wife and his son help him with this business. In order to provide his family with all of the necessities, he wishes to expand his enterprise.  To do so, he needs a larger harvest.  

He is asking for a loan of 7000 somoni to purchase fertilizer.  He is planning to use the income from farming to give his children an education and to improve the quality of life for his family.  He is in need of your help and he is waiting for your kindness.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to grow rice and wheat

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зулфия добросовестная женщина. Ей 38 лет. Она замужем и на воспитании имеет 3 детей. Ее муж Исломджон старается обеспечить свою семью со всеми не обходимыми средствами. Зулфия и ее муж хотят, чтобы их дети получили высшее образование. Их сын поступил  университет. Он поступил в Худжандский Государственный Университет по специальности Веб.-дизайн. Зулфия должна оплатить за учебный договор своего сына, но не имеет денег. Она запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en:
Zulfiya is a conscientious woman. She is 38 years old. She is married and raising three children. Her husband, Islomdjon, tries to support his family with all necessary means. Zulfiya and her husband would like their children to receive higher education. Their son entered the university. He started at the Khujand State University, studying web design. 

Zulfiya needs to pay for her son's tuition, but does not have the money. She requests a loan to pay for it. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for her son's education

loans.name: Asliddin

texts.ru: Аслиддин трудолюбивый и ответственный человек. Ему 40 лет и он из Истаравшана. В этом городе его предки поселились очень давно. Аслиддин живет со своей женой, дочерью и двумя сыновьями. Аслиддин с юных лет разводил скот и любил это ремесло. Он начал бизнес в этой сфере 8 лет тому назад и продолжает куплю-продажу скота до сих пор. Аслиддин в основном выращивает крупнорогатый скот. Он много думает о расширении своего бизнеса и о покупке нового скотного двора. Единственное ограничение для него это финансы. В данный момент вести хозяйство ему помогают супруга и сыновья. Аслиддин не останавливается на достигнутом и продолжает дальше расти и реализовываться. Он просит кредит для закупа 6-голов бычков и телят для увеличения поголовья скота
texts.en:
Asliddin is a hardworking and responsible man. He is 40 years old and from Istaravshan. His ancestors settled in this city a long time ago. Asliddin lives with his wife, daughter and two sons. 

Since childhood, Asliddin bred livestock and loved this work. He started a business in this area eight years ago, and still buys and resells livestock. Asliddin mainly breeds cattle. He thinks a lot about growing his business and about buying new a new barn. His only restriction is finances. Currently his wife and sons help him with the business. 

Asliddin does not stop to progress, and continues to grow his business and earn money. He requests a loan to purchase six bulls and calves to increase the number of cattle.

loans.use: to purchase six bulls and calves to increase the number of cattle

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice works hard to support her family. Janice is married and has a buy-and-sell fish business in the Philippines.

Janice requested a 17,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional fish to sell.

Janice has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Janice would like to save enough money so she will be able to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish to sell

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more stock to sell for her ready-to-wear business.

Jesusa successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Jesusa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 31 years old and married. She has four children who are in school.

Marilou works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock goods like soap, milk, coffee, cream, spices, eggs, and other items.

Marilou has borrowed and repaid three loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from a restaurant.

Marilou aspires to save enough money to afford sending her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock goods like soap, milk, coffee, cream, spices, and eggs.
